Risk Details: Only info provided is that risk is in Lacombe LA and has 6 beehives.
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked additional info about species of bees and whether this is a business. May apply Total Biz Excl or liab surcharge.// Honey bees only. Personal use only - no business. 10% surcharge applied.

Risk Details: This risk is being non-renewed by Lex due to their recent dual access requirement. PPC is a split, agent was asking if that is OK with our new guidelines
Reason(s) for Decision: Declined per updated guidelines, split PCs no longer eligible.

Risk Details: Townhouse in Philly.  The 2112 portion of the townhouse has an archway at ground level that permits cars to pass through to the rear of the property. Besides access for the 2110-2112 Sansom St. home, the archway permits access to parking for several other adjacent homes. The right of access for the other homes is preserved via a Declaration of Easement.  Contained in the easement, there is a stated requirement that the owner of  2110-2112 Sansom St. home endorses as Additional Insureds those property owners onto their Homeowners Liability section.
Reason(s) for Decision: We won't list multiple individuals as addl insureds. Also concern about the phys dmg exposure of multiple cars driving through.  Could possibly rate for that, but other issues we can't do.

Risk Details: Insured had 2 prior fire losses in 4 years.  Both were totals. $350K chimney; $600K+ garage. Score is "P".
Reason(s) for Decision: Low score, 2 fire losses.

Risk Details: Agent provided two applications, one for primary home and one for secondary. They also advised that they may want to quote the applicants condo as well. Applications had the same info across both. 3 losses, 49k hail in 2015, 19k hail/wind 2018 and 6k pipe break 2018.
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised that we could get comfortable with the risk, however, would need correct and complete apps for both properties, along with premium for each. Advised we may consider either a higher deductible or increased surcharge due to losses.

Risk Details: 1940 home completely gutted/updated in 2016. Foundation is pier & beam, no enclosed in brick. Insd purchased in 2017. Has clear inspection.
Reason(s) for Decision: General question, but this does relate to a specific risk.  Advised Ryan of pier & beam issues. We discussed on the phone and he is going to closely review the 2017 inspection and order a 3rd party inspection to make sure no issues.

Risk Details: 1961 home w/2000 roof update. Prior claim for pool damage - closed - $671. WRS 6. Beauty salon in front of house. Separate entrance per sketch. 4 contractors rent chairs. 15 customers/day. No tanning, waxing, nails.
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked for all the business info we need. Also for app, risk meter, older home app. // 5/3/19 MP received info on risk. Separate entrance, 15 customers/day by appointment. Has GL in place-agt confirming liab and phys dmg.  Approved as policy has business excl, prof services excl, adding TBE. There is a separate entrance.

Risk Details: 1920 home in Maine with 19 year old flat roof. Agt making sure the $5K Roof And Ensuing Water Dmg form is okay.
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised partner of UW guidelines for 19 year old roof. Also advised there are other age criteria. Feel free to send app and rater and we can discuss. Felt comfortable addressing the basic question about the roof without requiring a full submission.

Risk Details: Phone call from John wondering if we would consider a primary homeowner with a gun claim where bags were dropped on a bed on top  of the gun and it went off and hit someone.
Reason(s) for Decision: They wanted liability and I noted we would be more comfortable without liability. It is a sign of careless storage of a loaded weapon on top of the bed.

Risk Details: Insured's business has federal lawsuits and charges of human trafficking and money laundering. Numerous articles over the past couple of years. Case still pending.
Reason(s) for Decision: SCU was checking with a very general inquiry with no attachments.

Risk Details: Workshop 200' from home used to service machinery from insured's business.
Reason(s) for Decision: Exclude the workshop and add TBE. Insured has the structure insured under his business policy.

Risk Details: This is a builders risk that will be the insured's primary home when 7 month renovation is completed. Annual policy written. Insured leaving $50K contents there. Some in locked rooms (they have only key) and some in a shipping container in their driveway.
Reason(s) for Decision: If shipping container is locked (only key is w/insured), cant easily be towed away, and contents in it make sense (i.e. furniture, not jewelry and fine arts - which might be a moral hazard).

Risk Details: Home is rented to daughter as her full time residence. Heat source is a non-thermostatically controlled butane gas 3 burner heating unit.
Reason(s) for Decision: Unknown what city in AZ - are there freeze days? If not, we may be able to accept a non-thermostatically controlled heater. If so, we can't write it.  Agent will get more info and submit is she feels it is acceptable.

Risk Details: Insured is on reality show "Million Dollar Listing". We declined primary due to location, can we write his rental?
Reason(s) for Decision: Reviewed w/ Louisa - too famous for liability

Risk Details: Prior $20K loss from smoke/fire caused by dryer. Agent asked for proof, only got loss run with no cause listed. Loss over 4 years ago.
Reason(s) for Decision: Ask for fire marshal report or get confirmation from State Farm of the cause, this is within agent's authority.

Risk Details: Insured is EVP of Mosley Music. Reviewed online info. No news stories.
Reason(s) for Decision: Not too famous

Risk Details: Ground up construction -insured is a roofer and is acting as the GC, hiring all subs. Have we changed our position?
Reason(s) for Decision: Still unable to insure risks where insured is the GC.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Confirmed this is on Bethany's project list.

Risk Details: Property includes primary dwelling and guest cottage rented out via AirBnB. Insured has animals - 2 horses, 4 alpacas, ducks, chickens. Can $10K limited animal liab be added?
Reason(s) for Decision: All personal use? Any interaction by cottage guests? Evaluate and we can decide. Alpacas don't bite per google. Want to make sure this isn't a petting zoo, pony ride exposure for guests.

Risk Details: Insured is asking for an "AI" US Government c/o Forest Service/HO Association.
Reason(s) for Decision: Interest is that they own the land and lease it to the HOA.  Ok to add as additional interest, but not additional insured.

Risk Details: Insured is an actress. Reviewed online info.  She has been in a number of TV series and some movies. Relatively famous.
Reason(s) for Decision: okay excluding liability

Risk Details: Insured wants to write primary with us. They are building a guest house which will be insured separately w/ Scottsdale.
Reason(s) for Decision: COC must have liability. Apply building exclusion for the guest house under construction.

Risk Details: 2 properties on the same street. Agent quoted one as primary one as secondary. Prior loss, insured sued neighbor for playing music too loud. They have since moved out. Insured was reimbursed by Their Own carrier for legal fees.
Reason(s) for Decision: Questioning occupancy.  Once clarified, we can allow a rate quote subj to more info on how the insured's carrier would reimburse them.

Risk Details: Insured has a home on premises w/attached garages. Small office structure at front of property. Runs auto sales business off property. Has a GL. Auto detailing in garage only, no repairs.
Reason(s) for Decision: Add TBE, GL has to stay in place. Advised of limitations of GL with doing car detailing in one of the attached garages.

Risk Details: Retail agent sent paperwork today to bind coverage 3/4/18. They included statement of no losses.  Agent asking if they can go back to 3/4/18 as that is the date the insured's coverage expired.  No explanation of why it was one day late.
Reason(s) for Decision: Ok w/signed statement of no loss

Risk Details: Insured has an open liab claim with $50K in reserves. Policy renewed without liability  3/3/18 w/Lex who is the one handling the claim. Insured did cosmetic reno to whole house w/GC. Never got COC. Sub fell off ladder and is suing the insured. Loss occurred Summer 2016 (almost 2 years) and is still open.
Reason(s) for Decision: Orig app was x-liab. Now that we have info, loss was not really negligence by insured. Open loss can't come back on us. Continuous coverage except liability.

Risk Details: 2001 dwelling, insured moved out, for sale. 8/17 large water loss. 2nd story bath pipe break $90,000 damage. Agt applying $25K deductible. All copper plumbing.
Reason(s) for Decision: Newer home, one loss, even though large, $25K deductible is comfortable for a home that will be vacant.

Risk Details: 2 properties, same LLC,was COC with Zurich, one is 90% done; second is completely done
Reason(s) for Decision: Photos, PC, LLC ? OK, agt included S/C

Risk Details: Risk quoted for closing 2/12/18. Insured signed policy docs on 2/26/18. Then they closed and forgot to notify agent. Closing was 3/7/18. Agt followed up and found out they forgot to notify. Lender will force place if no coverage in place.
Reason(s) for Decision: Appears intent was to book 3/7. Have signed statement of no loss.

Risk Details: Chimney crumbling, roof concerns. Agent asking if we would consider quoting with roof exclusion and existing damage exclusion.
Reason(s) for Decision: Also added water damage exclusion, pending repair or removal of chimney. Insp did not note liab concern w/chimney.

Risk Details: Applicant is possible target. Wanted to check before offering terms
Reason(s) for Decision: Was a member of band, most hits in 70s/80s. Nothing recent no concerns. Confirmed with LT OK to offer w/ liab

Risk Details: Pol cancelled w/Mercury for material misrep. Prior theft claim, alleged the insured provided erroneous receipts to substantiate loss. Insd disagrees. A second loss for fallen tree was declined.
Reason(s) for Decision: Insured is suing for the misrep, another sign we don't want to be in the middle of the issue.

Risk Details: Nice looking home. Insd is a landscaper and has some business storage on premises. Back yard is messy per insp sent.
Reason(s) for Decision: Find out more info on the business. Also, looks like backyard is being re-landscaped. Agt will verify. Looks like a nice house, would be okay with tidying up. Total Business Exclusion could apply.

Risk Details: Insured has primary with us. Policy extended liab to a vacant piece of land. Insured started construction of a duplex on that property in November and is just now looking into getting insurance. BR supplement says work will be completed in May. Unknown how much work is left or if we will retain policy.
Reason(s) for Decision: Will we retain? How much work is left? May consider if we will retain even though close to completion.  Apply adequate s/c to make up for missing out on initial building.

Risk Details: 7 units in Yosemite park. Agent says PC6. Experience w/other risks is that there is 30 min response. Probably brush. Letter provided of excellent fire protection and mitigation.
Reason(s) for Decision: Confirm clearance, confirm PC.

Risk Details: Policy RUA19821-open large water loss
Reason(s) for Decision: $10,000 Water Damage Deductible and surcharged the premium an additional 25% as suggested by agt

Risk Details: Open theft claim from 01/24/2018, almost closed; currently $1200 paid.
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised that can move forward with list from insured that was sent to current carrier with contents that were claimed in loss

Risk Details: Dwelling and guest house on same property. Mom lives in guest house rent free.
Reason(s) for Decision: Write on HO-3. No HO-4 needed for mom. Confirm there are railings on the guest house deck.

Risk Details: Insured has a dwelling, hobby farm and crane business on this property. His workers stay in the dwelling. Can this go on a DP-3?
Reason(s) for Decision: This is a commercial exposure. This isn't residential rental, it's housing for workers and the businesses are on the same property.

Risk Details: Insured's dog got loose and attacked a small dog who was being walked by a woman who fell and hurt her knee. $70K open reserves. Dog is a Husky mix, now kept in back yard.
Reason(s) for Decision: Since this is not a bite, we may not have the protection of the exclusions of the Limited Animal Liab form. Approved with the Animal exclusion.

Risk Details: Dwelling has an attached flat roof garage.  The roof is in poor condition but will be replaced within 60 days of closing.  Agent called back later and advised that the insured will be renting out the large 3 bay garage to a commercial enterprise of some sort, maybe a trucking company. Online photo link in agency file.
Reason(s) for Decision: Attach the roof exclusion but indicate on the dec that it applies to the garage roof only. // With updated info about the business rental, the risk was declined. Advised a commercial policy is more appropriate.// Agent emailed. They have in writing that the insured will not rent out to any businesses.  The garage will only be used by the tenants.

Risk Details: Dwelling suffered a prior mold claim 2.5 years ago.  Mold was professionally remediated.  Mold report includes several recs to prevent future water/mold issues. No info on whether these were addressed. 1969 Dwelling with $5K mold coverage.
Reason(s) for Decision: Although we allow mold covg if mold is prof remediated, it should be confirmed that the recs listed were complied with before any covg is bound.

Risk Details: Dwelling in average condition but has basement covered in mold which agent says is due to not using correct drywall and house was closed up. Insured doing the clean up and replacing roof. Sketchy on what other updates being done other than paint. No GC at this point. Agent is saying "minor cosmetic" which we know is vague.
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised Tamika to find out what the updates are that are being done. If only roof and mold, apply water damage exclusion, roof exclusion, and mold exclusion. We would not require a GC but we would require this work be done by a professional. If more than that, if any kitchens or baths, more than floor and paint, they must have a GC.

Risk Details: roof that is 25%  covered by man-made concrete shingles and  the other 75% is architectural shingles. The home was built in 1932. The address is 4304 State Street Dr New Orleans La 70125.
Reason(s) for Decision: updates confirmed, roof integrity confirmed

Risk Details: fractionally owned units. The condo/villa is part of an HOA community and our insured would have access to the unit for 5 weeks per year. He wants to short term rent it for a few of those weeks when he’s not using the unit.
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised not fit our short-term rental market sign more of a "time-share"

Risk Details: Request to insure 2 rental dwellings including premises liab. Insd is high profile former WA Redskins player. Also in the news for 2015 assault of girlfriend. He will stand trial shortly. Online articles reviewed.
Reason(s) for Decision: Referred to Louisa with rec to decline the risks.  She agreed.  We fully declined due to high profile and the details of the case.

Risk Details: multilocation rental, interested in scheduing on one policy
Reason(s) for Decision: advised can do schedules, as long as system can handle it

Risk Details: a gentleman who is a licensed contractor, well used to be licensed.  He is building his own home along with a pole shed.  However, he does not own the property he is building on and nothing will be in his name until the home is complete, approximately 1 year from now.  At that time, we will be getting a mortgage
Reason(s) for Decision: declined, no insurable interest at this stage and insured is the builder

Risk Details: The insured is buying a Honomobo M1 container home.  It is considered a modular.  https://www.honomobo.com/pagem1/. This company manufactures prefab homes out of shipping containers and hooks them up on site.  It sounds like delivery and crane placement are separate.
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked numerous questions. Per UW Decision Doc, we can consider completed ones. Never had a new COC submitted.  Reviewed details with Jeff May and we approved (8/30/18). Crane exposure is typical in home building. May lose the risk after completion, but that happens in builders risk.

Risk Details: Home is located on Indian Leased Land and the tribe wants to be an AI
Reason(s) for Decision: Generally tribal courts have jurisdiction over this land and individuals who reside on it.

Risk Details: Insured wanted to add previous owner as additional insured as they will be financing the home through them.
Reason(s) for Decision: Since it is the insured asking for the additional insured and they are attesting to the financial interest, I’d be comfortable adding the previous owner as additional insured without any documentation. Additional insured gets their name on any claim checks which seems appropriate.  If it was the previous owner asking to be added, I’d make them prove their interest.

Risk Details: Policy lapsed due to lack of funds. Referred to see if we would approve, with a signed no loss, without a lapse
Reason(s) for Decision: Within guidelines - referral not needed.

Risk Details: Referred because they want to reduce the deductible from $20k for water
Reason(s) for Decision: Confirm full mitigation measures taken since the large loss.

Risk Details: Wanted to know if they could add the property manager as an additional interest.
Reason(s) for Decision: Additional interest is ok for property manager. Additional insured is not. They are good.

Risk Details: Requesting a backdate to avoid a lapse. Asked for more information
Reason(s) for Decision: Need more information about the lapse

Risk Details: Requesting flat cancellation as insured did not take possession of the house
Reason(s) for Decision: Never had the home therefore it was never inforce

Risk Details: Multiple water losses for this insured. Two on the primary home and one on their secondary home. Cheryl is asking to match a lower quote
Reason(s) for Decision: Asking for information about the quote.

Risk Details: Referred due to distance to coast
Reason(s) for Decision: On a barrier island which is ineligible
Do not want to insure home inhabited by minor (and $4M TIV).
These CA hillside homes are typically okay. Advised agent not to make changes, get pics of the piers and we can review if any concern.

Risk Details: Home has a fireplace insert. Agent was not familiar with underwriting them.
Reason(s) for Decision: Professionally installed ok. Advised we need annual cleaning.

Insured Last Name: TBD Agents for Christ Residential Program
Risk Details: The insured’s run a discipleship out of their home for 8 continuous months of the year. Their organization is called Agents for Christ. Participants are usually all adults (over the age of 18) and although it does vary, they average about 4-6 participants per year. The participants live in the home with the insured’s during these 8 months and go through a serious of classes if you will on how to spread the word of God. There are no events so-to-speak. The insured’s do have CGL through Brotherhood Mutual which also includes Sexual Misconduct and Professional Liability.
Reason(s) for Decision: Possibly with TBE if description is accurate. Liability is a maybe. Sounds like low phys dmg exposure if it is as described. Has to be DP3 due to roomer/boarder limits in HO3

Risk Details: New bind request for a risk in Paradise that suffered smoke damage. Agent referred asking if CAT claim had to be surcharged.
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised we are declining due to open loss and that we are reviewing our exposure in the area (per Jeff) may not write in Paradise.

Risk Details: Delta advised inspection revealed primary heat is fireplace insert. She is verifying DNOC is the proper action.
Insured has 2 rentals. Agent asking to place on same property. PC10
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked for more info on PC10 and numerous questions about dwellings to determine if they can go on same policy or if it should be separate.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Numerous emails finally resolved.

Risk Details: Rated as vacant. Insd lives in home 3 months during summer, otherwise out of state. Good precautions (alarm, water off, cameras.) Gardener there weekly. Son checks on weekly. Existing policy.
Janet inquired whether we write log homes and what our underwriting and rating direction is. Discussed in response.
Reason(s) for Decision: Review Cov A;  get manufacturer/builder name; 10% s/c in rater.

Risk Details: Agent applied in Jan 2016 for coverage. We found vague online info, asked questions, and no reply was received. Now retailer wants quote again stating bankruptcy was ch 11, business related, not a concern.
Reason(s) for Decision: Ran insurance score. Insd has 2 bankruptcies: Ch 11 Business in 2010 and Ch 11 Personal in 2015. Advised of decline.

Risk Details: Insured wants to add sinkhole coverage for a home in Bethlehem PA.
Reason(s) for Decision: We do not currently have rates available. Asked if we needed to.

Risk Details: Alison quoted a risk and bind order received for COC. Originally insured stated hiring licensed contractors. At time of bind, advised they were going to be the GC and hire licensed subs. Advised we cannot write the risk.

Risk was in the pipeline of quoting with several others from Beverly Hill. Several hit with bind requests. This is one of them. Agency has exceeded $50M Cap. I ok'd this one being written since it was in the pipeline.
Insureds hound mix bit another person whil hiking w/the owner. Safeco NRN. $50K open claim.
Reason(s) for Decision: Subj to completed and acceptable UW questions on app. Animal liab may apply but need to ensure insured understands the exclusions of the coverage.

Risk Details: DNOC sent after insp showed asbestos siding. Turns out it was on the app and missed. Danielle has addressed with UW. Agent wants DNOC lifted and NRN sent later. 15% asbestos. No cracking/crumbling. Okay condition.
Insured is having home renovated by a licensed/insured contractor but there is not specifically a "GC".
Reason(s) for Decision: Subs are not always needed. As long as person in charge is a contractor (and it is not the insured), we are okay.

Risk Details: Insured wants to rent out their home for the PGA for 2 weeks. They have an admitted policy in force. Any options.
Reason(s) for Decision: Provided some input about occupancy, duplicate policies, options the admitted carrier could consider and offered to continue discussions.

Risk Details: Inspection showed and described what looked like a common walkway and pool gate on the insured's property.  Further investigation revealed this is not the case. This is insured's walkway only, and door in their yard is used by them to get to the pool entrance.
Home closing was on 1/10/17. Agency just advised of bind request (mortgage fault).
Reason(s) for Decision: Need no loss letter.

Risk Details: Renewal - inspection just now being reviewed. Woodstove is primary and only heat; 18" clearance to side unprotected wall.
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised agt to nonrenew.

Risk Details: Insured has electrolysis business in basement of home. Has a business but that is moving out. She will retain some clients and service at the home. Will have a commercial policy.
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised we would need to see the whole risk, but would exclude liability (due to relation to medical field) and add Total Business Excl. Explained implications of the form.

Risk Details: FIRST BIND REQUEST FOR NC X-WIND. Insured is the bookkeeper for her husband's Paws of Carteret business. No animals. No foot traffic.
Reason(s) for Decision: Ensure no employees - this exposure is fine.

Risk Details: 1910 home completely redone in 2006 after Katrina. Home was on registry when insd bought it. He never removed. No tours. Home all standard construction.
Reason(s) for Decision: Include MFRC

Risk Details: Agent asking to write a ground up construction starting with demolition. Typically this is a class we decline.
Reason(s) for Decision: Reviewed HO-3. Some addl coverage still apply like FD and Trees/shrubs etc.

Risk Details: Insured completed pet questionnaire and indicated their dog bit their child. Agent asking if animal liab will apply.
Reason(s) for Decision: Risk acceptable, but excl on limited animal liab form will probably cause exclusion of dog due to prior bite.

Risk Details: Insured has open liab claim for dog bit. Trespasser came into fenced area. Chained dog bit them. Dog has been euthanized. Claim still open.
Reason(s) for Decision: Liab and Animal liab okay.

Risk Details: Insured purchasing a 2001 built home where all construction is not completed. Alex writing as an owner occupied HO3 excluding the pool, including personal liab as home is occupied.`
Builders risk in name of LLC. Member of LLC is acting as GC - lic and insd.
Unfinished exterior bathroom walls and interior not completed. Insured ran out of money.
Reason(s) for Decision: Exterior photo doesn't look weather/element-proof enough. Otherwise could consider with app. (Run insurance score). Came to us with very little info just to check.

Risk Details: Insured owns this rental home and rents it for residential use. Also has an equipment company on the property.  Construction & machinery equip. Shared driveway. Separation per aerial photo.
Reason(s) for Decision: Exclude roof - 27 years old.  Total Business Excl.

Risk Details: Home is 2 separate parcels across street from each other. Lot has a garage. Also there is a dock on main property.
Reason(s) for Decision: All checks out. Info in file. No rental.

Risk Details: 40 year old tile roof. Avg condition per insp. Okay? Exclude next year?
Reason(s) for Decision: Exclude next year, or issue now with ACV, reinspect in 3 years and exclude if not replaced.

Risk Details: Dwellings used to house those recently released from prison and/or ex-military.
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked addl questions to assess opportunity.

Risk Details: Director of Glass House Inc owns several dwellings, buying more. Transitional housing for homeless, vets, x-rehab, x-jail families and individuals.
Reason(s) for Decision: DP-1 w/no liability was the suggestion with other questions before terms could be approved.

Risk Details: Mother owns home in name of trust. Renting to daughter. DP3/HO4. Daughter wants to be Addl Insd on DP3. No contract in place.
Reason(s) for Decision: Agreed w/ Delta-with no contract pol is written right; daughter cant be AI, can be additional interest only (notification)

Risk Details: Bobbi quoted a risk 1/27/2017 which had fuses, but upgraded to C/B. She gave Markel and Lex quote. By mistake, agent asked for Lex to be bound. Just realizing it. Wondered if we could go back to 1/27/17 to fulfill intent.
Reason(s) for Decision: I advised to fulfill MEP w/ Lex and then switch to us.

Risk Details: Insured requesting to add 3rd mortgagee. Agent asking if they have to cancel or nonrenew.
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked numerous questions to evaluate. Ins score decent. Ok by Louisa.

Risk Details: In ground trampoline. Anything additional than the trampoline exclusion?
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised of hazards and said excl is adequate.

Risk Details: Insured has a 2014 animal loss - horse got out on road and caused collision. $2716. Agent wants to offer $10K or $25K liab for top agent as an exception.
Reason(s) for Decision:
• How many horses and goats?
• Please confirm no breeding, boarding, or riding lessons.
• Are the horses kept in a fenced area?
• What kind of fence?
• With the loss that occurred, did the horse get out of their fenced area?  Was there a problem with the fence?  

Received answers - in file. sounds secure enough to offer $10K animal liab.

Risk Details: We have been on this risk for 1 year. Agent wants to extend 3 months.
Insured has Doberman that recently bit mailman. $25K reserve still open.
Reason(s) for Decision: Could consider w/full submission. Could exclude the dog or add Ltd Animal Liab since dog is double excluded.

Risk Details: 4/16 $48K water backup (roots in drain); 2/22/17 $0 closed/denied - rain damage to paperwork (insd writing a book).
Reason(s) for Decision: Agent adding $10k water dmg ded. Sent email confirming.

Risk Details: 6 rental homes where rent is partially subsidized. 6 LLC's own the properties.  All are updated.
Reason(s) for Decision: Reviewed online photos. Found below avg condition and neighboring homes/properties boarded up.

Risk Details: Agent looking to match last years premium on this 1790 home in Charleston.
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked for CQ questions and details on exact premiums.

Risk Details: New Chapter 11 bankruptcy. Does it make a diff that it is Ch 11 or that it is just husband.
Reason(s) for Decision: New is a concern. Still a family concern.

Risk Details: Is pex plumbing okay?
Reason(s) for Decision: We have no criteria. There have been some issues, but nothing major like polybutylene.

Risk Details: Aunt is primary occupant, although not sure if that is permanent. Insured may visit on weekends.
Reason(s) for Decision: Write as secondary w/rental. Aunt is relative per insured definition. Since unsure of how permanent this situation is, this seems safest way to write.

Risk Details: Primary home insured w/Safeco excluding rental cottage, rented via Air BnB. Has a "1/2" address, but on same property.
Reason(s) for Decision: Suggest to find out if liab is excluded or only the dwelling. Agent will approve X-Liab until they prove liab is excluded. 3/22 provided-approved.  At the time of loss, claims will have to evaluate the legal address of 428 ½ to determine if this is a separate location.  They may also have to evaluate any injured parties connection to the insured or the tenant

Risk Details: 1906 home updated and abated of lead. During process, insd filed Ch 13 bankruptcy due to expense of abatement. (Insd is an attorney). Online photos show old row house.
Reason(s) for Decision: Check for firewalls and condition of row. Run ins score. Verify lead abatement.

Risk Details: Insured has a seasonal home rented thru VRBO. They leave canoe and kayaks for tenants use. Is this covered
Reason(s) for Decision: No exclusion under HO-3.

Risk Details: Insd has 5 sheep and a mule. Wanted to add animal liab.
Reason(s) for Decision: $10K animal liab ok

Risk Details: TIV: 3,782,000. 1991 build year, no claims, Lex renewal that is now competitive with Markel since primary home (prior was COC), inspection included to confirm Coverage A value, $10K water ded due to flat roof.
Reason(s) for Decision: granted approval to release terms. Home has central burglar/fire, and $10K ded per rater. Cov C is only $500K, a little low for the size of the home. So advised to let us know should they decide to increase and it pushes TIV over $4MIL. Per Google, applicant owns a jewelry/clothes boutique in Beverly Hills.

Risk Details: Current policy-MAXH13100005275. renewal customer. Attached inspection-missing railing on one set of steps, not back at property until June and able to fix then
Reason(s) for Decision: Granted approval to handle in June. Insured since 2011, and this is a very nice property

Risk Details: Returned to Danielle. 1923 home updated in 1988.
Reason(s) for Decision: Danielle reviewing possible backend procedure.

Risk Details: Insured has an in home doggie daycare.
Reason(s) for Decision: Submit with app and answers to business questions. Provided copy of Total Business Excl and Animal exclusion would apply. Advised of TBE limitations.

Risk Details: Home in name of LLC formed for family children and grandchildren for rental properties.
Home in name of LLC formed for family children and grandchildren for rental properties.

Insd had a couple of small losses at other rental locations. No surcharge per our discussion as they were minor. Did have a $0 Fire at our location. Last year wildfire left ash deposits on insd property. They called in to have it cleaned up not realizing the policy didn't pay for that. Denied-$0 paid. Brush surcharge and additional surcharge for location applied.

3 family home for investor who they write a lot of business for. Needs to be bound today. Vacant reno with a lot of work to do. Quoted Friday, found out today that there is no GC - the insured is hiring all the subs.
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised we will be working on a program but it's not ready yet, and we can't make individual exceptions without doing all the research.

Risk Details: New inspection for home where insured has been moved to assisted living. Family does not want to repair damaged porch decking or sidewalk.
Reason(s) for Decision: Remove liability asap. Can be added back if porch is repaired. Okay to leave sidewalk.

Risk Details: Insured will have $315K of consignment paintings in her home and needs insurance.
Reason(s) for Decision: Provided flyer for Jamie Gregory=Markel Specialty. Tried contacting him and his boss - neither are online.

Risk Details: Insured is owner of CAL Framing, a general contracting company. Would we allow them to be the GC to build his house?
Reason(s) for Decision: Discussed w/Louisa. Still too close to home.

Risk Details: 3 tiny houses used as vacation rental in Utah.
Reason(s) for Decision: Not our market.

Risk Details: Insured had a "huge fire" at prior location in Baltimore MD.
Reason(s) for Decision: Need fire marshall report or comparable. Left VM for Tamika.

Risk Details: 4 family members own a seasonal home together. Stuart Frye wants out and filed a lawsuit a couple of months ago. He wants to be bought out or have the home sold.
Reason(s) for Decision: Reviewed w/Louisa. Ran ins scores on all.  747,855 and 997. Stuart says not enough info to score, and he is listed as retired. We agreed if scores were okay, we would do it.

Risk Details: Completed log questionnaire indicates name of builder and years experience are unknown. We reviewed photos and details of the home online and it looks like a custom home. 2007 build. Great condition.
Agent not currently authorized in TX but wants us to consider a one-off policy.
Reason(s) for Decision: Reviewed w/Jeff. No one offs, need to put a program together.

Risk Details: Daughter owns home, mother lives in it, daughter visits. Mother had a wrongful eviction claim at different location 2 years ago 6/15/15 $0 paid.
Reason(s) for Decision: Surcharge for loss. Get details so we have a comfort level with the mother. Info received and approved. Declined to offer PI due to prior loss.

Risk Details: Insured had prior water loss 7/12 $10K - roof leak. Has a flat roof. $10K ded applied. Roof replaced. Then had fire loss in 2015. Part of roof was being repaired and subcontractors torch caught the house on fire. Subro against GC.
Reason(s) for Decision: Need statement from carrier who insured the home for the 2015 loss to confirm cause and subro. Still charge for the loss.

Risk Details: Builders risk written and it turns out it is to cover the home being raised. Can't tell if it was moved here from another property, or just raised here. Provided direction for both possibilities.
Reason(s) for Decision: Moved from another loc - rescind or cancel. Raised here - okay, check GC has $1M coverage.

Risk Details: Originally bound 3/16/17. Covg lapsed 2/28. Person handling file in retailers office left the company and this was left unhandled. Hull and the retailer bound 3/16. Now lender is coming back with a force placed policy for lapse time. Agent requested backdate to 2/28 w/signed no loss.
Reason(s) for Decision: Discussed w/ Louisa. If they had called on 3/16, we probably would have helped out with less concern. Advised of this, but approved the request.

Risk Details: Insured is TV and movie actor.
Reason(s) for Decision: Refer to Jeff. No adverse news or concern. Mostly TV actor. Agreed to do WITH liability.

Risk Details: Insured is allowing their friend to rent a part of their property to park their tiny house.
Reason(s) for Decision: Reviewed HO3 and Total Business Excl. No exclusions found. Not extreme enough to exclude liab. Addl surcharge is in order.

Risk Details: Insd is in escrow and desires only 1 more month 'til it closes vs. normal 3 month 100% earned.
Reason(s) for Decision: If they can do it in their system, ok. If it goes over a month, revert back to normal rules.

Risk Details: Vacant renewal which renews tomorrow 4/28. Agent JUST found out it is under extensive reno. Insured is acting as GC hiring many subs. Occupancy in 4 weeks - confident it will be done. Lloyds isn't helpful in PA. Have to get something done today (late in the day).
Reason(s) for Decision: Agreed to help out as an exception, offer terms for property only with liability excluded (old guidelines)

Risk Details: Referred her to Markel Marine per details in our ES UW Direction document.
2 unit structure, 1 occupied, 1 vacant. How should this be rated.
Reason(s) for Decision: Questions to agent: current dec, verify-is it a 2 unit rental. How long vacant? What are the plans. May need to come up with a "blended" rate in between occupied and vacant depending on answers. May need to check coverage to see how vacant limitations apply to a 2 unit structure.//5/3/17 found online reference to this address being a bar. Photo looks like 2 story. Confused on what we are insuring. Email to agent.

Risk Details: Agnt writing a primary home that shares a property with a manufactured home that is rented out by the insured.
Reason(s) for Decision: Agent will exclude the mfg home and gather proof of insurance to ensure liability is in place.  Agent later called back saying mfg home was assembled on site and bolted to a permanent foundation. I advised unless it is MODULAR, we would not be able to do it.  Mobile/mfg homes can be "assembled" onsite (doublewide-2 sides) and they can have a perm foundation.

Risk Details: Insured is buying and renovating a duplex. 1st floor is unit 1, 2nd floor is unit 2. Anything unusual?
Reason(s) for Decision: Basically a 2 family, just unique configuration.

Risk Details: vacant condo, wants to do DP3 for about $850K coverage A
Reason(s) for Decision: Discussing with Melissa

Risk Details: Inspection revealed a business on the property in a separate structure. Business hires out electrical contractors. Insd daughter works with him + 2 other employees. No foot traffic. GL/Prop covg in place for business. Agent wishes to quote w/Total Business Exclusion and exclude Oth Str.
Husband passed away - his name is on deed - wife still lives in home. Can we write coverage?
Reason(s) for Decision: She is a named insured. Yes, we can write an owner occupied HO3.

Risk Details: High valued secondary with large prior fire loss. Insured hired a contractor to do work. They started a fire with a space heater. Repairs complete. Not sure on subro. Seacoast coming in at $4700 w/tax/fees. Markel at $4817 w/ no charge yet for loss.
Reason(s) for Decision: Tamika getting fire report. If 100% subro, we could consider not charging. Need prior carrier. No reduction in rate.

Risk Details: Agent asking if they can modify minimum earned requirements to 60%.
Reason(s) for Decision: VIP client and trying to foster agent relationship.

Risk Details: 1974 cabin updated in 2005. Home is winterized and never used in winter. Checked temperatures for area (AZ). Non-winter months never have freezing temps. Insured says stove is rarely used.
Reason(s) for Decision: Subj to rating as PC9 (confusion on what it really was-all documentation had a different PC); also acceptable WBS quest.
Audit Notes: Check WBS quest. Make sure issued at PC9.  No policy on file 7.31.17

Risk Details: There was confusion at retail office and agent accidentally deleted an email from his associates in box so they missed the bind request.  5/11/17 request to go back to 5/8/17 with SNL.

Risk in corp name for tax purposes. The insured leases home back from corp and lives there as their primary. Agent wants to give this more of an HO3 rate (agree). Adding the rental endorsement. Issuing w/premises liab only. Insured will have their own HO4.`
Non-floating home extended over water.  Newer roof. Condition a little rough, may just need paint.
Reason(s) for Decision: Make sure updates are good. Order EHP to get eyes inside.

Risk Details: Is dock away from premises covered?
Reason(s) for Decision: Close to a mile away and owned/used by another cabin owner. Advised we are not comfortable amending address to include - too far away and less control over who would use it.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Note - policy was already issued. This just clarified we wouldn't cover the dock.

Risk Details: Alia asking about insuring an HO4 for a client with a pit bull that is certified as a service dog.
Reason(s) for Decision: Sent list of questions and info needed to review.

Risk Details: Policy was cancelled due to repairs not made after inspection found issues. Insured has now repaired. Pol cancelled 5/2. Proof attached of repairs. Can agt reinstate.
Reason(s) for Decision: Charity said original insp was attached - I can't tell. Advised we could RW w/lapse unless there is a lien and there can't be a gap. Need signed statement.

Risk Details: COC is almost complete, contents moving in. Interior cleanup, roof and railings still needed. Can they switch to secondary?
Reason(s) for Decision: More info needed.

Risk Details: Polycomp Trust is a self-directed IRA.
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised if Alex wants to pursue further I can send to claims.

Risk Details: Policy is renewing. Insured needs 30 more days to provide proof of repairs.
Reason(s) for Decision: This is a seasonal. This is a good agent. Insd needs more time to get the proof. Repairs are done.

Risk Details: Insured is buying home but will rent it out for 2-3 months before moving in. Okay to write as HO3 w/ higher rate for the rental.
Insured purchasing home now. Will be vacant until July or August, then renovation, then move in.  Can we write an HO3 COC. May be vacant for >60 days.
Reason(s) for Decision: If it gets near 60 days call us and we will evaluate a possible extension of time for the 60 day restriction not to apply. Advised an alarm system may help. Likely it will be a short time like 10 days. Insd has to be in home by 9/1.

Risk Details: Can they offer Personal Injury on a home that is not owner/primary.
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised we typically do not.  They should look to their primary.

Risk Details: We wrote a COC that the insured intended to move into. Now they have decided to sell and move after construction. They need 1 month more to finish, policy expires in 1 week.
Reason(s) for Decision: Very good agent for Alex. Agreed to offer options of 3 month fully earned or 1 month w/15% surcharge on annualized premium.

Risk Details: Nonrenewed 6/18/17 due to 2 years vacant. Insd needs 30 days additional to complete sale.
Reason(s) for Decision: 20% s/c on pro-rated premium. 30 day fully earned.

Risk Details: Agent wants to know if we can add EQ to this policy?  (Not part of program)
Reason(s) for Decision: Not creating rates for 1. We can if there is a market. (Discussed w/Jeff)

Risk Details: Are horizontal balusters okay? Photo shows what appears to be no more than 4" apart.
Insured has a 1600' barn which is rented to their caretaker who oversees seasonal property for reduced rent.
Reason(s) for Decision: Agent will rate as 2 family, str rented to others, secondary 20+ rental rate.

Risk Details: NCRUA014304 construction will be done 2 months after expiration, needs extension.
Reason(s) for Decision: Profitable and good account.Pro-rate renewal prem +10%. 100% earned.

Risk Details: Issue with agents mail delivery. Pol renewed 5/31. Insd mailed payment 5/24.
Reason(s) for Decision: Ok w/ signed no loss letter.

Risk Details: Agency mis-typed eff date as 6/8, should have been 6/3.
Reason(s) for Decision: No signed no loss letter required since agency error.

Risk Details: Letters included asking for change from PC9 to 4.
Reason(s) for Decision: Additional info needed.

Risk Details: Roof is new. We don't have revised guidelines yet but I have been offering $5K water ded if roof replaced in last 10 years.
Reason(s) for Decision: $5K ded. Very nice neighborhood per Tamika.

Risk Details: Rear wall behind home has steps on it with inadequate railing. Historic section built by Army Corps of Engineers
Reason(s) for Decision: Remove non-historic steps, or put an adequate barrier and sign to deter access.// 6/21 reviewed photo and asked for more photos.

Risk Details: Insured has the loan for the property split up between 3 different IRA's who hold different portions of ownership.
Reason(s) for Decision: This looks like financial management vs. financial crisis.

Risk Details: Estate sale being held at this property for 3 days. Company running the sale has liab ins.
Reason(s) for Decision: Nothing in pol language that excludes coverage.

Risk Details: 2016 home w/ metal roof. Agent says 2006 flat roof. Clarified it is 2016. Insp says flat.
Reason(s) for Decision: $5K ded approved - looks like very nice home!

Risk Details: Can ID Fraud be added to a Builders Risk?
Reason(s) for Decision: This is more personal than risk related. Don't see a reason not to add.

Risk Details: Insured received a 1 month extension from us past 1 year. They recently were getting ready to get occupancy permit and the sprinklers malfunctioned causing a flood loss to 2 of 3 floors. GC is going after sub for damage and system repair. Need additional time.
Reason(s) for Decision: Issue 1 year term eff 7/2/17 with ability to pro-rate cancellation.

Risk Details: Family left home to adult child in name of trust.  Individual is disabled. Brother of individual has trust in his name and he is caretaker for home. Okay to write HO-3.
Reason(s) for Decision: Owner occupied situation. Home taken care of by family member.

Risk Details: New flat roof. Can we go with $5K ded?
Reason(s) for Decision: Home for sale. Photo in file. Very nice. Brand new renovation - new roof.

Risk Details: Risk has a diving board per inspection. Agent wants to know if there is a pool exclusion.
Reason(s) for Decision: Must send cancellation unless diving board can be removed.  No pool excl and can't exclude liab.

Risk Details: Insured has a signmaking business next door to primary dwelling. Separate address, GL. There is a front room in his dwelling that he uses as a mini showroom. 5 customers a week on average. Insd doesn't know if GL extends.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved X-liability.  Don't see need to add Total Business Exclusion because there really isn't a physical damage exposure with the public traffic.

Risk Details: Vacant land with no house, COC ground up. Area will be fenced during construction. Insured has grapefruit and avocado on property. Someone rents this from them and picks it. They have a GL with insured as addl insured. No liab - it is extended from their current primary. Will add total business exclusion.
Insured is living in home during renovation and wants CPL and med pay. There is an exposure w/the workers.
Reason(s) for Decision: We should go after Workers Comp is there is an injury. Insured living in their home needs this coverage.  Med Pay is limited to $5000 even if it did come back on us. Okay with the standard coverages.

Risk Details: There was a PAF loss at prior property.  PAF is on a stand alone policy. They believe babysitter took jewelry - 2016 mysterious disappearance loss. Should this be charged?
Reason(s) for Decision: Yes. It is a reflection on the insured's history and should be charged.

Risk Details: We approved risk w/lapse 6 weeks ago.  Coverage was not pursued and now they want to bind.
Reason(s) for Decision: Told Craig if there is a good story we can consider. Otherwise we wish to pass.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Discussed w/Tim

Risk Details: Insured is living in a motor home on the 20 acre property during construction. Do we have any concern with premises liability. Ground up construction of home at the front, motor home is at the back.
Insured building ground up COC. No address yet - it is Lot 49. In gated community. Mail going to neighbor. Insd lives in China.
Reason(s) for Decision: subject to confirmation that responding FD can find the location.

Risk Details: Agent inquiring about $25K AOP deductible. Wants to save $.
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised agent it reaches a point of diminishing returns where we can only give a few points for $10K to $25K AOP. If they really want, let me know and I will work w/Bethany on a number.

Risk Details: Insured is a doctor in the process of retiring. This risk was written as a vacant dwelling, but it is actually used as his medical practice with 3-4 patients per week, no residential use other than he eats lunch there on the day(s) he sees patients. Agent non-renewed. Retailer wants to know how we can stay on it. Tamika did refer this commercially, they reached out but agent has not replied there. Trying to keep this policy.
Reason(s) for Decision: Risk is not being used as a dwelling. It is commercial medical office. Should be insured commercially.

Risk Details: Agent found out from inspection that duplex is half rented, half under reno. Can they write DP3 coverage needed for the side that is rented?
Small homeowners which agent found online is renting individual rooms. Turns out it is to 6 individuals. Agent wants to decline.
1970 home with roof exclusion. Renewal coming up. Roof is metal tile and per inspection looks like in good condition. Agent wants to add covg back for roof.
Reason(s) for Decision: If we get a roofer statement, can consider adding ACV roof.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Statement rec'd. 5-10 years left. Gave Ok for ACV, advised be sure insured aware needs to replace w/in that time frame. K.Burdine

Risk Details: NI is 4 individuals acting together to purchase, reno and sell.  They individually own other houses as well.  This is not a conglomerate.  Okay to keep on PL?

Since inception and for 2 renewals, the policy has not had the cosmetic hail form. Jill just caught it. Asking her to look into what happened at branch or SRD. System ok now? Everyone on board w/applying? She is asking if we have to add it or can we continue without.
Reason(s) for Decision: Remove 7.455 credit to get back to square one, then apply a 3% surcharge. This gets to about 10.5 surcharge. Hailscore is 1, so okay to proceed with surchage in place of form. Very nice overall log style home.

Risk Details: Insured has an off premises retail store and stores antique items (inventory) in her barn on premises.  Property is insured elsewhere, needs barn coverage.
Reason(s) for Decision: Full submission coming. Policy itself covers this. Add Total Business Excl.

Risk Details: Agent reviewing for renewal terms and wanted claim detail and advice on how to proceed.
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised ok if occupied. If for sale, vacant or still builders risk, would not offer renewal terms. $41K loss 9/16 for VMM at dwelling.

Risk Details: Agent has a triplex which has turned out to be 3 separate units w/3 separate addresses. Discussed writing as 3 separate DP policies w/liability charge for each.
Agent inquiring about whether a CA risk is ground up or renovation. One wall is being left.
Reason(s) for Decision: Watch out for demolition! We could write after it is done.

Risk Details: Request to apply lower deductible to partial flat roof updated in 2010.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved if truly replaced. $2,500 ded and 10% s/c or $5,000 ded.

Risk Details: Home has steps with no railing. Wall on one side, dirt bank on the other.

It is renewing 7/28 with Lex, however, Lex has removed Sect. II liability due to a claim. The loss date was 3/1/2011 for insider trading. The underwriter provided the following description:
 
“The SEC filed suit against our insured for insider trading; our insured misappropriated information from a friend that GSI Commerce would be acquired by Ebay; suit alleges insured traded while inn possession of this information”
 
The claim was denied by AIG on 8/16/2016.
Reason(s) for Decision: When integrity is questioned I don't feel comfortable writing the risk at all.

Risk Details: Insured buying 2 homes on same property and inheriting a tenant whose rent is calculated into the sale. Should this be 1 policy or 2? How are loss of rents covered?
Reason(s) for Decision: May be renovating within a year. Unknown since this is new. Decided best long term decision is 2 separate policies. Provided policy language re loss of rents.

Risk Details: Policy coming up for 3rd term. 6 months left to go on builders risk. Interior work left.
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked agt why the delay. If no issues, just a long time, add 10%. If concern, refer back.

Risk Details: 1922 home updated, good condition except some roof damage which is in the process of being repaired -excluding until done - contractor scheduled for tomorrow. There is an 80 year old tree growing through deck and near house. They have maintained it. Can we write?
Reason(s) for Decision: Retain an arborist to confirm safety of tree and that growth won't damage deck or home. Determine growth rate for long term assurance.//8/21 received arborist report. Tree needs to be removed.//8/22 Can they have more than 30 days - yes since they are wokring on it.

Risk Details: Risk bound in April. Insured went to Alaska in mid-May for 3 months, known trip. Insp co wasted time scheduling and now can't do interior insp. Neighbor can't be reached. Retailer is difficult, but insured is innocent in this.1975 home w/07 updates, all pex plumbing. Can we stay on until 9/15 inspection.
Reason(s) for Decision: Okay to wait, already past 30 days. If any issues or if insured doesn't cooperate w/9/15 insp, send mid-term cancellation

Risk Details: Inspection noted siding repair was needed. Insured has contracted with someone but it will take 30-45 days to complete. Copy of contract received. Other repair completed nicely.
Insd has 2 open water claims w/Kemper and has hired a public adjuster. He is suing Kemper. Pipe and AC leakage. Not all damage repaired
Reason(s) for Decision: Insured is suing his own co and hasn't made repairs since Jan 2017.

System Reason(s) for Referral: Bike/bicycle and kayak on rental property
Risk Details: Is there coverage?  Referred back to Burns policy from 3/24/17 for answers.
1950 home partially updated. Home has "cast iron plumbing 10%". We assume it is drain lines, but not sure.
Reason(s) for Decision: Okay if it is drain lines. If supply lines, it is a concern. Insd willing to get licensed plumber to inspect. Kirk will proceed with that.

Risk Details: Insd filed chapter 11 and wants Govt AI name added. Approval attached is for a different insured. Can't find an approval in file.
Reason(s) for Decision: Need to check app to see how bankruptcy quest was answered. Run ins score and check date. //8/8 addl info requested. //8/10 asked agt to mid term cancel or nonrenew to get us off this risk as quickly as legally possible due to concern w/financial condition. Refused to add AI (sometimes this causes risk to move)
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Husband's score 762, no bankruptcy. Lots of large and dismissed debt. Wife's score is 729 w/ recent business bankruptcy. $90K judgements. Much dismissed debt. (yes, 62 min is correct as of 8/10)

Risk Details: Policy originally issued in 2016. Burns sent DNOC for inadequate clearance. They provided photos from agent and note from insured saying they cleared to 100'. Advised this was not adequate.  Agent now asking to offer renewal terms.
Reason(s) for Decision: What addl info was received that proved adequate clearance? No new info is in the file sent after my declination on 12/2.//8/9 Leslie pointed out this is not a brush zone. Advised DNOC should not have been issued.  Okay to renew.

Risk Details: Insured sets up a large model railroad in yard 2-3X year w/buildings. Advertises to churches, sr center, neighbors, children. Juice & cookies served. Sign-in, helpers.
Reason(s) for Decision: Insured must get an event policy for each event. Referred to Jamie Gregory for possible schedule of the railroad.

Risk Details: 1960 home updated in 2001. Home has flat roof. Nice condition. Comp roll. Agreed to allow $5000 full water damage ded as this was how it was originally issued. Agt didn't know of flat roof and they missed fixing the ded when the insp came in.
Reason(s) for Decision: Roof guidelines still under discussion.

Risk Details: Two homes on the same property. How to insure?
Reason(s) for Decision:
We’ve handled this situation a couple of different ways.  We prefer not to add the two Cov A’s together as we feel it could really create confusion at claim time.  You can:
• Switch the homes around – insure the higher valued one under Cov A and the lower under Cov B
• Write two separate policies, one for each home

Risk Details: Inspection showed brush issue. Insured provided clearance photos. Agt asking for 2nd opinion if I think it is acceptable.
Reason(s) for Decision: Appear insufficient. Provided extensive Cal Fire forms and info to support clearance requirements.

Risk Details: three properties, short term rentals, agent that Nichole is trying to grow, one PCQ provided -10-20 response time
Reason(s) for Decision: Requested separate PCQs if able; also advised if purely rental, no owner occupancy at any point through year, need to be rated as a rental. Advised prefer 15 min response time, but after reviewing new PCQ may be considered w/ appropriate surcharge; advised would need LLC questionnaire if we continue
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: approved w/ condition: acceptable LLC quest; will quote as rental, will surcharge 20% for each property at 20 min response time; separate PCQ or indication on the 1 which addresses it applies to

Risk Details: insured needs builders risk, just received home back from settlement w/ex-wife, and property wasn't well cared for. Renovations include: painting, windows, roof, floors. No walls. Home is accessible year round. Inspection was attached. No losses, CS alarm, premium $14,816. No GC as types of work easily subbed out
Reason(s) for Decision: Confirmed with LT that OK with BR instead of vacant, even though no GC being used. OK w/ premium and inspection reviewed

Risk Details: Insured has purchased a dwelling in his business name. He and other employees stay here when they are doing solar panel jobs in the area.
Reason(s) for Decision: No business use, average # of employees (no more than expected on STR risk). Residential only.

Risk Details: Agent wants to add $200,000 schedule of shoes worn one time for promotions and then displayed around his condo.  This was referred and approved by Markel Specialty. // 8/23 found out condo will be under construction. Checked on regularly.
Reason(s) for Decision: Provided referral info to Markel Specialty.

Risk Details: Shipping container on fenced/secured vacant lot. Would this be other structures?
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked addl questions to determine if this was other structure on HO-3 or as a DP-1 stand alone; Could consider.

Risk Details: 1970 home w/aluminum wiring. Insured purchasing 9/20. Electrician is pigtailing copper wire.
Reason(s) for Decision: Reviewed https://www.cpsc.gov/s3fs-public/516.pdf and declined to agent.

Risk Details: Alex was inquiring about scheduling a $3,000 bicycle that a 7th grader rides to school. It is locked in a bike rack with other bikes and left outside. Lex and Lloyds will write. He said a $75-$100 rate would be okay.
Reason(s) for Decision: Discussed w/Jeff & Louisa and they agreed we are not interested.

Risk Details: 1970 dwelling w/"floor heat". No info on what this means. 50 years old original.
Reason(s) for Decision: If this is in cement elec floor heat, should be okay. Suggest heat contractor inspection due to age. If other, let me know.//8/30 turns out to be gas heater in the floor, radiates throughout house. Inspected today by hvac contractor and all is in good condn.

Risk Details: Insured's daughter keeps her horse at grandparents house. She is only rider. Goes to rodeo once a month.
Reason(s) for Decision: We can write the risk if there are no other issues but it does not appear the animal liab form extends liab to an insured animal in someone elses control.

Risk Details: Insured is referring to their home as manufactured. Agent shared photos and online reference. Reviewed neighborhood and other homes. Does not at all appear to be manufactured. Maybe modular. Agent will proceed and have inspector check carefully.
Reason(s) for Decision: Inspector carefully check.  Looks like a site built home in and out. All online sources refer to it as site built.

Risk Details: Owner occupied renovation w/several months left. Insured moving in now. Any rate relief since insured is going to be living there and reno is not extensive?  1910 risk was gutted to studs in 1995. Due to open loss, agent changed mind about rate credit originally requested. Claim due to clogged/dripping sink on 2nd floor. $33K reserve.
Reason(s) for Decision: Tear out from water loss 100% complete and under repair. No undiscovered damage. Insd bought home appx 1 year ago and it has been under reno since. Online pics and info are okay and confirm this.  Applied addl 10% for tail end construction.//Alex called back. He thought I understood the construction situation. He had already revealed an indication without the addl 10% s/c. Pondered and felt we could do it at the quoted rate. It is owner occupied and rebuilt.  .22 rate and we may keep it.

Risk Details: Airplane hangar
Reason(s) for Decision: Submit with full details and pricing.

Risk Details: Quoted renewal eff 7/28. Agent followed up with insured but no reply. Now insured wants policy. Alex proposing renew with lapse with SNL.
Risk in the name of LLC which is brother and sister who inherited home when father died. Alex proposing to write as HO3 since brother Charles is living there.
Reason(s) for Decision: This is an owner occupied exposure.

Risk Details: Steel airplane hangar owned by insured is located at a small regional airport. Used for storage, nothing hazardous. Insured used to own a plane. No concerning exposures in the area. Good security.

Insured is having house gutted. There is a detached garage that will remain untouched. Insured will store $70K of contents in it. Garage is locked. Insured is renting house in the neighborhood. No one has access to garage except insured.
Inspection shows horizontal balusters. Are we okay with those? Appear to be no more than 4" apart.
Reason(s) for Decision: Confirm no more than 4" space.

Risk Details: Insured purchased a "home" using as an office. ADM market declined, can we quote in E&S.
Reason(s) for Decision: This would be a commercial exposure since there is no residential use.

Risk Details: 3 structures on premises. Primary home and 2 fourplexes that occupy full time long term tenants.
Reason(s) for Decision: 3 separate policies all with separate liability charges.

Risk Details: Insured is friends with Kat Von D and describes herself as an actress. Mostly insignificant movies. Not much online info. Online photos show baluster concern.
Reason(s) for Decision: Subj to acceptable balusters.  Agent has positive info noted in email in file. Agt knows business manager. Insd is moving to find a more quite lifestyle.

Risk Details: VMGA rate $3334. Scottsdale rate $2377. (We have $10K backup)
Reason(s) for Decision: Ran CQ rater, can't beat our rate.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Reviewed with Bethany. Ran Tiger. Worked with Tiger over 2 days. Issue w/CQ rater. Resolved, but not getting a favorable rate. Much back and forth.

Risk Details: Insured grows veggies and crops and sells them at farm market. No employees. Owns 7 acres, but only part of this is garden. Was on a hobby farm policy with QBE.
Reason(s) for Decision: Apply Total Business Exclusion. Suggest small GL for business. Agent will recommend UFI policy to retailer.

Risk Details: West Of is an LLC entity formed for ownership of the one rental property.  JKS-CMSV LLC is an entity that is managing the leasing. There was a request to add them as Addl Insd. Alison talked to them to clarify and they agreed Addl Int is ok. Both entities have the same members.
Reason(s) for Decision: Story went on and on and on and changed multiple times. Final info is that JKS LLC will not be listed at all. This is STR and no business use. Advised Alison not to proceed any further trying to nail down JKS interest since they are not going to be listed. It won't change the form.

Risk Details: 3 story dwelling/condo with roof last replaced in 1987. Karen says it is in great shape per Zillow. They applied roof exclusion but retailer wants it removed on this newly written risk eff 9/22/17.

Risk Details: Insured pursuing lawsuit for siding, trim and fascia that was supposed to have a lifetime warranty and there is damage. Can we renew the risk?

Reason(s) for Decision: Advise insured of the excl. It excludes liab for their spa as well as pool and surrounding deck. Sent copy of form. Since it specifically excludes the deck, we are okay allowing all the time they want with the exclusion in place.

Risk Details: Insured closed on 9/28/17 but didn't come in to agents office to sign papers until 9/30/17. (Didn't realize signature was needed to bind) Agent sent to Alex on Saturday.
Reason(s) for Decision: Agreed to backdate with signed statement of no losses.

Risk Details: Good risk given 5% credit to win for great agent. After A+ run, 2 $0 losses found. One was leak under bath that turned out to be under ded and was repaired. Another involved pool water damaging plants and furniture. Details will be developed.
Reason(s) for Decision: Discussed that since both losses will be surcharged. Since $0 confirmed, we will still allow the $5 credit.

Risk Details: Renewal was quoted with $10K water ded due to $17K pipe break to water heater on 8/9/17. 1988 dwelling. Only loss in 9 years. Agent surcharged for loss.  Would we be okay with $5K water ded?

Risk Details: Risk expired on 9/29. Alex followed up on 9/28 and again yesterday.  Apparently the agent is no longer with the agency and the emails did not get handled properly. Alex asked about renewal w/o lapse.

Reason(s) for Decision: Okay to write as secondary, no COC - minor items left. Check rating w/other competitors to get our best rate.

Risk Details: Seller/applicant is renting back her house for 6 months. Can an HO be written?
Reason(s) for Decision: New owner needs a DP3. Seller/applicant needs an HO4.

Risk Details: Risk is 11 miles from a 65% contained wildfire. Can they bind?
Reason(s) for Decision: Any risk within 20 miles is not eligible. Fire must be 100% contained.

Allow 'til 11/8 to get signed statement from contractor that k&t is disconnected and no longer used.

Risk Details: Insured said all reno was done, change to primary. Agent did, now they say there are some additional changes being made. Re surface ceilings and remove/re-drywall a fireplace area. Risk Details: In middle of construction, builder went bankrupt. Some very small number of items left to be done. Insured will be the GC for any little things left. They need to get a home warranty to get their Occupanyc Permit. Home has passed town inspection.

Risk Details: 4plex townhome
Reason(s) for Decision: Requested additional info. Advised if applicant owns outside, and only unit owns, shouldn't be a problem. But from attachment name (says condo.townhome) and online pics concerned this may be a condo or apt complex which would be ineligible

Risk Details: 3 loans on prop need to be listed; It looks like this has a 1st, 2nd, and 3rd loan.  I checked with the lender and all three loans are with the California Housing Finance Agency.  The first is a regular FHA loan.  The second and third are also with them but are “silent” loans.  The second is a MyHome loan and the third is a Zip loan.  They are zero interest loans not payable until the home is sold.  They are given to borrowers to help with the down and closing costs.  They just sit there not accruing interest until the home is sold.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved. Researched loan types and confirmed don't indicate financial hardship

Risk Details: 1986 primary home and guest house on property. Both had separate addresses. 733 and 733 1/2.  Write on one policy or separate. They really only want the guest house insured.

Risk Details: Approved this risk for not being accessible year round. Inspection shows nice home, but the foundation is pier and beam. $200K cov a.

Risk Details: Insured took out a $500K policy on a home.  Hull was under the impression it was a COC renovation. Previously we said we wouldn't insure a property where the home basically had no value - it will be torn down! // 10/31 Reviewed w/ Jeff and declined. Note that a policy was already in force before info was obtained. Agent offered opportunity to cancel if they placed it quickly elsewhere.

Risk Details: Dwelling with guest house, back building, and garage. Insured will be renovating main house and maybe others in April 2018. Meanwhile, this is vacant. May eventually rent out the guest house. Can they put all structures on one policy.

Agt sending for opinion. // 11/3/17 removing liability because there are 3 employees.  2 gardeners/1 caretaker who lives in a motor home on premises.//11/6/17  caretaker is a friend who lives in a "trailer", they are not paid. Not sure if this trailer is a mobile home or what-agt will check more. Ok to include liab and workers comp if there are only 2 employees.

Risk Details: Insured owns and insures a primary home elsewhere. They are renovating their guest house and the carrier won't insure it. Can we?
Reason(s) for Decision: Write as DP3 reno. Try to get liab excluded and extended from primary. But if carrier won't, then write liab, but specifically exclude the primary and any other structures using building exclusion so we don't have any liab there.

Risk Details: 1890 dwelling gutted and remodeled. 3 family owner occupied.  Insured has a pony and 2 goats.

Risk Details: Advised Jerrold since home is all flat roof, I would probably not write it. Gave him some info on flat roof considerations along with deductible and exclusion options.
Builders Risk where there is a $13K liability claim. Insured acting as own GC. Liab placed with Nautilus.

Risk Details: Insured is a private in home nurse and cares for 99% of patients in their homes.  2-3 times a year, if there is a patient the family doesn't want to go to a nursing home, the insured takes them into her home at the end of their life, until they pass away.
Reason(s) for Decision:
• Does the insured have general liability, professional liability, and/or malpractice insurance that would cover her while she is taking care of someone in her home?  
• Is she administering any medications to the patients in her home?
• What oxygen, life support, or other equipment might be used?
• Would you have a liability market if we did it X-liability?  
• Would it work for you if we applied a full business exclusion?

Risk Details: Tamika asked for okay to extend policy for 3 days as insured is closing on home. Suggested $50 + tax.
Reason(s) for Decision: I approved subject to her ensuring this is enough premium for work she will do on her end.

Risk Details: Owner died so main home is vacant. There is a tenant in the granny unit who is helping oversee and clean out the property. It is going up for sale in 90 days and tenant is moving out.

Risk Details: Insured has a post and beam construction home and is having it replaced with a slab.

Risk Details: Typical requirement is no more than 4" between balusters. With that, I've allowed no more than 4" below the baluster string between the baluster bottom and the floor of the deck.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved if it is no more than 4", or if they can prove county requirement that the gap be bigger.

Risk Details: Insured has a primary w/no losses and a 2-family rental. Rental has a loss - smoke damage $7800. The damage was caused by a fire at a neighboring house also owned by the insured. The Fire Marshall report is "undetermined". Agent says they can't get the report (questionable). There was a prior VMM claim 2 days before the fire, no payment was made. Then the fire occurred.  (questionable).  Smoke damage has been repaired, claim is still open.  They will go with a $10-$20K deductible.
Reason(s) for Decision: We must review the Fire Marshall report before we agree to write either the Primary or the Rental.

I ran insurance score and found 10/18/12 bankruptcy. Insured said "no" to bankruptcy in last 5 years - advised agent we are declining due to undetermined fire loss, and also for material misrepresentation of bankruptcy.

Risk Details: Alison has 2 properties.  1 has 3 separate rentals. The other has a primary home and a rental guest house. We discussed how to insure.  The decision was, 3 separate rentals on one property can be written on 1 policy w/3 separate dec pages (like MDF00000332245). One liab charge since it is on the same legal property. Then use DL 24 11 to extend liab to the 2 other homes.  For the home/guest house, they are separate addresses. Need separate policies. If not rented, I'd make an exception for it to be an other structure.

Reason(s) for Decision: Wanted us to beat a Lex and Beasley rate. Ran against AAL and agreed to match Beasley $1900 rate.

Risk Details: Sent preliminary photos to see if we would be a market for something like this.
Reason(s) for Decision: Train/Railcar/Caboose -- If completely professionally renovated (structure as well as plumbing, heating, electric), permanently parked, and we can come to an agreement on an acceptable Cov A, we can consider writing on a submit basis.
Markel quoted prem 2960.  Lloyds prem $2280.  AAL came in at $1550.  Agreed to match Lloyds premium

Risk Details: Agreed to offer renewal for another 6 month term.
Agent asking for alternative to roof exclusion. 40 year old home w/unknown updates. Photos from inspection look good.
