Reason(s) for Decision: Advised Lisa we can't cover all in the UW guide. This is not a market we want. Grad students might be an exception.

Risk Details: 2 rental units on one property. Home and detached garage w/apartment rented to different people. As we did with another similar risk for Alison, put both on one policy, there would be 2 decs w/different "locations" listed but under one policy. Include charge for liability. There is a form that extends coverage to multiple locations.
Reason(s) for Decision: Agent came back - primary home is seasonal with family use. Det garage unit is rented. Advised to use HO 04 40 for the garage. Cover on a homeowners form.

Risk Details: New build in new community. Agent doesn't know if fire hydrants are in yet. 5/9 PC. Agreed to write as a 5 as long as hydrants are there or will be within a few months.

Guest house is primary residence for the insured. The previous main home is what is rented out. Alison will find out if this is AirBNB situation or a seasonal rental. We can probably write the "guest house" as Coverage A and the main house as Coverage B.

1989 very nice home. We have insured's Secondary. They have a C N A quote for $3800. We are coming in at $4421 w/$10K ded. ($4509 with $5K) We hit premium floor.  I did agree to go to $4300 today.  Tomorrow I can get an insurance score run and see if we can do better. Also asked for app and make sure this is apples/apples quote.
Reason(s) for Decision: Insurance score allowed 15% discount. Advised Kirk if apples/apples, we can get to $4128 (16 cent rate).

Risk Details: Insured is remodeling their home on land owned by newport beach and leased back to them. They REQUIRE to be listed as AI with strict endorsement language. We won't do it. Lloyds will for $3K more than us. Hull got Markel Coml to write a GL listing Newport Beach for $1M liab. Insd needs personal liablity for their protection and for their umbrella. Alison wants us to write liab on our policy which will be possibly stacked with the GL. Ours will be $300,000. We can increase our premium $1,000 for this.
Reason(s) for Decision: Alison will submit if needed. Discussed w/Louisa and she feels we need policy language from Coml and this may need to go to Audrey for approval since we would be stacking.  Our other insurance clause states:  This insurance is excess over other vaid and collectible insurance except insurance written specifically to covera as excess of the limits of liability that apply in this policy.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: 6/10, ended up writing with Lloyds.

Risk Details: Insured's decks were built around a large tree.
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked multiple questions about type of tree, maintenance plan etc. Ok if it checks out.

Risk Details: Insd owns a 2-3 family rental on one street, and a commercial business on the other. They are connnecting the two and turning it into 100% commercial. They need coverage on the rental and COC. Once the CO is issued, they will cancel the policy.
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked numerous questions about timeframe, type of business, use of exclusion.

Risk Details: M1 Concourse offers condos with auto storage in and around a racetrack. Values are $100-$500K. They can be used for offices, apartments, and/or car storage.
Reason(s) for Decision: Reviewed heavily with Jeff. Approval with parameters in Burns file.

Risk Details: Would our tainted drywall exclusion form apply to a case where asbestos taping and joint compound is used for drywall.
Reason(s) for Decision: Question in to Rodney. Drywall would be covered but extra cost to remediate would not.

Risk Details: Agent is asking if 5 additional insureds can be added to the policy.
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked a slew of questions about insurable interest. See email in agent file.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Interest is legit, but this is 5x the exposure. Approved for a premium of $200 additional.

Risk Details: Risk is titled in name of a deceased person. Son is the executor. Can they write in the name of the son. Insurance lapsed in 12/2015.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved with a 5-10% surcharge-Matt can apply his judgment.

Risk Details: Kirk wanted approval to reduce Oth Str from $195K to $85K effective 6/17 (Friday, 3 days ago).  Since this is a reduction, and the agent probably talked to the insured that day, I'm okay with going back a few days. Very little prem diff.

Lender left VM for retail agent to bind eff 6/17, but agent didn't get it unitl today.  Alison asked to backdate with signed no loss.  I requested current date (date she got the request) unless it was going to cause a force placed policy for the insured.
Reason(s) for Decision: Lender is going to significantly charge the insured for the 3 days.  I agreed to allow eff date of 6/17/16 with signed statement received.

Risk Details: Insured has 2 locations on 1 lot, but they have separate addresses. We discussed how to handle. 1 policy with 2 dec pages, each listing a unit and coverages. Make sure to apply 2 liab charges.
2001 log home with metal roof PC9. Does he need to surcharge?  Refer?
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised it does not need to be referred, does not need to be surcharged, per UW guidelines.

Risk Details: Insured has 2 roomers - rents out 2 rooms to 2 different individuals.  Are any additional forms needed. Reviewed policy language. Exclusion for contents unless related. There is coverage for liability, so no addl endorsement needed. Advised each roomer needs an HO-4.

Alison is getting mixed stories about the occupancy of this home.  It is a builders risk.  First agent said vacant. Now they are saying on of the members of the LP is going to live there before and after the remodel.
Reason(s) for Decision: I provided Alison with a sample of Burns Vacant Unoccupied Form and offered to create MPLH0115-0715 if she gets a bind order.

Risk Details: 1979 home updated. Insd had dog bite claim at other location. Lab retriever still in hh. Agent applying dogbite exclusion RU2401. Reviewed and it is the same as our MPL form Okay with open claim USAA $5000 reserve.
1994 home with 2 prior roof leaks. Roof is tile. Insd replaced the complete underlayment but not the tiles. (common practice when tiles aren't old or deteriorated)
How should a builders risk ground up construction be rated when they don't know what they are going to do with it when it's done - sell or occupy.
Reason(s) for Decision: Agreed to builders risk rate on a DP3.

Risk Details: How to insure 5 units on same parcel. 2 duplexes built in 1981. Single fam built in 1931. 3 dec pages, charge for 3 liab but include on 1 and extend to other locations. 1931 home needs MFRC - will do 3 forms lists.
5.5 acres - insured's primary residence.  They have 8 chickens (for eggs), 2 rabbits, 2 goats (graze the land), 2 labs, 1 cat. I did not think this was too many, or a concern from a liab perspective.
Agent has 25 rental locations but about 9 of them are mobile homes. We don't write mobile homes in our E&S program.

Insured renovated home, is now living in it.  Chubb wrote, but then inspected and found out counters aren't done. Most of all of the rest of the kitchen is done.  Bobbi wants to give worldwide liab. We agreed to write without the Builders Risk liab form
Vacant 6 month policy in the name of Giant Eagle Foundation. Eventually they will lease to struggling families. For now just need vacant policy.
Reason(s) for Decision: Alison will get Corp/LLC form and make sure it qualifies. No big businesses.

Risk Details: Insured wants to schedule their hot tub in Oklahoma.

CA office got inspection back late for this risk (Danielle has confirmed it is an isolated incident)  They did not know the risk was under construction. Danielle had them mid term endorse outside the 60 days.  She says per CA guidelines, n/a to E&S. Our compliance dept is still looking into that, but either way, the risk wasn't written with proper coverage so mid term change is okay.
Home is sold, seller is renting back. How to set up the policy for the new owner? Alison is writing as a homeowners with rented to others form. She will rate as a rental.

Insured bought a home and is renting it back to the builder. Jill and I discussed and believe we could do this X-liability.  She will verify how it is being used and if it is the only home, or part of a community. Probably can go DP3. Will rate between rental and vacant depending on use and whether it is isolated in a development.
Reason(s) for Decision: Jill will get back to us with more info.

Risk Details: Similar to Clifford Risk.  Leslie called assuming we would not want to write. We briefly discussed the risk and agreed on the decline.
Suzanne had a note that Larry said no asbestos siding. She has a risk where the inspection shows it. I advised this is a Markel rule, not just a Larry rule. She will cancel the risk
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved the cancellation

System Reason(s) for Referral: Decline risk by an active fire
Risk Details: Risk by the "Trailhead Fire" which was reported on 7/11 to be 98% contained. Burns follows 100% and I agreed. He says AA and Farmers have opened up.  I say better safe than sorry as stranger things have happened.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approve, as in agreed with Matt to Decline. Didn't want to log this as a decline

Risk Details: 1890 home not completely gutted. Has 4 losses (2 sewer line, water damage, theft).
Reason(s) for Decision: Agreed with Ben that this should be declined as it has not been completely gutted and the losses are related to this.

Risk Details: Insured cleared up to 120'. There are additional shrubs and brush, but it is across the street, not on their property.
Reason(s) for Decision: Forwarded copy of criteria which says 150' or to prop line whichever is less.

Risk Details: Alex missed charging for a $4500 water damage 10/15. He did apply a $5000 water damage deductible.  Prem $1580. $145 is the lost s/c amount.
Reason(s) for Decision: Agreed to skip the s/c this year but add at next renewal.

Risk Details: 2010 home PC4 in brush. Slope is 78 degrees. Do we have any criteria in place?
Reason(s) for Decision: We don't have any criteria. Per Kirk, other competitors do not either.  Cal Fire usually does drills on more challenging properties.

Risk Details: Home has all been updated except for cast iron sewer pipes
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved subject to no water/sewer backup.

Risk Details: Alex was advised of a $21K loss from controlled burn that went out of control and damaged oth str. Loss runs show $63K fire plus 2 wind losses. Not an agent he works with-one off for a commercial agency. He has another carrier to give this to.
Insured has 8 persian rugs we would be insuring as fine arts.  4@$8K and 4@$9500. They have photos - no bill of sale or appraisals.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved subject to bill of sale or appraisals.

Risk Details: Kirk doesn't have all the details yet so we discussed starting off with an offer of a water damage exclusion. Once the agent proves the loss info and corrections made, could consider a high ded.
Reason(s) for Decision: Sent Kirk a copy of the new water damage exclusion.

Risk Details: Insured has a $22K tractor strictly for maint of prem. Also, is a retired mechanic and has $30K in tools which he uses for pers use only. Okay for personal property?
Reason(s) for Decision: Yes, these do not need to be scheduled and no limitations. $22k is not outrageous.

Risk Details: Home with deck built around multiple trees. Asked if okay from a liab perspective.
Reason(s) for Decision: Reviewed online photos. Looks acceptable. Advised it is a concern if it is in a brush area. Also cautioned about monitoring growth and have a plan to make adjustments before damage is caused. Business name-get quest, watch UW criteria about corp name.

Risk Details: Are we a market for a homemade shipping container home?
Reason(s) for Decision: If professionally renovated and we can come up with a solid Cov A, we could consider.

Risk Details: Parents own, son living in it. Fits definition of named insured. Can they write an HO or DP? Wants theft of bldg materials.
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised Alex we are coming out with the DP Theft of Matl coverage, or would qualify for Homeowners.

Risk Details: Can a seller for a land contract be added as an additional insured?

Alison has cases of more than 1 rental property but sharing an address. We brainstormed how she would set up the policy. Would be all on one. Separate dec for each. One forms list (with designation if a form only applies to one property). If this manual designation didn't work, she could attach a manuscript endorsement. Liab is charged for all, but extended to all properties. That way we are not providing multiple limits at one address.
Agent didn't realize the lapse was over 90 days until Stmt No Loss was received. All info looks good - Corp form, older home form. 10% s/c added.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved subject to updated no loss letter

Risk Details: Primary residence 7 horses. Discussed finding out about breeding, boarding, riding, lessons. Also barns could be a concern if there is a lot of hay storage.
Reason(s) for Decision: Might consider x-liability.  Animal exclusion alone may not be enough. May need to exclude buildings too.

Risk Details: Agent bound based on old app and now inspection is showing brush issues and 3 horses boarded. 2 addl horses belong to the insured.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved X-liability, clean up brush.

Risk Details: 1929 roof no updates, cement roof.  Google shows landscape architecture business at this location w/hours 9-5. Cement roof could be asbestos mix.
Reason(s) for Decision: Pend for addl info on roof-ineligible if asbestos/concrete mix. Sent business questions to determine if we can write, maybe with business exclusion.

Risk Details: Insured turned an 1800 SF metal building into a home. Pristine photos in file. There has been a lapse due to an old PO Box was the address
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved subj to the rest of the risk being acceptable. Add s/c if lapse.

Risk Details: 2001 roof, unknown if treated. In forested area, not brush.
Reason(s) for Decision: Alison is sending additional information.

Risk Details: Discussed risk for Mark Damon, actor/producer. 73 years old
Reason(s) for Decision: Not too famous.

Risk Details: 2004 custom home, one of a kind modern design.  Angled walls, unique features.  Reviewed w/Louisa
Reason(s) for Decision: Declined due to concern with establishing Cov A and how a loss would be settled due to unique design.

Risk Details: Land contract - seller wants to be additional insured.
Reason(s) for Decision: Reviewed contract - appears in order.

Risk Details: Home is being purchased by son w/help from parents who will be co-titled.  Parents had a CAT fire in 2015 at a different address.  We do not need to surcharge for the loss.
1990's home with 3 pipe leaks. Alison is excluding water and retailer is questioning. 2014 $0 pipe, 2014 $24K slab leak, 2016 $46K pipe
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved Alison's direction.

Risk Details: Agent quoted w/Lloyds and Markel. Went on vacation, accidentally bound Lloyds. They received 8/10 w/ an eff date of 8/13. Agt wants to backdate Markel to 8/13 w/SNL.

Quote provided on 7/25. Insured thought they had given bind order but agent did not receive it. Good agent moving risk from a competitor to Markel. No active wildfires within 20 miles. Eff date back to 8/14 with signed no loss.
Prop is in the name of the LLC, but loan is in the name of one of the LLC members, Gregory Smith. One of the LLC members is Legacy Financial Group LP
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved subj to addl info on Legacy Financial Group LP

Risk Details: Lisa wanted to make sure we were okay with the unique design. It is modern, but not over the top.
Reason(s) for Decision: Risk is within Lisa's authority to submit.

Risk Details: Home is in the name of an LLC. Retailer wants to add individual insured as an AI. Alison doesn't want to and is asking my opinion.
Reason(s) for Decision: Marked as approved because I agree with Alison's decision to not add the individual. Discussed w/Kirsten.

Risk Details: Ben is asking for exception to our fenced pool rule for a home in PC10, pretty remote.  Pool and home set way back off road, pool not visible. Entire back yard is trees. Top agent.
Reason(s) for Decision: Issue is, the pool has a diving board which is ineligible. I don't feel comfortable making an exception for that.

Risk Details: Danielle inquiring if we are interested in writing student housing - single family - 4 undergrad students. Owner is friend of agent and says it won't be a party house.
Reason(s) for Decision: Declined due to poor experience w/student housing.

Risk Details: Wrote home in May. Inspection disclosed it was COC. Alex contacted insured and they said 5 days to completion. Checked again, 2 weeks, then said plumbing has an issue.  Wanted to know if he could endorse to COC back to inception.

Insured Steven Schneider and wife Wendy Rhodes are film producers.  He produced a couple of horror movies - not blockbuster and she produced some older films (including The Wedding Date as a production consultant). Not too famous.
A flat roof needs a $10K ded, but this one is older so the roof exclusion was applied. Are both needed?
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved with roof exclusion only. The exclusion applies to resulting damage so we should be covered.

Risk Details: Agent asking to backdate to 7/31 due to vacations and needing to gather addition information.
Reason(s) for Decision: Not a valid reason to backdate.

Risk Details: 1930 home with partial cast iron plumbing update done in 1990. Lisa wanted okay to quote excluding water damage.
New risk. Insp came back showing wood shake roof and wiring issues. In brush zone. Agent sent DNOC. Wiring being fixed, any chance we could stay on a wood roof. It is not a newer roof.
Reason(s) for Decision: Discussed options w/Alison and really we can't do anything. DNOC stands.

Risk Details: We restrict builders risk within 2 miles of coast. This current policy NCRUA1104104 is currently owner occupied, but they are going to be moving out, renovating kitchen and downstairs. .13 miles from coast.
Home and guest house has been on a Markel HO3 as Builders Risk. Home is done, guest house still under reno. Discussed best approach.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved to continue on as builders risk. When complete, will add back in other coverage water backup, mold, ERC. Didn't want to do now since those extend to the guest house. Limited to prem liab. Bobbi called back and asked for OK to add contents - approved.

Risk Details: Alex has a risk that is on historical registry. Some portion rented out via Airbnb. Insd gives tours, so declined. Turns out, they are just showing the home to people who stay there via Airbnb. Can't really stop that. These are not scheduled general public tours. A
Reason(s) for Decision: Alex to get signed statement and submit for review.

Risk Details: Jill has a policy where State Farm is excluding an other structure the insured uses to make jewelry to sell online and at fairs. Will Markel write a stand alone for the building X-liab.
Reason(s) for Decision: The policy language excludes any business out of an other structure. Can't override the policy language. Suggested a commercial policy.

Risk Details: 28 minute response time, PC10. There is a closer FD manned during fire season that is 11 mimutes away. Plus a volunteer squad nearby.  Still not liking the 28 minutes.

HUCAH150000877 retailer asked for EQ and home to be bound. Lisa overlooked because no one ever wants EQ. No losses. Eff 8/18. I approved w/no SNL as broker did have the bind request and bound the policy portion of it.

Inspection for rental property shows a lot of debris around property. Discussed w/agent. There is a prop mgt co to take care of maint issues. Move gas cans away from house to shed. Liab is for the owner.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved subj to moving gas cans away from house preferably to shed.

Risk Details: Open water damage claim. $36K reserve, work is just starting. Kemper is nonrenewing eff 9/20/16. Leak in bathroom pipe into rooms on floor below. Loss occurred 8/4.
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised Alex of our concerns with open water damage claims. If they find other issues and we are the insuror, who will it fall back on? (us)  Even with existing damage exclusion, if it is newly discovered issue, still could fall on us.

Risk Details: This is a vacant home with a decent rate. There is a loss that came up in loss runs. It was declined. It does not appear there was damage. Insured discovered a tree root in the septic line. Discussed and Alex will attempt to apply 1/2 a loss surcharge.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved w/some rate increase since there was a loss filed, there would have been some expense involved.]

Risk Details: Our proposed insured has a rental home leased to a tenant. That tenant is sub-leasing to another family.
Reason(s) for Decision: We have no control over the exposure.

Risk Details: Policy renewal with Markel expired on 9/2.  Insured has been traveling for a couple of weeks and missed the email from the agent letting them know.  Has been a good risk. Agreed to renew with no lapse with signed statement of no loss.
Reason(s) for Decision: Discussed procedure w/Jeff. Exception basis, need "valid" explanation. Reiterated procedure via email with Alex.

Risk Details: Approval to add LLC as AI to policy. Leslie found out it is the insured's LLC. Reviewed questionnaire.
Rental company (generic airbnb type) demanding they be added as additional insured.
Reason(s) for Decision: Reviewed w/ Alex who does not want to offer to list them at all.  Really no interest at all in being Addl Insured. Also no reason to list as Addl Interest (even though no coverage). They just connect renters to the property. They are not managing anything.

Risk Details: Agent does not usually write more than 3 rental units. Would we take 4.
Reason(s) for Decision: Mutually agreed this was more than we would do, even though on a COC.

Risk Details: Eligible rental cottage, but it is on the same property (same address) as a mobile home.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved X-Liability if there is min of 15' from mbl hm. If unable to extend from SF policy, we need to know separation and if it is well apart and defined space from mbl home, may consider liab.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Turns out home is 30-50 feet away and has a separate drive. SF won't extend liab. Alex allowed at $500k ded. Advised a condition is that a policy stay in force with liab.

Risk Details: Melissa had several photos of stairs w/no railing. We discussed and decided they were not needed.
Inspection shows home with open foundation.
Reason(s) for Decision: Not a risk we want.

Risk Details: Insured has plumbing company and bought 2 rentals in his business name. One occupied by employee, one by an independent nurse.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved subject to prem liab only.

System Reason(s) for Referral: One of two units on property
Risk Details: There is a property near the beach with 2 units, A&B. They are owned by different individuals.  Our insured is renovating unit B. Any concern with liability?
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved as we would for a single family home renovation.

Risk Details: Insured owns a duplex rented to 2 familiies.  Recent property inspection indicated one unused room actually qualifies this as a triplex. Can we remain on the risk?
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved staying on subject to this not turning into a 3 family. Okay to keep rating for a 2 family.

Risk Details: Elderly mother passed away. Daughter is living in the home and will stay there. Home is not yet cleared probate. Alex not sure who titled owner is at this point. No other relatives. No will
Reason(s) for Decision: Alex is getting full info-quick inquiry from retailer. We decided he could write a Dwelling Fire - covg on dwelling only, no liab, no other coverages. Verify occupancy and rate accordingly. Even though we don't have a true owner (since daughter isn't the executor yet) we feel it's an okay situation. He will verify condition as well.

Risk Details: Will we approve a risk where the agent is POA
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked kelly to refer risk w/info on the relationship and why insd made them POA.  Share results w/Louisa per her request.

Risk Details: Insured has a shipping business in a detached 3000 SF building. They blend, package, and store non hazardous chemicals and packaging materials. They do their own shipping. No trucks. No empl, visitors, etc. Coml insured.   2nd business is administrative only - they maintain interior plants at client facilities. Also has 2 horses personal use.
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked to verify that the underlying being maintained by the retailer selling the Markel policy. Asked for app and other info to review. Subj to building exclu, total business exclusion, also, keep coml in force.

Risk Details: Insured owns a home and is renting to own to a renter who can buy it within 5 years. Renter wants HO3 in his name. Matt suggests DP3 w/HO4.

Loss runs show Theft 12/2013 $0 - maid stole watch (on camera proof). Reported to Farmers agt for info only - he opened a claim. Insd wanted maid to give back. During the course of that discussion, 1/2014, they arrived home to find maid on the floor saying she fell down the stairs - all tapes were missing. Insd called police - they went to maids home to find 40 illegal immigrants who were then deported. $3,000 reserve still open since 1/2014. Should we s/c?
Reason(s) for Decision: Good agent, nice rental home in Beverly Hills. Lawyer sending info to support insured's report of the story. If we get that, no surcharge for the losses. If we don't, we will s/c for 1 loss as the 2 are somewhat related.

Risk Details: Insured purchased church and parsonage. Living in parsonage while they reno church to be primary residence. Both at same address.
Reason(s) for Decision: Decided to write as address A & B on separate properties since uses are so different and are going to be changing.

Risk Details: COC where insured is acting as contractor and hiring subs.
Agent asked if we would consider Corbin Bernsens 1936 home. Could we do a discount? It is in a Renie fire zone.
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised we could only consider X-Liability, but not sure if we would be comfortable with a discount.  Willing to look at the risk. Agent not sure if she will submit.

Risk Details: Agent has a single family being made into a duplex and a separate structure single family home being built.
Reason(s) for Decision: Sending app. Discussed and decided this was best on two separate policies.

Risk Details: Insured home is on a cul-de-sac between 2 streets. There is a primary home and a vacant parcel w/2 different addresses.
Reason(s) for Decision: Add 2 addresses to location, or manuscript endorsement.

Risk Details: Insured will be living in home during renovation. We will allow contents, loss of use, personal liability, med pay, personal injury. Different situation when insured is there and they have no other source of liab/med pay.
Advised Bobbi we allow 1 12 month renewal. If they want to do in 3 month increments it's okay with us. Beyond 1 12 month renewal requires Markel UW approval.
Insured has 4 goats and 20 chickens.  Alex will be excluding animal liability.
Risk is a model home the insured bought and will live in eventually. Leased back to builder.
Reason(s) for Decision: Probably better served on a commercial policy. If they won't do, we can consider  on DP3, X-Liability, would need info on security, location, who has access, kept locked, alarms.

Risk Details: Risk within Alex' authority. Loss runs show a fire loss for prior owner. $50K debris caught in pool heater started a fire, damaged pool and landscaping.
Delta has a risk she is looking at writing with us. Insured has a dock at a separate location.  Not a lot of details from branch - wanted to discuss before she called them.
Reason(s) for Decision: Discussed various options. Stand alone liab would be best. We don't have a form to extend. Would need full UW info on where is the dock, what is security, can just anyone get on it or pull up to it, what are circumstances that they have this at a separate prop, owned/rented/leased? Advised if all answers were great and we felt comfortable, we could always write a manuscript form.

Risk Details: Insured had $145,000 VMM claim at primary residence in 2014. At time of loss it was a rental. Tenant stole fixtures/contents. Carrier subrogated and recovered. Home is now insds primary. This unit is now a rental which is rented to friends of the insured. No surcharge for loss since different location and not within control of insured.
Insured is purchasing a home, renting back to the seller for 30 days and then starting a builders risk. May take 30-60 days to get the permits. Premium will be based on builders risk.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved provided the home is vacant less than 60 while they are getting the permits (policy language).

Risk Details: Home w/prior suspicious fire loss and possible liability loss almost done being renovated since 2013 loss. Agent wants coverage as home will be up for sale and sold.
Reason(s) for Decision: Not much here for us.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Agt f/u- Would you consider this one written on a DP3 with a surcharge that we can endorse to vacant once the reno is completed? Advised based on history, still not comfortable with risk. K.Burdine

Risk Details: Lexington renewal they want to change to Markel but then cancel on 11/21/16 as escrow is closing. Would MEP apply.  Yes it would.
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised MEP would apply.

Risk Details: Risk is currently primary. Insured is moving out. Son will be living there weekdays and it will be rented out most weekends of snow ski season. Would we rate as secondary/rental or full rental.
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised if son is really living there, it would qualify as secondary/rental.

Risk Details: HUCAH15000112-Prior loss-slip and fall at prop in another state; client feels claimant may have staged loss, about $17K paid out.
Reason(s) for Decision: approved with a rush prop inspection; Loss on another prop, diff tenant, no longer owns that prop; inspection will reveal any liability concerns on current property

Risk Details: Family business w/3 fam members and 1 addl employee.  Office only w/no foot traffic. Prem liab only. Home in name of 2 trusts. Insd rents from the trust. Ho4 policy written for them.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved with Total Business Exclusion.

Risk Details: This is a renewal that we previously approved. Facts have not changed. Delta was courteously checking to see if we wanted to reunderwrite since our referral criteria tightened up.
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised if prev approved, we don't need to see renewals as we were previously more lenient. If FD changes or material facts of risk change, then we want to see those.

Risk Details: Burns sent DNOC due to not meeting brush clearance. Insured had pro landscaper come in and trim, etc and letter form insd states they have 100' defensible space.
Reason(s) for Decision: Leslie was inquiring as there are many excellent things about the risk. Advised the Wildfire Warranty form will stand if there is a claim so we have to get confirmation from an inspector that there is 150' clearance and requirements of the form are met.

Risk Details: Insured is in the business of "energy healing" (Reiki). They work from home but majority is through skype and zoom. They "may" see 1 client per month.
Reason(s) for Decision: Add Total Business Exclusion.  1 client per month is not too much of an exposure to trust the excl. Agt will review limitations. No increased phys dmg exposures.

Risk Details: 1933 home updated. Student housing at Lehigh University for 4 students. Rented to "upperclassman - juniors".
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised we are not comfortable. May consider grad student exceptions.

Risk Details: Wrote at $800K. Inspection came in around $600K. SF has now increased with the COC. $900K Cov A is now justified.
COC with GC doing the work. Insured has $20-$25K in tools he wants insured. Will be at the prop during renovation.
Reason(s) for Decision: What kind? How secured? Other contents?

Risk Details: Insured sold home to new owner and kept the mortgage. New owner didn't pay, home being foreclosed. Will be a rental.

Risk Details: Agent wanted to extend liab to seasonal in Ocean City, NJ.

Risk Details: Insured has a property he will be fixing up to rent. There is leaking underground oil tank on the property. Prior owner removing it.

Risk Details: Too late to NRN. Insured expects to put up for sale soon.

Risk Details: Newer policy where agent wants to add 17 mortgagees - random people with $50K + invested it appears.

Risk Details: Insured is an online ticket broker, no traffic. Agent applying Total Business Exc.
Risk has a rock slide with steps built into a hill. Slightly over 5'. Do they have to exclude.

Risk Details: Policy HUCAH150001117-insured doesn't want to install handrail on steps since built to code

Risk Details: Insured has renovated a garage on the property into a rental apartment. Ray asked to exceed 50% and write as a 2 family risk.

Insured Last Name: Martin and Janet Sheen, The View Trust

Risk Details: This property has two small hunting cabins on it that are used as secondary homes.  Primarily during hunting season.  They are only 328 square feet and 210 square feet.  Then there’s a well house.  The insured really wants to insure the buildings since they are fairly nice and newer dwellings.  They both have electricity, water, and heating, PCQ says 30 min response, map shows over 1 hour
Reason(s) for Decision: Discussed w/ PM. Rate ($900) not adequate for risk and unusual that now seeking insurance (pics from 2008); response time to great

Risk Details: This is going to be a new purchase secondary property.  The current owner (not our insured) filled out the woodstove questionnaire for us, but they will maintain and clean as needed.  The cabin is accessible year round, and will be used year round.  The properties in the area are within a locked gated area.  It has a combo lock that is shared by the owners, and the local fire department has the combination as well.
Reason(s) for Decision: Response time for seasonal home is outside our comfort level. Even though lower valued, response time is over an hour

Risk Details: Insured may hunt with friends on property
Reason(s) for Decision: No payment to hunt on prop; insured will always be w/ guests, 74 acres, not stocked with any animals. Discussed taking some addt'l premium if we are able to do so and remain competitive.

Risk Details: Builders risk, complete rebuild
Reason(s) for Decision: Not many details provided, advised OK to proceed if licensed GC, work <1 year, supp app completed.

Risk Details: wood shake roof, nr from prior carrier due to no longer writing in zip

Risk Details: This is next to a business – car shop. It is NOT part of the property of the 3 family; gut/rehab
Reason(s) for Decision: Confirmation that owners of property have no ownership in the car shop next door; appropriate use of flat roof guidelines per online pics of home

Risk Details: 2 water losses in 2015. $15K clogged condenser pan overflow. $10k toilet waterline loose. Insured had all waterlines replaced. She checks all these items annually.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved subject to a $2500 deductible. Felt insured had done what she could to mitigate, and performs annual maintenance.

Risk Details: 1915 building fully updated. In Santa Fe historical district. Front is leased to a lawyers office. Back is leased residential.  Coverage is lapsed. No losses. Agent asking to consider with total business excl, SNL, etc.
Reason(s) for Decision: This would be more appropriately written on a commercial policy in my opinion since part is leased to a business. It is not the insured's business.

Risk Details: Large water loss in 2013 that took over a year for repairs to be completed, PC3, all updates completed since 2006.
Reason(s) for Decision: Repairs were a major update to the systems, floors, walls, and some cabinets.

Risk Details: This is a brand new build, secondary, PC 10.  Estimated response time is between 20-30 minutes.  Responding fire department is 10.3 miles from the home, and is a volunteer station.  There is a paid, live-in caretaker at the home.  There is a 5,000 gallon cistern next to the house, but the fire department also has the capability to bring 1 tender (2,000 gallons), and 2 engines (500-1,000 gallons).
Reason(s) for Decision: Per agt, can't take more than a 10% surcharge as want to beat Lex. Approved subj to getting a central/monitored alarm
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: agt advised need higher TIV for Coverage B, and can't get alarm so will offer Lex terms unless we want to compete. Declined as per app 26-30 minutes is the best case scenario in response w/ good weather so need more premium or a mitigator

Risk Details: Malibu is restricted - good quality risks only. Alison confirms this is nice home. Online looks okay.  Not in brush but she is applying some brush s/c anyway.
Reason(s) for Decision: Good risk for Malibu exception.  // Alison replied the next day that Malibu was the mailing. Turns out it's really in Pacific Palisades.

Risk Details: MPLCO00001309-Insured moving to Australia for 2 years, renting out home for long term basis. Wishes to add MPLH0179 for remainder of this term, then rewrite next term
Reason(s) for Decision: Discussed w/ MP, since home was owner occupied half of the term, agree to allow for endorsement for remainder of term

Risk Details: Insured has multiple mysterious disappearance/theft losses close together with $0 paid. Apparently babysitter or nephew took items from her. Was insured w/USAA, Safeco, then Lloyds. There were thefts w/ all the carriers in addition to other types of losses. Insured added alarm to her closet where someone was taking items. Apparently she called every time she found one thing missing.
Reason(s) for Decision: Claim frequency. Question of state of mind. Morale hazard.

Risk Details: Agent asking for exception to our $1M limit for WRS 30-49.
Reason(s) for Decision: Not eligible per guidelines. Advised the CA guidelines are not flexible.

Risk Details: COC, primary and moving in upon completion of renovations. Farmers NR due to extent of renovation: walls, doors, window space, kitchen, flooring (no additional square footage)

Risk Details: Not in brush, over 150 feet from, insured is therapist and see clients in home
Reason(s) for Decision: subject to confirmation of the GL policy and the total business exclusion being applied.

Risk Details: No app provided. PC quest provided. Secondary home on island. Not accessible year round (when lake is not thawed or frozen). Accessible by snowmobile when lake is frozen.  No bridge access. Insured has wifi, burglar, smoke det, cameras w/alerts to cell phone.  There is mutual aid with fireboats. Volunteer FD.
Tail end construction, only wants 3 mo policy. Has 3 horses - 2 belong to a friend.

Risk Details: BR, didn't realize coverage was needed, now ready to purchase, 14 min drive time
Reason(s) for Decision: approval to offer terms subject to a no loss statement, confirmation of GC liability, a lapse and 25% surcharge, and a PC 10 rating

Risk Details: Agt quoted ground up in Feb, but insured didn't take as thought GC GL would cover. After GL advised didn't, now seeking cov. Foundation, framing, roofing, windows, rough heating and Air conditioning and plumbing are done.  Surcharging 20%

Risk Details: 09/10/2015-lightning, 04/10/2017-water. All repairs made, 01/2015-$932,000 liability for libel/slander/defamation; wants PAF schedule as well

Risk Details: Malibu risk, in brush
Reason(s) for Decision: declined due to brush

Risk Details: 8 miles from Woolsey fire (per my search today). Fire is 98% contained. Not in brush. PC unknown. Property was an equestrian training facility.
Reason(s) for Decision: If PC 8-10 decline. If protected, fire must be 100% contained. Need to make sure this is not an active equestrian operation. Make sure we have Cov B right or exclude fences and structures.  There is a LOT going on per online search.

Risk Details: What testing is needed or required?  The insured read the alarm form and wants to know, since it is a rental
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised Alison All alarms should be periodically tested.  The insured may want to consider adding a clause to their lease that the tenant test the alarm monthly and report any concerns.  The insured should probably oversee the testing once annually.  They could do this in conjunction with the alarm company and the tenant.  If they keep a record of this, they should have no problem being in compliance with the requirements of the form.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Alison advised the insured isn't comfortable keeping the alarm form. Alison is removing the credit, but I agreed we could still write even though over $2M. We are assuming the tenant will likely maintain the alarm and monitoring. Additional call on 7/12/16, insured is wanting $25K mold. Got an okay from Jeff for $250 rate.

Risk Details: Will we give credit for dry hydrant?
Reason(s) for Decision: Confirm PC9 now, 11 min response, excellent risk. Could allow 5% credit. PC 9>8 would be 10%. Officially we do not give credit for dry hydrants in a PC9 or 10, but they are recognized by ISO as a creditable water source.

Risk Details: This was a Burns risk, agent wants Hull to rewrite. There are no alarms and it's over $2M TIV.
Reason(s) for Decision: Agreed to waive requirement to match competitor expiring.

Risk Details: Historic registry; renovations
Reason(s) for Decision: MFRC only, home is not super ornate, but def some unique qualities per online review. Also contingent to no tours

Risk Details: Open loss:2 losses within 3 years, but all loss history is listed on the application.  There is a 5/20/2018 water damage claim that is open, and potential loss value could be $175,000 if not denied.  Chubb is having an engineer complete an inspection on the property to see if it’s a construction defect or ongoing issue.  They said if it’s not then the claim will pay around $175,000.  They are having water intrusion from their windows.
Reason(s) for Decision: We could offer terms as suggested (with the roof and water damage exclusion), but must wait until the claim is closed or at least the repairs are nearly complete. We aren’t comfortable binding policies in the middle of a claims process, so would need to wait until we offer terms.

Risk Details: Near a brush zone.
Reason(s) for Decision: Jeff reviewed. Risk was okay but questioned surcharge. Some back and forth. Finally, Alison agreed to apply full surcharge.

Risk Details: Nice risk but it has no c/s alarm. Does $10K AOP apply since it is a rental risk and insured can't confirm whether alarms will be used?
Reason(s) for Decision: Fire/smoke detectors don't require activation by a tenant , they are always active. We would require them at a minimum. Could forego burglar since no guaranty of use. $10K ded applies if no alarms.

Risk Details: Coming off COC, vacant/up for sale
Reason(s) for Decision: Insured lives close to home, easy to monitor, photos OK

Risk Details: Secondary home, roads paved, tankers on property, but no hydrants

Risk Details: $3.6M TIV in brush.

Risk Details: not in fire zone, sustained smoke damage (over $100K) last year, repairs made., alarms in home, 2000 build

Risk Details: 1974 condo. Mtg co has now required an HO6 policy . Good ins score. No losses. Getting SNL

Risk Details: Condo that is allowed to be rented for 1 night. Will we allow?  2007 risk.
Reason(s) for Decision: If it is primarily rented 2 nights and 1 night is just to fill a few openings, we could consider. (95% 2 nights pretty good). Otherwise, if open to 1 night always, we should decline.// Primarily 1 night rental - listed that way on AirBnB site per Allison. Declined.

Risk Details: 1974 condo w/updated roof. Seasonal rental. PC10 paved, year round access. 29 minute response.

Risk Details: Agent inquiring if 2 condo units in a multi-unit building can be together on one policy or separate. They've been on an HO-6 together.

Risk Details: 1980 year built condo. Condo is a caboose. It is part of a line of condos all built from a train. This is a seasonal condo for the applicant. Roof is membrane with sealant. Reason(s) for Decision: Approved terms. Comfortable with risk since it is a condo, otherwise roof would've been a concern. Condition appears to be good on this risk and all the others that are there.

Risk Details: 1952 year built with no indication of any system updates to the dwelling. Primary heat source is a wall furnace that is not thermostatically controlled.

Risk Details: 1964 condo fully updated. Ben says guidelines indicate $50K would be a referral.

Risk Details: Daycare in home, GL policy in place,

Risk Details: Insured is TV actor. No concern with lifestyle. Low cov A, modest condo. Liab not a concern. Not in brush. 3 prior water losses under $5K. $5K water damage ded quoted.
We are not a market for Yurts. Advised Allison I found a NY and Hawaii Company - Midrox.  None in Colorado.  I checked w/friend at Farmers/Foremost and they don't do Yurts.

Framed, vacant shed on land in OR. Insured will be living in RV while looking for house (moving from TX to OR). Once they have a home, the RV will go into the shed and the coverage will be dropped as the homeowners coverage will cover the shed then.
Reason(s) for Decision: Excellent risk. PC 5 means fire may be mitigate, but likely will lose it. No plumbing or electricity for perils. Shed seems to be in good condition based on limited pictures online.

Risk Details: Insured purchased in 12/2017 but failed to get insurance (too busy with work). Written through top agency, surcharged 10%, will do interior inspection and no loss letter
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved as quoted

Risk Details: 2006 seasonal condo near coast. Has 10% wind/hail ded. Agent asking us to match Scottsdales expiring $1988 with 2% ded.

Risk Details: 2016 auto condo. Previously reviewed w/Jeff Leone. All issues addressed. $0 liab.

MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: $1387. No debit applied per Jeff. DP3 Vacant.

Risk Details: Two log cabinson the property. A woodstove is the primary heat source. One home was built in 1996 and the other in 2015. Soary power only, no plumbing except a 525 gallon cistern.  Cabins never insured but wants coverage now.
Reason(s) for Decision: IS is excellent. Never had a mortgage on either building - is a veterinarian that travels around quite a bit. Log cabins are "off the grid" with not a lot of exposure. Winterizes cabins when gone in the winter. Fully accessible (PC4) and relatively low value.

Risk Details: Attached is a seasonal home for the above applicant located in UT. Home was built in 2000, no updates. It is built of 100% frame construction. PC4. No losses. $350,000 in contents
Reason(s) for Decision: however due to the higher contents limit and no burglar alarm in the home a $10K theft deductible will be required.

Risk Details: 206 rental home. Loss 8/19/16 5 yr old child drowned in insured's pool - was a guest of the renter - parents failed to supervise the child. Nothing paid, reserves $605,000. No liab requested.

2007 primary condo. Insured had 2 prior water losses in 2015 and was nrn'd by State Farm. He is a cinematographer. No adverse information online and "not too famous".  Extremely low per RM. Negligible per FireLine.

2016 frame built, nice pics, 868 sq ft, This is a utility shed/garage only.  primary home is 1.3 miles away. only a utility trailer and ATV’s stored in there (insured on an auto pol).   visited about 2 times a month.  It has locks, security lights, and a cell phone monitored alarm.

Risk Details: Storage shed in rural setting with 17 minute response time on a PC 10.

Risk Details: 2016 masonry structure only. 14 min response time. FD is 5.8 miles away. Not paved but accessible, visible. Pond freezes over but there are tankers and a well.

1982 frame condo with 7 water claims and 1 liab claim. 4 water claims are the insureds. Others, she was advised by her agent to file when a neighbor had a loss. There is one liab claim with $0 paid. Agent proposes $5K water dmg ded.

Risk Details: Insured has a pole barn w/no windows used to store his belongings as he travels most of the month.  $50K contents. Agent applied 10% theft ded which we previously discussed. In rural area, locked.

Risk Details: Agent inquiring if a mobile home on blocks qualifies for an HO-3.

Risk Details: Used for camping and storage. Plan to build there in 2-3 years. FD 3 miles. Yr rnd access.

Risk Details: 2000 barn w/ office. Insuring just the barn and liability Insd will be living on the property with their motor home. 22 acres. Fenced, gated driveway. Agent charging $1500 min prem.

Home built in 1982 and is on stilts. Metal roof. Partial updates to wiring in 2018 and plumbing and heating in 2016. The roof was completely replaced by 2010. Primary heat is infrared gas heaters which are not rated for residential use
Reason(s) for Decision: Infrared heaters are not rated for residential use but mostly in commercial settings. Also a PC 10 with 20 minutes response time.

Risk Details: 1953 home updated. Tenant will have in home daycare. They carry a GL. Can we include $500K liability.
Reason(s) for Decision: I approved subject to meeting the guidelines Burns follows today - licensed for no more than 5 children. DL 24 16 Daycare exclusion applies.

Risk Details: Frame, secondary, built in 1950/updated, new purchase, rated as PC6 , no heat; active policy BWH107552-3983205, no heat not disclosed but discovered during inspection
Reason(s) for Decision: Home is winterized, not in use in winter (Seasonal in warmer months only). Piping updated in 2008; subject to 10% surcharge since not disclosed at rating and requested rewritten to a DP3 form if not already

Risk Details: 2010 condo part living, part business-sectioned off w/separate entrance. Chiropractor w/8-10 clients per day. Prof liab in place. Liab and In-home business liability requested.
Reason(s) for Decision: X-Liability, X-in home business liab; add Total Business Excl-discuss implications w/insured.

Risk Details: 1975 frame home updated. Insured sets up food truck on weekends in driveway. 30 customers all weekend. No GL policy. No liability quoted.
Reason(s) for Decision:
• We are unable to find good online photos.  Do you have a recent inspection or photos?  (We have a concern with the condition of a home with a $75,000 Cov A.)
• App indicates updates completed in 2016 and 2005.  Were these full or partial updates?
• How far is the food truck parked away from the home?
• Is there cooking conducted?  What is the source of fuel for cooking?  Where is it stored? 
• Is there a fire extinguisher in or outside of the food truck?
• If we do proceed, it would be subject to the Total Business Exclusion.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Home updated, looks okay. 20' from home w/propane tank for cooking and FE. Approved subj to no liab (as quoted-front steps a concern, outside fridge and chest freezer a concern). Total Biz Excl.

Risk Details: 1978 home. Online pics look ok.  Has 7 children. 5 is limit in program. $100K liab.
Reason(s) for Decision: Must apply TBE and get a GL. If not GL, X liab ok with TBE. Doesn't qualify for Burns in home daycare program.

Risk Details: Insured is a writer/journalist. Online search not concerning. Had prior loss 3.14.16 pipe burst in adj unit $5K. State Farm nrn per app-no info about why.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approve subj to acceptable reason for NRN.

Risk Details: 1974 home fully updated. Burns had insured. Then moved to AIG who is hassling them assuming this is under reno. Per insd, they purchased this unit above theirs.  There is no reno. They are mad at AIG.

Attached is a secondary risk located in OH. Frame construction, built in 2000, PC10, 14-18 min drive time, no alarms, no losses. The company they currently have coverage with is no longer writing in OH.
Reason(s) for Decision: Online photos and PCQ Ok. OK with possible 18 min drive time since to lower value

Risk Details: 1964 year built, listed updates 2008-2011 for all systems and roof. Replacing siding, windows, and a porch. Completion date is September 2019? Replacement cost of property is $153k, but market value and desired Cov A is $77k. Agent advised home is in "fairly rough shape".
Reason(s) for Decision: Too many red flags - far completion date for what seems to be little work, market value vs replacement cost, agent advised in rough shape. Insured is also on disability and asking for monthly installments. Due to all factors we are declining.

Risk Details: 600 SF home on shore of Houghton Lake purchased for $112,000. RC coming in at $80,000. Can we help?
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised Tamika I would run insurance score to rule out any moral hazard. Also need to see if we can allow them to write a risk in Michigan. This is for one of their offices in Michigan.

Risk Details: 1960 log cabin w/no utilities. Primary use woodstove. Online photos show a scrubby cabin in the weeds and woods. This is brush zone. 30-55 minute response time seasonally. Reviewed w/Jeff

1986 home w/no plumbing except running water for sink. WBS for heat but pretty much decoration only as it is used 4-6 weeks/year.150' clearance. No online photos. Dirt roads but accessible year round.
Reason(s) for Decision: Get WBS as app states it is for heat.  Inspection determined this is inaccessible year round, brushy, and 60 min response time. Adjusted rate with 50% s/c vs. original 20%.

Risk Details: 1973 home not accessible year round. 30 min response, roads not paved.  Log home. Space heater.
1919 home minor updates, roof exclusion, no losses. Lapse since 7/13/17. Daycare for 8 kids. May be getting GL. Consider with liab and TBE.
Reason(s) for Decision: Due to lapse. (Also advised Jill of concern with insurance score. Adverse information)
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Score under 600 with judgements and collections

Risk Details: This is the first stand alone other structure risk that JM Wilson is quoting after we advised we are allowing them. Structure is 250 miles from insured's home. PC 9, pole barn. Insured's occupation is "construction"
Reason(s) for Decision: Seemed odd that the structure was so far away from the insured's home. Asked for clarification as to why it is so far away and what type of security measures are in place. How often it is checked on and by whom. Regarding the insured's occupation, want to know what is stored in the building, if any employees come to the premises and if there is any construction work done there or any other connection with the insured's work.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Received response from JM Wilson advising that they are placing the risk elsewhere because they "didn’t ask as many questions"

Risk Details: Gun repair/customization shop in detached garage. Thought had coverage on primary home as well, but realized didn't so lapse in insurance
Reason(s) for Decision: Gun shop hazards and too large of a lapse

Risk Details: 1945 frame home with full heating, wiring and plumbing updates in 1993. New roof in 2005. Looking for FRC terms. IS was a no hit. There is a 15 minute response time.
Reason(s) for Decision: The CovA does not hit the minimum $100k but this is a cabin in CO which may have lower values. Fire wood pile must be moved and submit evidence that has been done.  Insurance score is a no hit.

Risk Details: 1939 home unsure of updates. Sign business in home and in garage. Lite traffic. No GL.
Reason(s) for Decision: Additional business questions and info on updates - increased demand.

Risk Details: 1906 commercial building now being used as primary residence. Agt to order insp, EHP, confirm no losses, confirm no coml use, confirm coml neighbor.
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked for confirmation of condition and reno completed. Also need to verify size, covg, Cov A.  Need 100% ITV of ACV or RC.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Burns consistently states that they do not want to change Cov A until they get the inspection back so they don't have to make changes twice.

Risk Details: 1920 home updated and rented out. Insured also leases land for farming. 2 large barns. Reviewed agt photos and online. Home looks good. Barn looks threadbare and full of hay.  Agt asking to exclude liab but cover home and barns.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved subject to excluding other structures and liability.

Risk Details: 1991 frame home. 145 acres - insd bales hay from property as secondary profession. Prim home has auto body and airstrip-insured by Lloyds. Agnt applying Total Business Exclusion.
Reason(s) for Decision: Verify use of Machine Shed noted on app $71,200. If biz equip stored in it, the TBE will exclude covg if a loss occurs from the equip. May need to insure elsewhere. If personal use, okay.

Risk Details: Seasonal 2016 home on rear, front home is duplex rented long/short term. Photo condition looks good. Rail missing on rental home deck. Was with Fair Plan.
Reason(s) for Decision:
You are approved to release terms with a 50% surcharge on the $1000 rate for a total premium of $1500, subject to:
• Confirmation that the reason the risk was with Fair Plan was due to coastal exposure and not condition or other concern.
• Front rental home upper level deck appears to be missing a large section of railing.  This must be repaired immediately and proof provided to you.

Risk Details: 1950 home updated. Has no heart. Occupancy is by insured's aunt for 6 months over the summer. Home is winterized off season. NRN by prior carrier due to prev insured deeding to daughter, our new insured.
1980 home updated in 2000. No alarm, no losses. Shares drive w/Delaware Valley Concrete. Large materials business per internet search. Agent is requesting liability.
Reason(s) for Decision:
• Please verify the condition of dwelling and the Cov A.  Value seems very low for RC on a 1200 SF home
• Please provide sketch of where the dwelling is located in relation to the business buildings, also the driveways
• Does anything separate the dwelling and business (e.g. fence, wall, etc.)
• Is the commercial policy for buildings, business contents, and liability maintained by the retail agent
• Would you have another source for liability if we cannot provide premises liability?

Risk Details: Frame, secondary, no losses, built in 1956/updated in 2006, located in MI, PC10, not accessible year round
Reason(s) for Decision: Premium appropriate for exposure, debris in pics so subj to debris removal

Risk Details: 1912 home/wupdates, MFRC & roof exclusion until roof is replaced. With Allied for 30 years. Allied NRN due to wildfire score. In brush zone. Cabin is 50' behind a lake that can be used by pumper. Has gas furnace in good condition.
Reason(s) for Decision: Subj to home being winterized off season. Agent applied 10% s/c due to summer use only.

Risk Details: 1970 home updated in 2014. Inherited from father who never insured. Insd updated and now wants insd. No heat. Only used in summer. Agt quoted DP1 ACV, 10% SC, 2500 AOP
Reason(s) for Decision: Verified PPC

Risk Details: $57K fridge line 4/15; $105K sink backup 9/12
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved subject to $25K ded w/water sensor monitored alarm

Risk Details: 1972 year built fully updated in 2009. Applicant is Deion Sanders, pretty high profile retired football player. Has home in FLP with mother and sister to protect his name. Couldn’t find any information on property online. Liability is excluded on the referral from agent.
Reason(s) for Decision: Overall, the profile of applicant is pretty significant. When searching online, at least 4 different lawsuits/cases were found that involved this applicant and other businesses/organizations that he runs. Also, not necessarily an immediate concern, but questions as to why such a low value and small property for someone with as much wealth as applicant. All of this considered, we are declining.

Risk Details: The insured built a barn in Colorado and they  are looking for  $100K property coverage only with a $5,000 ded.  Response time is 25 minutes.  Insured received a Markel quote from another wholesaler so submitting for review. 2016 barn, vacant DP1 rating. In brush.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved at rate quoted
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Verified rating w/ apples to apples competitor quote and this rate is fine.  $1272 DP3; $750 DP1.

Risk Details: Infrared heaters mounted to property
Reason(s) for Decision: Reviewed-very few freezing days in this area, heater will not be needed nor used regularly. 5% surcharge for heat type

Risk Details: 1900 dwelling that was a church, currently a library, being renovated to be a home. Agent says there are updates on systems. Roof is metal from 1968.
Reason(s) for Decision: Numerous questions about updates as there is galvanized plumbing. Roof exclusion. Covg A inadequate.

Risk Details: ground-up pole barn construction, 3 month build, PC 10, viewable to neighbors, insured checking every weekend, requested at Dp3; eventually secondary home on prop
Reason(s) for Decision: approved terms as a builders risk Dp1 (confirmed w/Jeff OK to offer DP1 on barn under construction) on  barn only. Advised should home be constructed would need to resubmit for consideration

Risk Details: Home was built in 1980. It is frame construction, no alarms. PC5. No losses. Roof was updated in 2017. The insured owns a painting business. There is a shed on premise that the painting business is operated out of.
Reason(s) for Decision: Subject to TBE, OK with separation/type of business

Risk Details: 2016 cabin with hardie board cement siding (virtually fire proof rated). No alarms. FD 2 miles away, but roads are dirt, and team is volunteer, so agent is probably accurate with their 20-25 min response time. Fully accessible, visible to neighbors.
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked for more info on the woodstove. If used in warmer months, may not be as big an issue.  Lower value and hardie cement siding are positives to allow for longer response time.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Used occasionally in winter.  Water is gravity fed. Always winterized when not in use. Stove is professionally installed. $100K value. FireLine could only do a zip code level match - came in at a 6 (lower end of high)

Risk Details: wood stove and solar panel primary heat source, never had insurance on it, responding fire department over 15 minutes, 482 sq ft, 1982 build, 5 acres with a well, visits about 4 times a year

Risk Details: Zoned commercial, used to be a restaurant but now strictly used as residence. Insured is a handy man so will get a GL policy for that exposure

Risk Details: 1990 home w/updated roof. Home on pilings.
Reason(s) for Decision: Confirmed online this is a frame home. Advised this is below intracoastal, so no wind/hail. Need completed/acceptable PC quest, can't be over 15 min response time.

Risk Details: 2016 kit log home w/no heat, no plumbing. Has generator. No portable heating, no woodstove. No prev ins as they expected value to be $35 K and it expanded.

Asked numerous questions: • What current premium are you coming up with?  I may want to add a slight surcharge.
• When cabin was being built, did insured have typical permits and inspections?
• Is the house wired electrically?
• What systems or appliances does the generator power?
• There are 2 location addresses on the app.  Where is the home located?
• One of the address is the same as the school where the insured teaches.

Risk Details: 1966 home with updates to all systems and roof. Referred due to 82 acres w/2 ponds. No coml, farm, or hunting.

Risk Details: 2005 condo purchased new. Never had coverage. New condo assoc requires it now. Good ins score. Getting SNL

Risk Details: Stand alone other structure built in 2016 is a  barn with some contents. Insd has a builders risk & liab from their primary. Constructing new home on this prop. Company won't cover the Oth Str. 25 min response time. $0.94 rate very strong. Top agent.
Reason(s) for Decision: Subj to no heat or acceptable heat. Turns out there is a low output heater. Advised okay as long as not portable and is thermostatically controlled.  4/26 agreed to remove Vacancy Clause form as insd going there every 2 mos. Neighbor watching, but not weekly inspection. Discussed w/Jeff.

Risk Details: Insured says bankruptcy due to bank not wanting to refinance home due to motorhome loan so he just told them to take the motorhome back. Info on credit file does not support this. Has score in the 1.50 s/c range. Terrier dog - no other info.
Reason(s) for Decision: Decline due to financial responsibility.

Risk Details: 2007 2 cabins. PCQ shows 20 min response time and no hydrant. Rated as PC9. Can't find location addr on a map. Can't find address for Witmer VFD online. Rough search shows 16 miles away.
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked agent for proof or rate as PC10 and send back so we can assure rate adequacy.  Current rate is $.66/100 TIV//Revised rating to PC10 makes it .77/100. Agent only rating as 1 family. Advised if the 2 cabins are rented separately, it needs to be 2 family.  If the "property" is rented, it can be 1 family.  Suggested changing to 2 family since it's only 2%.

Risk Details: 1988 condo on Catalina Island. RiskMeter won't run. Says out of area.
Reason(s) for Decision: Per PM, rate with additional 60%.  Rest of risk okay.

Risk Details: 1988 condo on Catalina Island. RiskMeter won't run. Says out of area.
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised to use WRS40-49 with 60% manual surcharge.

Risk Details: Metal building, no losses, no central heat or air. Only source of heat is fireplace. Applicant lives in part of building, other part is shop/storage

Risk Details: 1908 home updated except for 1 floor of knob & tube wiring. Will be updated within 6 months. Also has asbestos siding.

Risk Details: New purchase in 2017. No insurance since. Renovations just completed and insured now wants insurance. Insured is Chairman of County Commissioners. Volunteer FD 15 miles from home, dirt road, response time over 15 minutes.
Reason(s) for Decision: Response time over 15 min (and ins score low with 2 year lapse)
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: 2 star ins score per Niki = surcharge

Risk Details: 1978 home w/updated roof in 2014. Insured welds and fixes lawnmowers and motors in his garage. Has a GL. Per inspection, the work is done in an attached garage. There are tarp covered lawnmowers around the exterior of the building and many in the driveway and in the garage. This is part time per questionnaire. 3 prior claims - 2 wind, theft. No $ amounts.
Reason(s) for Decision: Declined as presented. Can't exclude the building. If we write with Total Business Excl, anything business related is excluded. Such a high fire exposure, don't feel we should take this on knowing it will be excluded. If a coml pol could be put in place that covers business related property losses, we could offer terms w/Total Business Exclusion.  4/26-addl info. Insured has a CGL in place which covers BI and Prop Dmg. Got loss info, no addl concerns.

Risk Details: Current authority is $150K TIV. Changed that!

Age of Home: Cellar was built in 1847, but the home's  structural integrity from the ground up was built in 1920 and home renovated fully again in 2008 for roof, 2012 for electric/plumbing & heating 2015.  Masonry construction with no alarms and no losses
Reason(s) for Decision: subject to no outdated components in cellar

Risk Details: Sawmill operated on property, PC 6, home built in 2013. Cash purchase, so no insurance
Reason(s) for Decision: Unfortunately, this property is ineligible for our product.  The type of business exposure is one that is pretty unique, and we may have been able to consider with a total business exclusion. I'm not too familiar with sawmill work, so would have to research it more to see if it is an exposure that a business exclusion could properly mitigate. Also, 5 years gap in coverage

Risk Details: Low value new purchase with limited utilities and higher response time. Roof condition questionable - exclusion applied. Agt quoting DP1 with 80% s/c.
Reason(s) for Decision: Bethany discussed w/ Jeff - approved since good agent and surcharge/low value.

Risk Details: 1950 home w/updates. 2-3 year lapse as they couldn't find coverage. Insd is FD Lieutenant. 30 min response time due to volunteer, dirt roads and gate. 1/2 acre pond 300' from property. Agent surcharged prem 50%. Zip code match on  FireLine with a 4 rating.

2014 home (was a restaurant- it moved and insd converted it to their home). Bait shop on premises covered commercially (bldg and liab). Delta excluded other str and added Total Business exclusion form.

• Confirmation of at least 15 feet separation between the bait shop and the dwelling
• Confirmation that the bait shop is staffed with regular posted hours, and customers do not come to the dwelling to get assistance
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Went over 30 days, so agt sent again; confirmed OK to offer terms as previously agreed.  6/5/17 okay with 10% surcharge and SNL.

Risk Details: 1954 frame cabin, updated in 1996. Elec baseboard heat. Access by boat, no vehicle. FD has access by boat and water pumped from lake. VMGA $1214. Agt to get pumper info and wbs quest.

Risk Details: Insured owns entire building. Lower level will be their art and furniture business. Upper level will be their home. Avg condition per online photos. 1939 building w/flat roof. Water stain on ceiling noted in online photos. Total business exclusion quoted.
Reason(s) for Decision: Check ACV-bldg is 3720 SF. Add $5K water dmg ded due to flat roof and possible stain. Also existing damage excl. Make sure coml covers personal loss due to TBE exclusions. Confirm $100K oth str noted in email. Exclude liab - unknown amt of foot traffic. Sugg quote as commercial w/ insd renting apt and writing an HO4.

Risk Details: 1994 year built with complete updates to everything in 2016. PC 10 with response time listed of 40 minutes. Unprotected quest shows volunteer FD that is 25 miles away. 7 miles of the road is gravel. No hydrant/dry hydrant. Currently rated at $.75 per $100.
Reason(s) for Decision: The rest of the risk was acceptable. Allowing exception given low TIV. Confirmed through ISO and google search that response time is right around 40 minutes. Given time, partial gravel road, and volunteer FD a higher rate will be needed in order to approve. Approved terms subject to using a rate of $.85/$100 which is a premium of $1,637.

Risk Details: Agent wondering if okay to include Personal Injury and ID Fraud on a rental quote. Allison is out of town and Ashley wants to review.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved subject to verification of their Standard Procedure. We are okay with the coverages - could be duplicate from primary and then unnecessary. Asked Ashley to confirm named insured is titled and no other members.

Risk Details: 1940 building w/updates. No alarms, no losses. Coml building not used for business in 20 years. Relatives stay here when visiting. Shares wall w/small business. Zoned coml, but residency okay with zoning.
Reason(s) for Decision: Make sure seasonal use and not a vacant coml building. Need uw ? Answered on app.

Risk Details: Home was built in 1952 and updated of masonry construction.  PC3 with no alarms and no losses. Storage facility on premises(home behind). GL in place, and quoted with TBE
Reason(s) for Decision: Reviewed online photos, home pretty close to business. Due to potential amount of traffic on premise (about 10 per month per questionnaire) and type of risk, OK with x-liab and tbe

Risk Details: 1963 home updated in brush. Prior carrier Fair Plan. Insd has batting cage on property that is used by son and sometimes children from son's baseball team.
Reason(s) for Decision: Exclude liab. Verify why w/Fair plan. Ok if due to brush.

Risk Details: 2015 home owned by an LLC but the applicant is Chris Comstock - DJ Marshmellow.
Reason(s) for Decision: Young EDM DJ. Concern of parties, etc. Phys dmg and liab concerns.

Risk Details: Retailer advised this is PC4, app says 4x, described as 4 miles to FD, no hydrant. Verified w/Verisk and they say this is a 9.  Tanker brings 2500 gallons.
Reason(s) for Decision: Rate as PC9. Discussed 2500 gallon w/Product and all are okay.

Risk Details: 1984 home (adding roof exclusion) quoting on a DP1 since small and not accessible year round. Insured is the fire chief. Woodstove that is "primary" but since not used in winter, isn't used much. Installed by insured, so ok w/clearances.

Risk Details: Frame home built in 2008. Original wiring, plumbing and roofing. Heat completely updated in 2018. Roof is metal. Had large fire loss in February 2018 over $300k. Insurance Score is an 'S'.
Reason(s) for Decision: I am not seeing a fire station within .1 miles but about a 15 minute response time. Coupled with a volunteer fire department response, this would be ineligible for the program unless confirm the address was incorrect or the correct fire station address.

Risk Details: Three buildings on the premises. Main smaller home and larger newly renovated rental. Homes built in 1900 and 1986 (rental).
Reason(s) for Decision: Referred due to unusual limits. Coverage B is higher than A as large home is rental unit (newly renovated).

Risk Details: Updates on all systems except plumbing which is original, 1901.
Reason(s) for Decision: Plumbing in early 1900's was lead, with 100 yr life expectancy.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Followed up with written email.

Risk Details: metal building, 1-2 blocks from his lake home, stores boats and PWC's, has small living space (kitchen and bath), appraisal included
Reason(s) for Decision: premium OK for risk

Risk Details: Open loss with reserve of $250,000 - The insured's dog (boxer/mastiff) got out of his fence and jumped on an elderly neighbor who fell and fractured her pelvis.  Still owns dog.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved as quoted, with xliability and animal exclusion

Risk Details: 1958 frame home updated heat in 2018, plumbing in 2008 and roof in 1998. 20 minute response time.

Risk Details: Written on pol MPLCO00001138, but delays in inspection as wasn't disclosed home is inaccessible from october-april. Log home, 1934 build date, in brush, 5 min response time in summer

Risk Details: 1920 dwelling w/WBS as heat. Updates to other systems. Prof installed WBS.  $1.06 rate

Risk Details: 1964 home updated. 48 acres near paved road. 11 road miles to FD. 20 min response time. Volunteer. Accessible.

Risk Details: 1935 home w/roof update in 2002, wiring update in 1997, plumbing update in 1997. No heat source - woodburning stove is primary heat. No fire department, on lake, no sprinkler, no alarms. 647 SF cabin. Online photos look okay. This is on an island NW of Minneapolis on an inland lake.  $912 rate = $0.75

This will be a definite total if a fire starts. Evaluating exposure to see if we are comfortable taking that on. May consider with a higher rate like $1.25 or $1.50 per $100/TIV.  Discussed w/Louisa. 50% s/c at minimum. We do not want to be low on premium against competition. Asked agent for feedback before finalizing terms.

Risk Details: 1900 home w/updated. High RC but partner says they are insuring for ACV. Printing business in basement. No employees, no foot traffic, prints real estate booklet for realtor's monthly listings. Has a GL.

Risk Details: 1948 home updated in 2015-2016. No heat. Water is drained. $2500 ded and surcharge due to no ins since purchase. 2 different families named on the app.

Risk Details: $110,000 dwelling with $150,000 garage.

Risk Details: Client purchased year ago, paid cash, no insurance since

Risk Details: 1978 frame home. PC10. Primary heat is a fireplace. Not accessible year round. Still has plumbing and electric. Cabin not used in winter.

However, at this point, we cannot include liability.

Risk Details: 1950 home w/updates. Business on property. Insd owns building and rents it to a gift shop/massage studio.

• Apply Total Business Exclusion

Risk Details: 1946 home updated in 2000. Insured runs daycare in home licensed for 12 children. Has GL in place.

• Excluding liability  
• Please do not add form BWH0141 as this risk does not qualify for the Burns & Wilcox Daycare program
• GL must remain in place, controlled by agent
• Include Total Business Exclusion form – please make sure insured is aware of the restrictions of this form for an in home business.  If any loss occurs related to the business, claims will deny the loss.  (e.g. A bottle warmer used for a daycare child shorts out, starts a fire and the house burns to the ground. Claims would deny all damage to the home, contents, etc.)

1920 home updated. Insured runs 12 child daycare in home. Wants total business excl. 5/16 Hail $12K; 8/16 Wind $3868. Found 2 other losses on app 5/12 Hail $10K; 5/13 Wind $6585. No info on where daycare is insured.
Reason(s) for Decision:
• 5% (five percent) W/H ded = $7811
• Add 15% additional surcharge/debit for frequency/severity of W/H claims
• Excluding liability – we’re not comfortable offering liability with a daycare in the home
• Include Total Business Exclusion form – please make sure insured is aware of the severe restrictions of this form for an in home business.  If any loss occurs related to the business, claims will deny the loss.  (e.g. A bottle warmer used for a daycare child shorts out, starts a fire and the house burns to the ground. Claims would deny all damage to the home and contents.)
• A commercial liability policy for the daycare must be in place (this lets us know the risk has been underwritten and gives us a comfort level with our property exposure)

Risk Details: 1910 home gutted and remodeled in 2016. 10% ord/law. Rented 10-14 weeks. Per agt home is beautiful. Found online historic district that encompasses 48 buildings in this area.
Reason(s) for Decision:
• With this home being on the National Registry, are there ever any tours conducted of the home, or any events held at the home related to this?
• Could you please forward me either a recent inspection or a web address to look at interior/exterior photos?
• Was the interior completely gutted, or was some of the architecture maintained?  Are walls drywall or plaster?  Original woodwork or new?  Any unique features inside?
• What are the attributes of the home that have it on the historic register.
• Is this quoted with Modified Functional Replacement Cost?• What kind of requirements are there from the registry for maintaining the condition or features should a loss occur?
• Do you need the 6% credit to be competitive?  We typically add a 10% surcharge for homes on National Registry due to additional exposure if there is a loss.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Agreed to write with MFRC and 10% surcharge per answers from agent.

• How deep was the snow that caused the collapse

• Was there a structural issue with the home that caused the collapse?
• Is there any maintenance plan in place to deal with this in the future?
Roof exclusion required if not fully updated.
