Risk Details: 2017 home purchased by realtor insureds and leased back to builder as model. Alarms/camera. Employee present, otherwise locked. Agt proposing TBE & full coverage.
Reason(s) for Decision:
• I see the insured's are realtors.  What do they intend to do with the home after the year is up?
• Are the insured’s involved as the property realtors and/or do they have any business involvement or connection with the builders?
• Is the builder's office in this dwelling, or is it just used as a model?
• What occupancy was used in the rating?  Tenant or vacant?
• What is being insured under Cov C?

This may be leaning toward a commercial exposure, I'm trying to evaluate if I can fit it into our program.  If we can, I'd probably propose issuing excluding liability because of the exposure and public traffic.  I’d also propose not applying the Total Business Exclusion.  I’m concerned that the TBE is going to really limit the coverage because everything that would happen (other than weather) could be attributed to the business.    //  8/7 approved subj to rate as vacant, no liab, agt call on TBE

Forwarded info to Dawn Denzler-Trace (contact per Corporate Pol Prefix List) that insured is keeping the dog per the PL submission, and that we declined. // Markel commercial advised they will be non-renewing the risk. Risk Details: 1941 rental. Open liability loss from 2/8/16. Tenant visitor slipped on one of the steps.

Asked addl info about the claim. If it checks out we could proceed.   • Has anything been paid yet or are they anticipating $6,000 will be it?  
• Any indication this is not a legitimate loss?  
• Where were the steps located?  
• What were the conditions surrounding the loss?  
• What was wrong with the steps?  
• What has the insured done to rectify the situation?
• What is holding up the loss from being settled?
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Per Delta, There is 6,000 in the reserve and nothing has been paid out yet. The person was a visitor to see the tenant and stepped on one of the steps going to the back door, the board came loose and he fell and hurt his knee. The steps have been repaired. They believe they are waiting to make sure about his knee.  Considered this to be acceptable and don't see a concern starting a new policy.

System Reason(s) for Referral: Business -Manor and guest house on prem
Risk Details: Insured operates Greystone Manor and a guest house for vaca rental. On a CGL. One of the other structures is now their residence. 1940 no updates listed.
Reason(s) for Decision:
• Please add the guest house to the CGL. I’d like to keep all the vacation rental exposure off our policy since it has a CGL.
• Home is 1940 – no updates are listed.  Must have acceptable plumbing, electrical and heat updates.  Roof exclusion applies if not updated.
• App says “On same premises as business family owns”. If that is the Greystone Manor Vaca Rental, that is fine. If it is something else, please advise.
• Please add the total business exclusion.  This will eliminate any exposure to other structures and liability for Greystone Manor and the guest house.
• If the owner occupied home were the only structure on its own legal address; with the guest house and the Manor on a separate address; we could reconsider the total business exclusion.  Although I am still thinking it would be wise to keep it in place.

Risk Details: 2019 year built metal building that has a living residence for the applicant and a personal shop that is used to store ATVs, personal projects, etc. There are 6-10 cattle on the property for personal use.

Approved subject to confirmation there is no business use or renting of the shop/land, confirmation heating, plumbing, and electric were done by a professional, and confirmation there is no WBS or other supp heat, as those are common in risks like this.

Reason(s) for Decision: Gave parameters for quoting. Advised Cov A may be high. $200/SF.

Risk Details: 1913 home being lifted to replace foundation.
Reason(s) for Decision: Concern w/ what gaps in covg there may be from contractor.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Discussed w/Jeff

Risk Details: Dwelling is 10 miles from the 99% contained Tubbs fire in Santa Rosa area. Can we make an exception?
Reason(s) for Decision: Sent to Jeff for review - he approved. Subject to lapse surcharge and signed no loss stmt.

Risk Details: 1920 condo w/full updates in 1998. Cov C is only $5K. D is $41,600 reasonable.
Reason(s) for Decision: Revise guidelines so this does not need to be referred in the future.

Risk Details: 1892 home w/updates in 2005. Open liab loss $20K. Tenant tripped on damaged floor. Housing Authority required flooring repairs.
Reason(s) for Decision: Older homes require good maintenance and condition along with full updates. The loss is an indication this is a concern.

Risk Details: 2017 home insured rents to 4 grad students of Rowan university.  Built in 2017. Online pic shows prev home on the lot.
Reason(s) for Decision:
• Confirm there is a vetting process in place to screen the students (such as background check, deposit)
• Confirm there is some limitation in place to the number of visitors (to avoid big parties on the private off campus property)
• Acceptable LLC form
• Add a generous surcharge for the increased liability and physical damage exposure

Risk Details: floating home in Acworth. PC10-no alarms, no losses.
Reason(s) for Decision: Asking several questions regarding stability of the home should the water level fall or rise.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: We declined and also advised Burns we are not a market for floating homes.  They may be able to get hull coverage form through Marine.

Risk Details: 1994 home - new purchase. Insured has a bankruptcy. Does not want to give ss# and dob as he doesn’t want hits on his credit report. Confirmed with Lex/Nex that it will show as an inquiry.
Reason(s) for Decision: Unable to help. Suggested the customer ck w/bank to ask if ins co inquiry would reflect negatively.

Risk Details: 1900 dwelling with updates listed on app within past two years. However, referral noted knob and tube is still used and amps are only 75 amps. Plumbing is not fully updated and OHQ indicates cast iron and galvanized is still present. 3 family rental. Asking if we will allow DP-1 subject to electrical being updated within 30 days.
Reason(s) for Decision: Not willing to make an exception to issue policy with k&t present. As such, approved subject to k&t replaced/updated to 100 amp circuits prior to binding. Was also going to apply water exclusion due to plumbing condition, but since this is DP1 there is no need as water damage is not covered.

Risk Details: Y fork in road, one side leads to business office (no foot traffic), other side leads to home. Occasional fixing of their business cars in the other structure. When home deed to insured after passing of father, had trouble secruing insurance so accepted force placed. Mortgage to be paid off, so now wants coverage.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved; CGL pol in place for business exposured-advised approval subject to maintaining that cov. Great insurance score. Reviewed with mgr and agreed ok with former forced placed coverage.

Risk Details: COC submission for a home that will be the insured’s primary upon completion. The home is old (built 1929) and currently has knob and tube wiring. The agent advised all electrical and plumbing will replaced shortly after escrow closes
Reason(s) for Decision: approval with complete updates w/in 30 days after closing

Risk Details: 2006 condo with 4 units. Insd has a property management co office in one and rents 3 others on a short term basis. Can't tell if owner lives here or just has their office here. Separate access to office. Has commercial policy in place. Quoted with Total Business Exclusion
Reason(s) for Decision: Must have owner occupancy to qualify. Otherwise, this is office and rental and should go commercial.  Could not tell from description if owner lived here.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: This is a condo exposure, so .21 rate is okay.

Risk Details: 1998 home quoted by agent at the end of June for an 8/3 effective date. They received bind request. Also includes a $125K fine arts schedule
Reason(s) for Decision: No to the schedule. Gave Jamie Gregory info. Jeff's email to agt advises we will honor existing quotes. Gave heads up to Jamie.

Risk Details: 1989 home w/updates. No losses. Has alarms. Prior lapse and bankruptcy due to husband passing away.
Reason(s) for Decision: Due to lapse and bankruptcy.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Ins score E.  Discussed with JB and we agree with lapse and bankruptcy, just decline.

Risk Details: Detwiler Fire (Mariposa County) is 17 miles away and heading away from the risk. Can we bind eff 7/27 which is date closing takes place.
Reason(s) for Decision: Only 7% contained - new fire. Agent rarely asks for these exceptions but too soon to consider this one. Agent will monitor and resubmit if they still need an exception next week.//7/24 sent again. Fire 50% contained and admitted markets are lifting moratoriums. Online site shows fire 5 miles closer to property. Extensive damage, evac orders till in place. Advised Alex I can't send this to management. Decline stands.//Fire cleared and risk was bound 8/30/17
Audit Notes: See if anything was ever written for this insured. We declined.

Risk Details: 2019 year built (being reconstructed after total fire loss). Not clear as to whether COC has started or yet to start. AmWINS stated COC will be with another carrier but want to place HO3 with us afterwards. $200k+ fire loss, did not receive C&O or fire marshal report.
Reason(s) for Decision: Pended to ask for clarification on status of COC. Not sure as to whether that has started, is completed, or yet to begin. Also, will need to review C&O or fire marshal report as that information was not included with claim docs that were submitted, only payout amounts. // MP 4/16/19 Received C&O-cause of fire was lightning strike. Approved HO3 primary w/June date; or HO3 builders risk now. Submit pricing so I can add surcharge and give final rate.

Risk Details: Insured has been self insuring for 2 years. She is a doctor. No claims. 1994 masonry home. Looks nice online. Ran insurance score and it is decent.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved subject to a 10% surcharge on the technical premium for the lapse.

Risk Details: 1967 home updated. Insd has dog boarding business on premises run out of a separate structure. Has GL and Prop on the business.
Reason(s) for Decision: Confirm updates - app doesn't list. Viewed aerial view of home property which shows adequate separation of home and business. Barn behind home accounts for $25K Cov B. With separation and GL/Prop in place and TBE, concerns are minimal.

Risk Details: 2018 new build, insured is a contractor and built the house constr completed in Nov and they did not consider the need for ins at the time. 3 star ins score = credit.  PC10 volunteer FD.
Reason(s) for Decision: Okay with 15% surcharge for lapse (total) and signed no loss. Also existing dmg excl. Mapped FD to residence - 7.4 miles/10 min. Should be less than 15 min response.

Risk Details: Greenhouse on property; grow/sell vegetables, garden tools, no marijuana. Owner/wife only employees, customers arrive via car, 1938 build, want FRC (all complete updates except plumbing-partial)
Reason(s) for Decision: TBE, GL, and FRC (all were quoted by agent). Per FB page, greenhouse and fun center (appears occasional "fairy parties"). Advised agt be sure GL covers this exposure as well

Risk Details: This insured was non-renewed due to loss of appetite and brush concerns.  They have recently moved earth and built a pad in which to build a 2-car detached garage (1020 sq') and are just waiting for the permits to come through before their contractor starts. Partial wiring in 2017, plumbing (2008), heating (1988), roof (2008).
Reason(s) for Decision: Confirm fire department accessibility as the road is very narrow, make sure the contractor is covered and exclude the deck until it has been repaired.

Risk Details: 1954 home w/updates. Insured is young singer/songwriter. No adverse info. Quote includes $1M liab/$1M PI.
Reason(s) for Decision: Reviewed online info - ok. // 8/23 Danielle asked for 25%/50% ERC. OK as long as Cov A is 100% ITV.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Jeff reviewing - approved. Case by case basis on the Personal Injury. In this case, okay.

Risk Details: 1941 dwelling with current updates. Could not find online photo. Home will be raised by licensed contractor. No mention of builders risk. Insd is a director/producer.
Reason(s) for Decision: Verify builders risk. Confirm this is frame, not something unique like houseboat. (Address brings up a marina. Other unique dwellings in that area.) Is it being raised over water? If so, resubmit with full details of contractor plan.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: .46 rate. Probably builders risk.

Risk Details: 1979 frame home updated. No losses. Rustic but nice looking treehouse photo. Access is by ladder. Insufficient balusters on railing.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved subj to confirmation that the risk is a home, and this is an other structure in the yard. $25K Cov B is okay. Exclude liability.

Risk Details: Agent sent it over because the prior owner had a fire loss in 2016 for $14k. Applicant is just purchasing this property.
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised that we are not worried about losses that occurred under prior owner, unless for some reason it was brought to their attention that the damages were not yet repaired.

Risk Details: Referred because it is a metal building. Built in 2019. Living area is 2400 sq ft, total area of building is 8000 sq ft. Per agent email, other area is used to store ATV, boats, and toys.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approving risk subject to confirmation that the other storage area is for the applicants personal use only and that there is no renting to others for storage or living purposes, and also no business use.

Risk Details: $120,000 claim on prior home
Reason(s) for Decision: Fire claim--requested cause and origin or fire report for review of specific causes

Risk Details: family counselor, 10 patients a week, separate area in home
Reason(s) for Decision: TBE and GL in place; online review OK

Risk Details: 1919 home w/original roof. Inspected, painted, sealed regularly. Last done in 2012. Online photos look great. Plumb part updated in 2012. Question about prior carrier.
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked Anella for info on plumbing and prior carrier. Will approve If it checks out. Reviewed risk w/Tim. Plumbing is updated. Confirm at inspection. Not nonrenewed.

Risk Details: 1995 home; new pipes installed under the home, new furnace, new roof and new fence. Has 6 losses since 12/11/14. 2 wind; 2 are related, furnace breakdown/freeze, water line failed, water leak on roof.
Reason(s) for Decision: Long list of additional questions to evaluate the loss history.

Risk Details: 1951 home w/ full updates in 2016 (1995 per app). 20 minute response time. No time to nonrenew. Will NRN in 2020. Prem $17,111 w/ new brush s/c and PC10.
Reason(s) for Decision: Renew now, set up for NRN in 2020. Did not add any addl prem for 20 min response time. Expiring was around $4K.

Risk Details: Risk is 2/3 rental and 1/3 flower shop.
Reason(s) for Decision: This belongs on a commercial policy - no owner occupancy.

Risk Details: 1909 church structure with updates almost complete. Liab currently extended from AO homeowners ins.  No current plans for the structure. Lapse since purchase.
Reason(s) for Decision: Lapse, no plans, unique structure.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Ins score M. Gigantic church building.

System Reason(s) for Referral: response time over 20 minutes and woodstove is the primary heat source.
Risk Details: 1994 build year, log, used during summer months only so wood stove will very rarely be used. Response time 20-25 in summer, 30 in winter.
Reason(s) for Decision: Lower value, wood stove won't  be used much (if any). Agt applied 10% surcharge. Advised approval subject to appropriate winterization

Risk Details: 2016 frame and straw bale/stucco. No liability requested (seasonal). Medium per RM. Moderate per FireLine.
Reason(s) for Decision: Discussed with Jeff.  We do not wish to be a market for straw bale construction.

Risk Details: 1960 home tenant occupied and sometimes property is used for fishing by owner. 3 oth structures exceed 50% of Cov A.  (garage and 2 barns). There is corn grown on the property. No mention of animals or what the barns are used for. No liability requested. Lapse - agent applying ded and getting SNL.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved subj to confirmation of personal use of structures, no hay or other flammable storage.

Risk Details: 1921 home updated. Tree trimming business - administrative work on premises. No traffic. Add total business excl. Has GL.
Reason(s) for Decision: Online source shows insd addr as business addr. Where do employees meet and where is equip stored. Total Business Excl ok, may need building excl.  // 7/24/17 addl info from Danielle - employees come to prem and business equip and trucks are stored in a pole barn 60' from home. Approved with TBE and building excl. GL must remain in place.

Risk Details: Loss of use listed as 450,000 (confirm). Built in 1999, frame and vinyl siding. In ground pool with approved fence. Large water loss of $144k.
Reason(s) for Decision: Remove 5% credit as they have a large water loss.  Agree with water exclusion.

Risk Details: Dwelling in Malibu not in brush. No alarm, flat roof. Agent applied $10KAOP deductible.
Reason(s) for Decision: Nice home just east of PCH

Risk Details: 1972 home. 22 acres behind home (per online pics) are rented out to a farmer-he is adding our insd as AI on his GL. Insd inherited home in 2014 and didn't insure. Now with tenant, they are needing to insure.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved with 20% surcharge for lapse of 2 years; confirm no concern with wiring or plumbing, signed statement of no loss, photo, $2500 ded due to lapse.

Risk Details: 2 losses-02/2016-line burst on washer (no payout), 02/14/2018-water line burst, fixed
Reason(s) for Decision: $2500 AOP ded, all repairs done

Risk Details: 3 wind claims in '14&'15 $2600, $2000, $400. Frame home on river.
Reason(s) for Decision: $5000 wind/hail ded. No personal injury. No adverse info on the insured.

Risk Details: Insured had roof claim. Replaced roof, but not in time for SF NRN. SF didn't approved of asphalt roof.
Reason(s) for Decision: Brand new roof w/1% wind/hail ded, 2% lapse S/C

Risk Details: 3 brothers own the property under this corporate name. No update info. 1948 home
Reason(s) for Decision:
• An acceptable corporate questionnaire
• Acceptable update information on this 1948 home
• No roof updates listed – please exclude roof

Risk Details: 3 water claims in 3.5 years-01/18-pipe broke-$3500, 01/28/16-water damage-5600, 03/04/15-ice dam ($0); quoted with $5K Water ded
Reason(s) for Decision: approved as quoted

Risk Details: 1930 home with plumbing, electrical and HVAC updates. The home has knob and tube wiring in the attic only. Would like to explore ability to write with renovation endorsement for 30 days to replace/remove the wiring.
Reason(s) for Decision: Looked back at prior knob and tube and this seems to be acceptable. Will need all of it removed and the attic must not be live until it is fixed

Risk Details: greenhouse on property, no marijuana, TBE applied, GL in place
Reason(s) for Decision: appropriate exclusions in place

Risk Details: LLC-one member, established for real estate holdings. 1970's build year, all systems updated in 2005
Reason(s) for Decision: Home updated, LLC questionnaire acceptable, value OK, Google search of company yielded no concerns

Risk Details: 1974 home w/updated heating and roof. 120 acres. No business or farming. Other structures coverage should be excluded per app.

Risk Details: 1953 risk updated in brush no alarms. Was not referred by branch at NB. Over 15 min response time. Was issued as PC4, it is PC10.
Reason(s) for Decision: Not comfortable with response time. >15 min drive time, volunteer FD, no alarms, secondary. Cc'd Danielle - another referral issue.

Risk Details: 2016 dwelling w/ prior garage and house fire due to careless smoking. Fire marshal report included.
Reason(s) for Decision: Careless smoking

Risk Details: 1997 home, ins lapsed with AAA due to billing error. Co refuses to reinstate. Agency failed to submit for approval. Got bind request today and came for approval.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved with no surcharge as agent had already quoted. $1555 premium

Risk Details: tuck under garage, plastic forming machinist with workshop in garage; GL in place for business operation; quoted with TBE
Reason(s) for Decision: received acceptable info regarding business (no employees, no customers, just a large machine to make plastic covers).

Risk Details: Agent asking if we can match expiring premium of $4007. Renewal prem is $5837. Average risk
Reason(s) for Decision: Increase due to AAL rating. Explained we did not implement caps or stair-stepped incr/decr.

Risk Details: Lapse of over one year after non-renewed by Nationwide. In brush. Built in 1956 with partial updates to wiring (2000), plumbing (2003) and heating (2000). The roof was replaced in 2015. No alarm or sprinklers.
Reason(s) for Decision: Confirm that the brush and vegetation is within guidelines. Rush inspection. Signed notice of loss. Minimum AOP deductible of $5k and no discount applied for this. Apply surcharge of 15% for length of lapse and no reason.

Risk Details: No coverage since 07/2016, 1965 build with updates, insured just didn't want coverage, home no for sale, no prior loss
Reason(s) for Decision: there appears to be some issues with the property itself (missing siding, missing front steps, damaged foundation). It also appears to have been of commercial usage.  It’s concerning as well that they were willing to go without insurance for so long, but now when it is time to sale the home they attempt to purchase a policy (perhaps the realtor is suggesting/requiring that they do so?).
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Advised if want us to consider further info can do so

Risk Details: 2008 condo purchased in 2009. Insd is a doctor. Never understood that insurance was needed. All other exposures insured with AIG. New agent uncovered the uninsured property.
Reason(s) for Decision: Agreed to write with a total of 30% surcharge due to prior lapse.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: I ran ins score - 887. Very good. I can understand how this could happen with a condo. The facts make sense and the insurance score supports a good risk.  No losses since 2009.

Risk Details: Primary heat is fireplace. Home was built in 1950. PC is listed as 4, but sent as a PC 9. Corrected. Jill said baseboard heaters are throughout. Home built in 1950 with full updates in '95 and roof in '07. Firewood is up against the home and agent has requested them remove it.
Reason(s) for Decision: Looks like there are baseboard heaters for all rooms except the main one, which is a fireplace.

Risk Details: Frame home build in 2000. Roof has not been replaced yet. There was a garage fire in January 18 for $40k. Water loss in April 17 for $1200.
Reason(s) for Decision: Water loss was small. Waiting on garage fire investigation. Fire due to insured burning paper in a metal container, then she placed it in the garage on the cement floor next to the garbage can. They suspect the embers started the fire. Pending inspection, roof should be either ACV or excluded due to the age.

Risk Details: Little info on the home itself.  Issue is the LLC, ownership, and occupancy.  This is an investment property being handled under a 1031 Exchange with triple net lease insd can buy another investment property. LLC is the lender and sale is expected to take 3 weeks. LLC would be AI.
Reason(s) for Decision: Similar to a land contract where owner is the LLC. Comfortable with the situation.

Risk Details: 1930 dwelling undergoing "cosmetic" updates. Agt asking if it should be builders risk. Insured is the GC per app. 3 fam per online info; single family per submission. Agt also asked if this barrier island is eligible.
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked numerous questions re condition, work being done. If more than minor and insd is GC, risk is ineligible. May have asbestos siding. Location ok per 2/18 email updated guidelines. Provided copy. // 1/16 Barbara confirmed asbestos siding - ineligible. Borderline on whether this should have a GC.  Rear cottage would have needed to be excluded.

Risk Details: $75K water loss (master toilet leak), insured dilegently checks on toilet to insure integrity
Reason(s) for Decision: water dmg ded $10K, only loss, approved but requested 1-2% surcharge

Risk Details: 2 loss in last 4 years-10/2014-water damage, 01/07/2018-jewelry and cameras stolen
Reason(s) for Decision: Water ded and all perils ded at least $5K

Risk Details: 1924 dwelling with updates. Home was the feature of a book Dispatches from Pluto. Individuals rent through AirBnB. App notes an event to "launch the house" Online lists horses and centralized hunting headquarters. 20 min response time. No galvanized. WBS are decorative, not used.
Reason(s) for Decision: Suggested event policy for the house launch as business excl may apply. Need WBS quests or permanently seal loading doors.

Risk Details: Built in 1993. Full roof update in 2013. Frame home with 5 losses. 2 wind/hail, 1 jewelry theft, 1 water, 1 sump pump failure
Reason(s) for Decision: Will need separate policy for jewelry. No water backup. Water deductible of $5k.

Risk Details: PC 9, 2016 build year, no prior claims
Reason(s) for Decision: Approval, subject to confirmation that FD within acceptable distance and sufficient water trucks

Risk Details: 2007 dwelling. Insd owns a petting zoo which is taken off site. Has 65 acres with a barn where animals are kept.  CGL in place. Animal exclusion, Total Business Exclusion quoted.
Reason(s) for Decision: Research online showed visitors at the insured premises and their website offered visitors to come.  Concern of excessive defense costs should something happen. (Large animals, pony/camel rides.)

Risk Details: Insured is renting out single bedroom through AIRBNB/VRBO for one night at a time.
Reason(s) for Decision: Minimum 3 nights required in an owner occupied case like this per Jeff. We are looking at AIRBNB issue overall.

Risk Details: in home caregiver for a bed ridden family. TBE and GL in place. 69 of 75 acres leased for farming
Reason(s) for Decision: Unable to locate any photos of the property online, to get a good understanding of the separation of the home and the farm land. But as long as there is clear, sufficient, separation of the two you have approval to offer terms on this risk. As stated, the terms would need to include the total business exclusion and the GL policy in place. I would also suggest requiring the farming business to have a liability policy in place to cover that exposure. If they do not have one in place, then I would suggest taking an additional 10-15% to address the possibility of a claim being filed on our policy that we may have to defend against.

Risk Details: 1979 dwelling with 2010 roof update. Insured has daycare on premises. Applying for a GL. Empty and fenced pool on premises. Agent asking for liab with pool exclusion and TBE.
Reason(s) for Decision: No liab/no med pay per guidelines. (concern of defense costs). TBE, still need GL in place as TBE excludes everything. Reminded this would not be in the Markel Day Care program. Online source shows 10 children license. App says 5-6.

Risk Details: 31 minute respond time, $2500 ded, 1000 County Road 11 Craig, CO 81625
Reason(s) for Decision: Approval with 15% surcharge due to PC; confirmed truly no rental. Insured family is large and when go in town use both homes to house.

Risk Details: 31 minute respond time, $2500 ded, 6041 County Road 11 Craig, CO 81625
Reason(s) for Decision: Approval with 15% surcharge due to PC; confirmed truly no rental. Insured family is large and when go in town use both homes to house.

Risk Details: Home built in 1905 w/ comp updates noted on app.  Location is 21 miles or 30 mins from responding FD in Gunnison, CO.  Agent has is listed as a PC=9 but based on distance to FD, it is a PC=10.  Not visible to neighbors and located north of small town of Ohio City on dirt road.  No CSA.  $1K AOP and $1K W/H deds.
Reason(s) for Decision: Declined due to remote location, lack of proven updates, and distance to responding FD.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Ins score is G

Risk Details: 1966 home with updates to heating in 2017 and roof 2016. 4 losses within lasts 3 years, 3 paid. 4/2016 wind loss causing roof damage and further water leaking $20k, 12/2017 heat pump froze $9k, 12/2017 Wind damage, damage to chimney $1100. High insurance score.
Reason(s) for Decision: The number of wind claims seemed odd for the area. As such, approved subject to a $5k AOP, then a $10k water ded and surcharge for the 3 losses.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Very good insurance score

Risk Details: Renewal date is 1/13/17. Asked for confirmation if we can NRN. If not, $5K ded and 15% surcharge over expiring. Appx. $2210.
Reason(s) for Decision: Subj to $5K ded and 15% surcharge.

Risk Details: 1946 home updated in 2009 with 1 prior wind loss. Insured has bankruptcy in 2014 due to medical and business debt.  Bankruptcy is now discharged.  Has active medical collections.  PC 9 visible, accessible, good response time.
Reason(s) for Decision: Kristine- 734; Paul - 715  Both scores equate to a discounted rate, so I felt we could approve.  Asked for rush inspection and older home supplement.

Risk Details: Insured owns construction company. Large outbuilding on premise, has 2 employees.
Reason(s) for Decision: Asking several follow up questions- also note, home is for sale.

Risk Details: Risk is in Palm Beach County.
Reason(s) for Decision: Currently under moratorium.

Risk Details: 1968 home w/ part updates. One prior lightning loss 7/17 $9K. Has power washing co which operates out of trailers on the property. Business structures will be specifically excluded. No customers. Has employees. GL in place.  Also wants liab extended
Reason(s) for Decision: Business structure w/hazardous stairs will be excluded. With TBE and Coml policies in place, exposure is eliminated. TBE, Coml pol, need OHQ. Confirm Cov B okay. Offered possibility of Stand Alone Other Structure for the prop w/pavilion. // 5/13/19 agent asked to release ACV terms. Approved w/same subj.

Risk Details: 1982 seasonal home 20-25 min response time. Med brush for RM, high per FL. Caretaker watches over home and has access to a tanker. Woodstove is primary heat, only used when there seasonally, pipes drained when not there. <150' clearance. 4 different LLC members which represent 3 families who use it one family at a time year round.  Woodstove quest sounds great.
Reason(s) for Decision: Need to know LLC member relationship as we would be covering interests of 4 people.  Need to surcharge for PC10.

Risk Details: Insured had bankruptcy 4 years ago. Winemaker, Mrs is music director. Not in brush. Was with RPS for 5 years. Wants to bind today.
Reason(s) for Decision: Insurance score look pretty good. Group 10. Online photo shows basic ranch.

Risk Details: Home is rented out for 4 weeks during the Coachella Music Festival (mixed genre).
Reason(s) for Decision: Rate for rental use; apply form; screen renters - not a party house.

Risk Details: 1953 w/full updates in 2018. Fire loss, undetermined on 7/15/17. $130,000. Report provided is first responder fire dept report.
Reason(s) for Decision: This was submitted by another retail agent.  This quote has different coverages. New agt wanted matching rate, but coverages are higher.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Same terms: Rate as 2 family. Definitely want fire marshal report to give us more info. Decline if we can't get comfortable with a cause. No adverse online info. Not agreeing to matching rate for diff coverages.

Risk Details: 1971 home fully updated in 2000. PC10 in brush. Electric heat. Visible to multiple neighbors. 13.7 miles FD, 20 min response. Road becomes gravel - asked how far FD would have to go on gravel. Is it subject to washout or closure? FireLine is High-7
Reason(s) for Decision: Per email from Ben and agent, road is subject to closing in the winter. No alarms. This will be a total if a fire starts.

Risk Details: 2012 dwelling rated as brush as RiskMeter not producing a result. Prior NRN due to FireLine w/admitted carrier. Insd has 85 acres with chickens and 7 sheep used for weed abatement. No farming.  Agt applied animal exclusion.
Reason(s) for Decision: Will verify no large barns and how dwelling is situated on the acreage. With no animal liab, risk is average. Brush s/c applied. FireLine is a zip match, but not above 9.

Risk Details: 1978 home. When insureds travel, they will rent out their home for 3 night min thru VRBO.
1996 home. Insured has auto repair business on premises.
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked many questions regarding the exposure. We have approved these occasionally in the past.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Talked to John at JMW briefly on the topic of auto repair and told him these can sometimes be acceptable depending on extent of activities and separation.  I did not find any formal referral in file for this one.

Risk Details: 1937 dwelling w/partial updates. Heating is a fireplace insert - no furnace.  664 SF, not in brush. App says "Duraheat Kerosene insert w/blower". (per online, this is a portable kerosene heater). Receipt and pix seem to support Lopi Republic wood insert.
Reason(s) for Decision: Without thermostat control, we can't do a wood insert. Jenner gets cold and freeze days. (North of San Francisco). If they use a portable kerosene heater, this is ineligible.

Risk Details: 1962 converted school bought in 2010. Insured renovated. No insurance since. Now wants because of increase of tornado and hail incidents in the area. School has part metal/part flat roof. Great Pyrenes animal. 12 mi to volunteer FD. Connected shop per diagram. B ins score. Agt will add 20% s/c.
Reason(s) for Decision: Lengthy lapse was purposeful and now wants coverage because losses are increasing in area. Longer response time due to volunteer and 12 mile drive time.  Flat/metal roof. Inadequate water supply per PC. Large structure.

Risk Details: 1962 home w/no wiring or plumbing updates. FRC quoted. Cabinet making business on premises. Fire loss 1/27/17 $35K. Diesel shop heater caught fire - damaged work area and tools. Quoting w/building exclusion and TBE.  Ins score R.
Reason(s) for Decision: Combination of age of home, no wire/plumb updates, ins score, prior loss indicates possible negligence.

Risk Details: 1971 home, updates in 2014. Wind 4/01 $10k; wind 4/06 $0; wind 7/06 $1534; Froz pipe 1/14 $127k; Sewer backup 1/14 $20K; Ice dam $951. Jeff suggests $1,000 AOP; $2500-$5000 Wind; $25,000 water damage ded. Exist dmg excl.
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked Jeff if they want to place this with Markel. Asked for detail on what happened and what they have done to mitigate future loss. Turns out insured was out of town and came home to water in basement. The 3 water claims all happened at once due to warm spell with melting ice and rain. Agreed to bind and we go claim free, consider reducing water damage ded in the future.

Risk Details: 05/24/2017 $282,000 fire claim; applicant cigarette in bed; oxygen tank also in home

I found this for Jon Klingelhofer:  https://www.google.com/#q=jon+klingelhofer+construction+nv&spf=1498773224669  Since they are sharing the same address, we need to be clear on the exposure to determine if there is any concern about our insured's section of the property.
• Your note says plumbing and roof are updated, but the app says heating and plumbing.  If that is the case we would need to apply the roof exclusion to this 41 year old roof.

07/11/17 update from Danielle: Jon has used his home address and landline for his business correspondence for 40 years.  He is a home builder specializing in Victorian restoration and his work takes place elsewhere

any exposed water pipes in the crawl space under the house are wrapped in foam insulation.  the house is insulated.  Rest of subjectivities will be confirmed later. Risk Details: 2003 dwelling with daycare on premises. Excluding liability and obtaining GL. Also quoting with Total Business Exclusion.
Reason(s) for Decision:
I am assuming the daycare takes place within the home itself.  If that is the case, you are approved to release terms subject to:

• Please do not add BWH0141
• GL obtained and maintained
• Excluding liability
• Include Total Business Exclusion - please make sure insured is aware of the severe restrictions of this form for an in home business.  If any loss occurs related to the business, claims will deny the loss.  (e.g. A bottle warmer used for a daycare child shorts out, starts a fire and the house burns to the ground. Claims would deny all damage to the home and contents.)

Your email says “on premises”.  If it takes place in a separate building, terms would still be the same but we would add a subjectivity:  Building exclusion applies for building where daycare takes place.

Risk Details: primary home located in CA with 2 rentals located on the property. Home was built in 1945 of frame construction, PC9 , no alarms. Full roof update in 2003 with other full updates in 1975.

Risk Details: 2007 home. Trucking business and 30 cattle on premises. Appears to be about 40' from dwelling with separate drive per aerial view. Unknown use of cattle. Agent applying Total Business Excl, Animal Exclusion, and requiring GL.
Reason(s) for Decision:
Additional questions:
• 30 cattle - what are they used for?  Are they related to the trucking business, or a separate business?  Are cattle bought and sold?  Amy slaughtered or other processing activities on premises?
• How far apart is the trucking business garage from the dwelling?  (It looks about 40 feet in the online aerial view - please confirm)
• What are the actual activities of the trucking business
• Are they hauling products?  What kind? Anything hazardous? Any storage of hauled items on property?
• Is the truck repair on the premises for repair of their fleet or is this a mechanic operation? (Asking to determine the extent of fire hazard near the dwelling)
If terms are offered they will be subject to:
• Specific exclusion of all buildings and barns used for the trucking business and the cattle (using the Building Exclusion form)
• Total Business exclusion
• Animal exclusion
• GL policy in place
• All uw questions on the app answered (some are blank)
• PCQ
• Confirmation no employees ever go into or around the dwelling//Received addl info and agreed to remain on risk subject to items listed.

Risk Details: 1948 or 1970 dwelling tenant occupied by insured business partner. New purchase. LLC formed in May 2017. Insured will be building a commercial kitchen in the detached garage. He and tenant/partner will produce hot sauce for sale at local markets. No sales from garage.
Reason(s) for Decision:
See 9/22/email for list of questions re business.  If we are able to proceed it will be subject to:
• Total Business Exclusion form
• No other structures coverage or exclusion of the detached garage using the Building Exclusion form
• GL in place
• Roof exclusion is roof has not been replaced in last 25 years (no update per app)
• Possible 10-20% surcharge due to increased exposure to the dwelling from the business on the premises.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Must have at least 15 feet separation from the dwelling and confirmation of proper commercial suppression equipment.

Risk Details: 1970 home w/updated roof. Prior hail loss. Dwelling is a rental and occupied with full time tenant. There is a detached structure with an office. Insured employee goes there 2-3 days week to pay bills for Commercial Landscaping business. GL in place.

MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: I was just over 6 hours turnaround on this one.  I worked an audit in the morning and in the afternoon when I went to work referrals, I had internet issues.

Risk Details: 1954 home with updates to all systems and roof in 2008.  insured has horse shoeing business on premises in other structure, with a GL for the business. Risk Details: 1995 dwelling w/marijuana grow operation on premises.  Also 3 prior water damage claims to dwelling.

Risk Details: 1968 home with no listing of updates. Condition of property is below average/poor, as there is a list of damages that need to be fixed. About half of the roof has moss growing on it. Reason(s) for Decision: Advised unable to write BR if insured is acting as GC. Due to inspection noting repairs are more than cosmetic, insured would need to get a licensed GC to manage the work and licensed subcontractors in order to consider. Existing damage, roof exclusion and water exclusion would all be required until repairs are completed. Suggest to write as HO3 w/ rental and have parents obtain own HO4. Would also need to review OHQ to judge condition of systems. Inspection was only exterior.

The applicant is in a nursing home and is terminal, children are planning on selling once the applicant has passed. The daughter is over quite frequently, there is a 30 year old horse on premises, not for riding.
Reason(s) for Decision: Discussed with MP, have approval to offer terms on this risk, but they (or the farmer) must have a farm liability policy in place to cover that exposure. Additionally, we would need to apply the Total Business and Animal Exclusion as well.

Risk Details: Primary home w/garage that is a vacation rental $150K.
Reason(s) for Decision: Confirm garage is on the premises and it has living quarters. Not rented for storage use.

Risk Details: Large water damage loss, repairs still underway. Per agt, flooring, cabinets, etc still remaining
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised could still be hidden damage based on stage of repairs. Agreed if they are in fact further along where hidden damage not a concern, may consider further

Risk Details: 1963 dwelling with some updates. Plumb repl in 2008 per app. Roof in poor condition per app. $101,354 loss from toilet overflow still open. DOL 4/18/18. NRN from prior carrier.
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked for more detail - see email. Evaluate if all work is completed.

Risk Details: 10/23 wind loss, 01/08/2018 water loss (busted pipe)
Reason(s) for Decision: suggested discussion how to winterize home (prior loss for bust pipes, insured didn't know how to deal with cold weather)

Risk Details: 1979 home in brush. 200' brush clearance. 600 SF guest house (sone lives in - he is on the deed) and 1300 SF finished workshop (used by previous cabinet maker owner).  NRN by Hartford due to brush exposure. Online photos look good.
1910 home updated w/15-20 min response time.  FD is 9 mi away; another 12 mi away. Volunteer. No alarms. Gravel roads
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised Alexa to submit if she feel strongly, but we would expect that this will be a total loss if a fire starts.

Risk Details: Only received quote so little info on dwelling. Referred due to prior $101,000 liability claim from personal use of a fire pit. No detail. No DOL
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked for FD report, ins score, app, details on loss, etc. Probably a decline, but appropriate to ask for full details before deciding. Explained this is a concern and leans toward a decline but offered to consider. // Insd poured alcohol on fire, bottle exploded, serious burns to his friend. No longer has the fire pit. // 4/22/19 discussed w/John. We agreed to approve excluding liability.

Risk Details: This is a builders risk which has damage still under repair from loss in 2016. Agent to determine extent of damage/repair left. 5/31/16 elec stove fire $57K; during clean up there was a theft $0 paid jewelry - didn't meet deductible and wasn't scheduled. 7/25/16 lightning $3800.
Reason(s) for Decision: If all checks out, agent will offer builders risk with personal property and high theft deductible.

Risk Details: 1969 year built with complete updates in 2019. Dwelling is owned by the church and is located on the church's premises. The dwelling is used for housing the pastor. They currently have a commercial coverage in place. No meetings, no parishioners are allowed, only the pastor is allowed to use the dwelling. 47 miles to coast.
Reason(s) for Decision: Since no business takes place at the dwelling, I am OK with risk and comfortable that TBE and building exclusion would apply in church related situations. Approved terms as quoted - TBE, building exclusion for church, and confirmation CGL is maintained.

Risk Details: 2014 log home. 9/2018 fire loss, current details from agent indicate could have been from electrical problems with vehicle. $50,000 damage to detached garage. 2015 water loss $50,000 caused by an ice maker line. Insurance score not provided yet.
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked for cause and origin report, along with insurance score to better review fire loss. Advised that if we are to continue with review of this risk, a $10,000 water deductible is to be added and most likely an additional surcharge for the losses.

Risk Details: Bankruptcy.  Insd has 2 prior losses and a bankruptcy, Chapter 13, due to hospitalization.  Went to court 1/10/18, in payoff for 5 years.
Reason(s) for Decision: Concern with active bankruptcy.

Risk Details: 1961 dwelling w/updated in 2015. Non brush. Insd has full time dog day care business. 5 at a time, breed restrictions, small dogs. Has a coml policy thru Pet Sitters Assoc - a Markel Underwritten policy.
Reason(s) for Decision: • Apply the Total Business Exclusion, apply the Animal Liability Exclusion. Ensure TBE is understood. Even though liab policy is with Markel, there could be gaps.

Risk Details: Applicant is Amish and power is from a gas powered generator.
Reason(s) for Decision: Very little info at this time. Just looking for market open to the scenario. Our concern would be that the system would be left unattended and pipes would freeze. Considering Amish lifestyle (farming, wife/kids at home more frequently) that is not as much a concern. Feel this could be an okay risk if everything else checks out. Needs to be updated electrical system, etc. //9/26 updates in 2010. PPC shows 6/6Y which could be 6 or 9. Agent quoted 8. Changed to 9 and gave premium of $1819.
Audit Notes: Make sure this was issued as a PC9 or that there is info on a hydrant within 1000'

Risk Details: 1994 home w/full roof update in 2000. No losses. Insured has licensed daycare in home. Lic for 6. Usually has 5. Agt quoting in B&W In home daycare program w/max of 5. App is incomplete.
Reason(s) for Decision: Lic for 6. Online check shows Karley daycare licensed for 10. Either way is okay, but not in the in home daycare program. Approved in HO w/ TBE and require commercial policies to be maintained. Need completed app-all uw questions blank.

Risk Details: Ground up construction. Insd has a barn and cottage on the property. $100K contents being stored in them. (They have $210K, but we are only going to give $100K.)  They will be moving back into the home after construction.
Reason(s) for Decision: Structures in good condition. Locked and secured. .47 rate competitive with other markets.

Risk Details: Referring due to prior dog bite claim/water claim. Still owns dog (1 of 3). Dog bite was related to claimant teasing dog, wants sublimit of $10K
Reason(s) for Decision: Gave approval to release terms with animal liab exclusion, declined sublimit request

Risk Details: 2014 dog bite claim, insured still has dog. Taking obedience classes. Agent wants to write with animal exclusion. $275K liab loss.

Brush exposed home. PC4. Has active claim that is newly reported due to wild fire. Inspection shows they are underinsured and want to increase coverage. After receiving new inspection, brush and dead trees have not been removed. Asking for them to be mitigated before increasing coverage. Also flagging for renewal pending confirmation this has been done.
Reason(s) for Decision: Subject to correct occupancy and brush removal they are approved for the increase.

Risk Details: Home built in 1937. Unknown when updates to plumbing, roofing and electrical have been done. Home has had liability coverage but insured has been told to cover the property. Insured is well known hockey player for LA Kings.
Reason(s) for Decision: Did not put on coverage when purchasing the home in July. Confirm updates to the home's systems.

Risk Details: Agent bound risk for this very large client on 1/15 with Travelers. Within a couple of days, Travelers advised risk was not eligible. Agent scrambling for a policy - could have desk bound w/Travelers, but need 1/15 eff date. There is a lender. Agent sent statement of no loss. App says home office.
Reason(s) for Decision: Not our typical procedure. Making exception due to large client, good relationship between co and agency. Asked for insured signed SNL and confirmation of no business activities on property.

Risk Details: Frame, secondary rental, no losses, located in NJ, no heat on second floor
Reason(s) for Decision: apply a 5% surcharge for the lack of heat on the second floor, and also please be sure to obtain an Older Home Questionnaire for the file

Risk Details: Insured closed on 9/15/16, bind request came in 9/16/16. All in order. Roof exclusion applied as date of update is not known. Retailer completed an evidence of insurance. Online photo looks like woodstove pipe and the older home quest mentions it.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved subject to an acceptable woodstove quest. Also asked agt if retailer has binding authority. If not, they should not complete Evidence of Ins documents.

Risk Details: 2015 home with landscaping business on premises. Employees, no customers. Storage only on property. Has trampoline, dog, chickens. Has coml policies. Business is in detached outbuilding w/fuel tank on side of it.
Reason(s) for Decision: Chickens for personal egg consumption. Aerial photo shows separation between home and other structure.  Subj to: Verify condition of all other structures. Advised clearances for fuel tanks to be eligible. Decline if clearances are not met. Require TBE, Coml policies in place.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Trampoline exclusion mandatory on all policies.

Risk Details: FireLine High 12 - Med fuels, steep, limited access. RiskMeter Medium.  1978 home no alarms. Hartford NRN due to location. 61 acres. 22 min response - FD 11 miles away.
Reason(s) for Decision: Decline due to 22 min response time.  Average risk.

Risk Details: Home was non-renewed due to condition. Home has now been updated and they are looking to insure again. No explanation
Reason(s) for Decision: Reason for lapse is unclear.

Risk Details: Brand new home. Prior home had total fire loss 9/2015 from Butte Fire. Home on 13.5 acres. 3.7 mi to FD. RM medium brush. FireLine Moderate-2, light fuels, no access issues.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approve subject to Fire Marshall report. Also that home is near front of 13.5 acres and accessible.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: No FM report available. Got RPS loss run which confirms evacuation and wildfire 9/15.

Risk Details: Attached is a primary home located in TN. Home was built in 1996 of frame construction,  PC 9, blueberry picking business
Reason(s) for Decision: approval to offer terms on this risk, subject to the Total Business Exclusion being applied and confirmation that they have a GL policy covering the blueberry business.

Risk Details: 1965 home with partial elec, no plumbing update. 1/20/19 $90K dog bite loss. Insd has a mastiff dog. Animal exclusion applied.
Reason(s) for Decision: Ok to release rate indication.  Need to review details of dog bite to ensure no negligence by insd. Exclusion is applied.  If we proceed, subj to acceptable OHQ.  Suggest EHP. (Guidelines do not require deductible UW until PRE-65.) //OHQ looks ok. Verify if any galvanized. Animal exclusion. Details of dog bite show no negligence. MP 2/15/19

Risk Details: Do we want to reinstate or renew this existing policy?  HUCAH150000389  No claims history.
Reason(s) for Decision: good account? Relationship w/agent? Need copy of app, insp, dec to review. If approved, 5% s/c will apply-rewrite w/lapse only.  Too late to reinstate (expired 4/15/17)  Acct and info looks fine. Confusion on app - lists primary and tenant. Asked Melissa to confirm HO3.

Risk Details: Renewal looking to add ERC. 1958 home w/updates. Not in brush. Says PC6, but app looks like it should be a 9 - no hydrant within 1000'
Reason(s) for Decision: Check w/Dani. Check brush clearance and PC - looks like it should be a 9.

Risk Details: 2005 seasonal w/16 week rental home w/no alarms. Letter from FD in file. 7.2 mi 15 min response time to front of property. Home on 45 acres. Verified response time online.  No farming/no ranching per app.
Reason(s) for Decision: Add 10% surcharge for response time reaching our max. $2654 prem.

Risk Details: 1 dog bit claim, 0 paid, dog no longer in home. 5 horses for personal use only, cows personal use only (use to graze land and cows for personal consumption). No cows now, but they get some occasionally.
Reason(s) for Decision: approval with animal liab excluded//subsequent conversation with Cheryl - advised we could write with animal liability

Risk Details: Remote cottage $110K TIV. 30-60 response time. $1.00 rate. Additional info provided that actually cottage is inaccessible and an inspector can't even get there. There is also no current coverage.
Reason(s) for Decision: Online info shows the home at this address is 2700 SF. Inaccessible and can't get an inspection, plus the lack of coverage.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Discussed pricing with Bethany, don't feel we can price for this exposure.

Risk Details: Insured has a current home, all updated. He is a licensed contractor and is going to add his own additional and garage. He is subbing out the plumbing.
Reason(s) for Decision: We can't write business for a contractor doing their own work as we have no subro opportunity among other issues.

City: Evergreen CO PC6, Lakewood, CO PC 4, Arvada, CO PC 3
Risk Details: 3 rentals, on policy. Open claim on Arvada rental. Tenant at fault for loss, prior carrier subrogatng, loss date 12/2015
Reason(s) for Decision: requested info on what stage of rebuild, questioned if considered debiting that home, other two homes 1950, 1957-requesting if updates being made to systems that weren't checked on app
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Additional request on 5/4/16 to write just one of the three locations with a  10% addl surcharge. Approved-Patterson

Risk Details: 2016 modular home being constructed by licensed contractor.
New modular being constructed on site. Main connections done by modular company. Insured is GC, plumber, electrician.
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised Ray we are not currently writing risks where insured is the GC. We are working on a program with Tamika.

System Reason(s) for Referral: Tenant is a foster care enterprise
Risk Details: Insured leases dwelling to a non-profit foster care enterprise. They don't own it in any way. Foster care has their own liability. Agent proposing $1M liab and Total Business exclusion.
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked numerous questions about the tenant and risk. Concerning class of business.

Risk Details: 1953 dwelling under construction w/WBS as primary heat. WRS 40 w/60% surcharge. Will be installing central heat.
Reason(s) for Decision: Need at least avg condition even for builders risk.  Photos show below average condition.  Pool structure is dilapidated. Home shows addition with trees growing through the roof.

Risk Details: 50% completed. Prior carrier cancelling due to extent of renovations (include moving interior walls). Agt quoted with 20% surcharge and $2500 AOP ded due to midterm work. Should be done 3-6 months

Risk Details: Burns sent this over to just ask a question. Vacant risk with a WBS. Requesting the wood stove not be used in lieu of the WBS quest. Insured advised the do not have any info on the installation as it was present before they purchased the property.
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised that we will not allow that exception. The WBS must either be removed, or a WBS quest must be completed. Advised that the insured doesn't have to be the one to complete it, and that a licensed professional can also complete the form.

Risk Details: 1953 w/full updates in 2018. Fire loss, undetermined on 7/15/17. $130,000. Report provided is first responder fire dept report.
Reason(s) for Decision: Need actual fire marshal cause & origin. Report notes 2 unit (check rate). One unit - people were away in Mexico. Other unit was vacant. // C&O from prior carrier does not indicate any suspicious cause. Did not add AP for loss being slightly over $100K because 5% that we often do won't add much.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Interesting that a fire started when no one was there on a 1953 rental. Definitely want fire marshal report to give us more info. Decline if we can't get comfortable with a cause. No adverse online info.

Risk Details: 1946 home vacant with Hull for 4 terms. They nonrenewed. This is insured's parents house and he is struggling to make decision on what to do with the home. Garage not in great shape-rest of house is okay. He lives next door to home. (Different streets but confirmed on google, they are next door)  Has a Lex quote but it's DP1 100% down.
Reason(s) for Decision: Very high insurance score, 10% surcharge, exclude garage, renew for 1 more term only.

System Reason(s) for Referral: Woodstove primary. Not accessible yr round
Risk Details: 1965 home w/woodstove as primary heat. Nonrenewed by Foremost for this reason.
Reason(s) for Decision: Woodstove as primary is unacceptable, even more of a concern as a rental. I scrutinize those even for supplemental heat.

Risk Details: 1940 home with lapse, prior carrier Fair Plan, not in brush. Was renovated in 2014-15. Roof has tiles replaced as needed, but is original. App says vacant; email cover says rental. Need more info on use.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approve with roof exclusion; can't do ACV due to age, lapse, and prior carrier.

Risk Details: 1920 home updated in 2012. Verified fire department is very close, less than 5 minutes.  Found 2 online references to businesses at this address. Sent links to agent.
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked Charity to investigate business and refer if there was an active business.

Risk Details: 2005 frame home in brush w/ no alarms, seasonal. 20 minute response time. Reviewed address of FD and it appears to be 11 min/5.9 miles. UPQ states something about 20 minutes - not sure if that is all or one tanker response time.
Reason(s) for Decision: Risk looks good. Approve if response time truly is <15 min. If over 15, refer back w/details. Advised not sure we could make an exception.  Fireline is Extreme 13. Heavy fuels, Moderate slope, very limited access. Part of 2003 Cedar fire. Copy of FL in temp file. RM shows moderate.

Risk Details: 1997 quonset hut renovated to be rental dwelling. Purchase of dwelling and 19 acres $289K. Agent asking for $300K Cov A. App says $30K. Quonset huts have low PSF. Response time over 15 min by volunteer FD and gravel roads.
Reason(s) for Decision:
Asked agent to check:  • Confirm interior renovation was professionally completed (especially concerned with wiring, plumbing, heating)
• Confirm no business use or business storage – residential use only
• Cov A
• Google shows a 14 minute drive time between the property and the FD.  This is a volunteer FD, gravel roads, so the response time will be over 15 minutes.  We would need to apply a surcharge to the premium for this.  I can determine the amount when we settle on a Cov A.

Risk Details: Originally built as warehouse; converted to private residence and garage
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised something to consider; questioned if applicant did conversion, or purchased as is? Requested confirmation of plumbing, heating, and electric in structure

Risk Details: home is rented out to Blooming Rose Pre-school LLC. There is a Scottsdale GL policy currently in place for the pre-school operations; 1942 build, partial updates to wiring and plumbing.
Reason(s) for Decision: reviewed website/facebook page of school. Appears to be a school only up to 15 kids in school; x-liab, TBE, and FRC settlement option if residential use. If comm only, advised better fit on comm pol

Risk Details: 1930 home updated except electric is partial and has knob & tube in attic. Aft says insd is closing, moving in, and will update in 30 days. Rush inspection.
Reason(s) for Decision: If knob & tube is inactive, okay to bind and have electrician remove inactive wiring in 30 days. If active, risk is ineligible per guidelines. 30 days is too long for active k&t.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: We have made exceptions before for new closings.  The electrician must be the first one in the house the day of or after closing. Circuits cannot start being used until the k&t wiring is removed.  We will wait to see if they ask for it.  I don't want to promote approvals for this situation.

Risk Details: Built in 1996 w/updates. Brush area. Seacoast $946. Markel $1229 (25%). That is with 10% discretionary already. We have ERC, RC on roof, $5K water b/u, $5K mold, $2500 biz prop.
Reason(s) for Decision: Discussing rates of additional coverages with Allison. Reviewed w/ Jeff and agreed to do 10% over Seacoast.

Risk Details: Air BNB approximately 24 weeks, will confirm two night minimim met
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved subject to 2-night minimum being met

Risk Details: 1954 home updated in 05/14. 5/14 water tank loss. Bridge access to home washed out in 10/13 - it is being replaced - should be in 2 months. Letter from FD explains access.

Risk Details: PC10 home built in 2016. Everything looks good (via zillow listing).

Provided the TIV is not too high and the risk looks good, Jeff gave the OK. Based on real estate listing, it is in excellent condition built in 2016.

Risk Details: Renewal policy - was rated as PC10 but agent supported a PC9 classification and asked that it be re-rated
Reason(s) for Decision: Verified PC

Risk Details: Periodic inaccessible; close to neighbors, alarms
Reason(s) for Decision: premium increase to $4K

Risk Details: 1963 updated condo. Insured is mayor of Anaheim. Not in brush. Heat, wire, plumb updated. No roof update. Cover is built up.

Risk Details: DP3 Secondary/Rental in the name of 2 corporations.
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked for corp supp app and asked several other questions. Need to determine if this is residential use or commercial.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Residential use in one corporate name for tax purposes. No business use. Owner is hub and wife - this is their business. They use this home seasonally and vacation rental to others 25 weeks/yr. Approved w/prem liability.

Risk Details: Open dog bite loss 11/17. Agent applying animal exclusion. Also, recently closed bankruptcy. Steven had health issue, couldn't work, Ch 13. 1969 home no plumbing update. NRN by USAA, no detail.
Reason(s) for Decision: Need OHQ. (This situation is ok per Burns guidelines, OHQ is the requirement.)  Dog will be excluded. Verified bankruptcy. Need reason for NRN - if dog or bankruptcy ok, otherwise Burns will re-refer.

Risk Details: Frame (stilts) home built in 2011. PC 6 with metal roof. Location is about 250' from coast which makes it ineligible for the program
Reason(s) for Decision: Too close to the coast. Nothing between the house and the water except some sand. Guideline is 1000'.

Risk Details: 1995 dwelling listed online and on app as a condo, but HO3 app submitted. 4 prior losses, 1 closed w/no pmt. 10/18 water dmg plumbing closed no pmt; 3/18 wind $749. 4/16 water dmg other $687. 3/16 weight of ice/snow $12K.
Reason(s) for Decision: Need more loss detail to determine if agts quoted $5K water ded/$2500 AOP is adequate. Charged for 3 losses. Make sure no pmt expected for 10/18 loss. New roof in 2018.

Risk Details: 1910 year built home, updates to heating 2019, roof 2005 and plumbing 2000. Wiring still has knob and tube wiring. Insured is just purchasing home and having contractor replace wiring "very soon after closing." Risk is also not 100% on circuit breakers
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked agent to confirm how much and where throughout the home the knob and tube is present and also if any was active. We were advised that it is throughout the home and still active. Since it is active and not minimal presence, declining risk.

Risk Details: 2002 year built with daycare on premises. 8 children, licensed, no staff. Two losses 9/2016 hail paid $32k, 8/2018 water back up paid $10k
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved subject to TBE, surcharge for the losses, and no water back up coverage due to the water claim.

Risk Details: 1963 dwelling FRC. Prior fire loss 9/10/17 $154,000. Electrical fire from piece of equip in office. App incomplete (uw questions).

Risk Details: This is a PC9 risk, the dwelling is on a farm and Commercial Team wrote the liability, the insured only need property coverage on the dwelling.  There is a woodstove but is not the insured primary source of heat, it is secondary.
Reason(s) for Decision: Requested confirmation of use of other structures that are quoted (clear separation, any farming). May need to exclude if unsure. Also, questioned installation/most recent inspection of woodstove; LLC formation, members, etc.

Risk Details: 1986 home. Roof updated in 2006. In medium brush zone. High-7 per FireLine. 21 minute response time. Reviewed w/Jeff and we are not making exceptions to the 15 minutes unless special circumstances.

The venue is set away from the home, there are separate driveways to the home and the venue. Applicant also said that they will be putting up a fence around the home to further separate the property. There is a GL in place for the venue and they are working on separating the zoning so that the venue would be on a different address.
Reason(s) for Decision: Feel comfortable since the venue space is away from the home, separate driveway, and that they will be putting up a fence. Volunteer department.  Appears this will be close to our 15 and definitely within Burns 20 minute allowed response time.  Approved w/re-rate to PC10. This is a .67 rate.

Risk Details: 1978 home updated in 2000, 16 min response time per PC Quest. Google=17 min. Bing=18 min. High brush zone per RM. Woodpile in online photo.
Reason(s) for Decision: Not comfortable exceeding 15 min in high brush zone.

Risk Details: 60 acres; 50 are leased and lessee has cattle. 2 tracks of land deeded separately

Risk Details: Insured operates an in home beauty salon.

Risk Details: 30 minute response time in Livermore CO.  Seasonal $300K Cov A; $555K TIV.  Not in a brush zone per RM. Fireline shows High-5; Light-med fuels, moderate slope, somewhat limited access. 1994 home very nice online pix. Has a woodstove.

Due to prior roommate leaving a pot unattended on stove.  **Declined by Mitchell via prior Email due to loss being due to carelessness & ins allowing others to stay in home.  JBach 5/8/19.**

Risk Details: 1970 home updated in 2010. Landscaping business on property. No online photos or info. No foot traffic, GL in place.

Risk Details: 2001 frame home with 10 min response time and accessible. Risk Meter shows risk is in a Renie fire zone but Ben's email indicates "not in brush".

Risk Details: 1923 home updated in 2014. Very nice online photos. Will be vacant with remodel starting at end of year and then it will be primary.

Risk Details: 1998 frame/log dwelling quoted as PC9 w/20 min response. Supplemental woodstove, no info. Animal liab, no animal info on app. PCQ unclear about year round access. Volunteer FD, hydrant.

Risk Details: 1998 home not in brush, tile roof. No online photos. Coming from Lloyds, our prem is competitive

Risk Details: primary home located in MO. Frame construction, Built in 2005, PC10W, no losses, no alarms, E insurance score; The applicant has an auto repair shop on the premises. If the car is not drivable they will then use a tow company to bring the car to the shop.  Business will have GL in place

Risk Details: 1959 home, all updated recently. PC9. FD 4.4 miles away; visible; accessible. Has American Harvest wood pellet stove in garage, installed by insured.

Risk Details: Insured on 30 acres, flat land, no brush, used for personal horse grazing (2 horses), requesting $30K bus prop. No foot traffic, but makes leather/furs in home and sales online
Reason(s) for Decision: requested confirmation that doesn't operate the bus from any loc, and that $30K figure is from ACV/or RCV and not sales price of finished items.

Risk Details: 2009 home w/log siding. Nice photos provided. 1592 SF. Runs off solar and backup batteries. Prim heat is gas forced air w/woodstove. Photo looks ok. In brush. Insd owns pest control business. FD 2.2 miles away. New purchase.

• Completed and acceptable woodburning stove questionnaire

ADDL QUESTIONS IF WE DID FOR SOME REASON MOVE FOREWARD:  How did the loss occur?  What was the total amount of damage?  What steps have been taken to mitigate future losses?
Is the insured planning on living in the home when it is complete?  (Verifying if HO-3 form is correct)
Current premium?
Need to do an RCE based on what the completed structure will be like and insure for 100% of the completed value (should always be that way from the start of the policy).  It appears $313,000 is going to be too low.
Really concerned with the open windows in the photos?  How are they protecting rain, birds, vandals, etc. from getting in?

Risk Details: A hail loss came in after renewal terms were offered. Can agent surcharge in 2018?

Risk Details: PC9 New 2017 home. No online photos. Online search shows 3.5 miles 6 min to volunteer Chuckatuck Fire Station.

Sales of art and books via internet. There is signage. In reality only 10 visitors per year come. Coml carrier won't cover building (?). No employees.
Reason(s) for Decision: This should be commercial. Exposure sounds like it could fluctuate. HO3 language excludes this building so even if we wanted to forego the Total Business Excl, the policy excludes.

Risk Details: $360K total loss . Insd was a witness to a restraining order violation and the offender burned down their house in 4/2016. COC almost done.  Wants a policy when it's complete in October.  2nd loss was $70K water damage. While roof was in process there was rain damage. Agt will be surcharging for 2 losses plus 10% addl due to size of loss.

Risk Details: Number of mortgages:  New purchase, insured required  3 private investors for renovations to home
Reason(s) for Decision: Not comfortable w/ reason for 3 mortgages
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: ran credit, poor range

Risk Details: Insured rents rooms to 4 students. No kitchen facilities. He has access to all rooms.
Reason(s) for Decision:
• Are these undergrad or graduate students?
• What college?
• We are told they don’t get kitchen privileges.  How do they eat or drink?  Do they have appliances in their individual rooms?
• Is this the insured’s full time primary residence?
• What is the insured’s occupation and is he generally around outside of his work hours or is he traveling?  (I wondered if maybe he was never around and he’s making pretty good money renting out rooms to students.)  
• What is the named insured so I can note my log.  
• As we discussed, there is a competitor premium of $4,800 (appx $0.90).  Our quoted rental premium is well below this and we are looking at an owner occupied policy.  You suggested a premium of about $3,800, which is about $1,000 more than quoted, correct?
//7/27/17 insured is a teacher renting to rabbinical students. they eat at school, all meals. Confirmed several rabbinical colleges in area.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Should be a higher caliber of student even though undergrad.

Risk Details: 3 water losses in the past 3 years, being cancelled for losses
Reason(s) for Decision: approval to offer terms on this risk subject to a water damage exclusion

Risk Details: Open liability claim-4 st. bernards in home,, one possibly bit Claimant (claimants friend and insureds dog got in fight). Quoted w/ animal exclusion

Risk Details: two water claims in 2014, lapse since 05/19/2018 (non payment of premium)

Risk Details: Retired physician owns 2 family home. Online pics look okay. There is one circuit of knob & tube wiring. Contractor removing 2nd week of July. 1945 home w/ updates.

What is running off or connected to the circuit?  Other than the knob/tube, is there an updated breaker box?  Any idea when that was updated?  Any fuses?// Replacing many outlets & switches, plus breaker panel is Zinsco (fire hazard)

Risk Details: 1953 dwelling that has been uninsured for 6 months. Agent sending for review.

Risk Details: 1950 home with updates undergoing renovation. Will be insured's seasonal home when completed. Rated as builders risk.

System Reason(s) for Referral: Personal liability on home with rental
