Risk Details: PC 9, LLC-established to buy/sell homes, 6 min response time per agt email, but per risk meter FD 8.6 miles away. Home currently secondary home, but will be sold or rented next yr. Requested agt confirmation on FD.
Reason(s) for Decision: Requested confirmation of PC as FD listed as over 5 miles from home, but agt listed as 8B and referred as PC 9

Risk Details: Risk is 8 miles from Fire Station. Home also is on 7 acres with 3 horses that are used for personal use only. There is a home office where business is conducted(HVAC business), no clients are on the property. There is a trampoline on the premises with a safety net and anchored to the ground with sand bags.
Reason(s) for Decision: subject to: response time w/in 15 minutes, no employees on premise, trampoline exclusion

Risk Details: 1991 home w/prior CAT fire (Camp). A+ shows this was a CAT fire on the day the Camp fire started 11/8.
Reason(s) for Decision: New location.  Waiving other proof of loss due to A+.

Risk Details: 1956 dwelling updated. Insured owns the dwelling, rents it to a group home "Acute Home Health Care".
Reason(s) for Decision: Little info provided. Website appears to be 24/7 on site care. We are not a market for that type of risk.

Risk Details: 1914 home w/updates. Duplex - 1/2 personal living; 1/2 rented to business. (Unsure if personal living is insured or rented to someone.) Auto shop next door. Also found Acoustech Drywall Contr at this addr.
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked for occupancy clarification. Investigate drywall business. Auto repair is separate address? Also asked in of on Cambodian Employment in 1/2 of duplex. If insured rents whole home, doesn't occupy themselves, this should go commercial. We will apply Total Business Exclusion.  5/19-This is a commercial exposure and would better serve insured to be quoted there.

Risk Details: Primary, insured is interior designer. Occasionally sales furniture/pieces from home so some inventory and foot traffic
Reason(s) for Decision: Agt quoted with total business exclusion, so approved subject to confirming that not frequent/daily foot traffic (like a small store front); if it is may have to revisit liab cov

System Reason(s) for Referral: home where land is owned by separate entity
Risk Details: Policy is being nonrenewed due to the fact that the prior carrier was not made aware of the land ownership. Home is owned by the insured, land is owned by a Christian camp.
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised agt we prefer liab be excluded given the property is not owned by the insured. Also adv to confirm the house is not utilized by the camp.

Risk Details: Seacoast $1211; Us $1924.
Reason(s) for Decision: Too much of a variance. Allison agreed.

Risk Details: 2009 year built. Losses listed are the same as the above quote, no specification as to which property the water loss took place at.
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised that we do not need to surcharge and exclude water on both properties and to confirm which the water loss took place at and only surcharge/exclude for that quote. If there was negligence, however, the surcharge and exclusion can apply for both.

Risk Details: 1999 home updated in brush, no losses.  Volunteer FD is 3 miles away with a 4 minute response time. Backup 24 hour paid FD is 24 miles away w/40 min response time. Fully accessible.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved due to very close Volunteer FD.

Risk Details: Insured in process of acquiring license for home daycare. Either 12 or 16 children (response is unclear).   Applying Total Business Exclusion.
Reason(s) for Decision: Provided list of questions to evaluate the exposure.  Depending on answers, may not be able to do at all.  12 or 16 children is a high number for us.

Risk Details: 1959 home with 4 prior pipe break claims. 2/15 $13K, 9/15 $45K, 1/16 $22K, 8/16 $39K. Per email, insured updated all plumbing. Quoted with S/C for 4 losses, $2500 AOP and $25,000 water damage ded (not on rater, but this is what Tamika said she quoted).
Reason(s) for Decision:
Asked if ALL pipes were replaced or just visible. Agent reply doesn't sound 100% confident. Approved subj to: • Invoice showing ALL plumbing has been replaced, including plumbing within walls
• With surcharge for 4 losses
• $2,500 AOP deductible
• $25,000 water damage deductible
• .54 TIV

Risk Details: The claim was due to plumbing pay out $10,000 DOL 9/10/2017. They have a wood roof which the agent believes it is the original. Updates were in 1980 per the inspection
Reason(s) for Decision: 10K water deductible must be applied due to the galvanized plumbing and prior claim history. Please be sure to confirm that all repairs were made from that loss. Additionally, due to the age of the roof it must be excluded on the policy.

Risk Details: 1955 year built with complete updates to heating and roof 2002 and 1998. partial updates to wiring 2018 and plumbing 2000. Non-renewed from prior carrier due to losses. Fire damage and water damage loss on same day. Water damage loss was flood. They said fire damage was mentioned to be due to the water damage? Also, lapse from 2/28/2019
Reason(s) for Decision: Pended asking for c&o report for fire.

Risk Details: a primary home located in CO. Home was built in 2007 of frame construction, PC9 , no alarms. 15-18 minute drive time.
Reason(s) for Decision: From docs, home over 5 miles from FD. Requested updated premium rated as PC 10 instead of 9
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: May consider risk with appropriate premium once PC 10 updated

Risk Details: 1940 updated home in IL owned by President of the presenting retail agency.  Partial fire loss 1/29/18 due to electrical. $128K claims closed. Still under construction - no info on extent of repairs left. NRN by prior carrier. Lapsed about 6 months ago, no insurance.
Reason(s) for Decision: Discussed addl info needed. Concerning situation, but entertaining since it is President of agency.  Tasha later advised that this is a low insurance score so she declined without even getting into additional questions.

Risk Details: Referred due to some hunting occurring on property - by owner, no one else.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved - 5 acres used for hunting on 68 acre property.  Limited exposure.

Risk Details: 1926 with roof exclusion. No other known updates.  Insured is a LLC and does their own house flipping. This one involves kitchens/baths.
Reason(s) for Decision: We are not a market for risks where the insured is the GC. Explained our position.

Risk Details: loss at this property on 6/06/2017-tenants having a meth lab in the home ($0 payout).   All of the remediation has been done, and the home has been cleared for renovation/construction. In We are looking to write a builder’s risk.  They are using an insured contractor to complete the work, and get GL cert prior to binding.
Reason(s) for Decision: firm rental vetting process prior to becoming a rental, and you have approval to release the quoted terms with this contingency along with the 15% surcharge.

Risk Details: 3 family rental dwelling 1 mi from coast in New Haven. Agt asking to waive deductible. (2% wind)
Reason(s) for Decision: All programs have this required ded.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Some chaos this week with a RUSH Stockton audit that backed up referrals.  Turnaround may have been impacted.

Risk Details: seasonal home for the above named insured located in CA.  Home was built in 1984 of frame construction. Full heat update in 2017, full roofing update 2006,  PC4 with local alarms. Risk meter not pulling
Reason(s) for Decision: have approval to offer terms on this risk. Since the address won't pull a Risk Meter, we will have to treat it as if it is in brush.

Risk Details: 2017 home w/addition. Private entrance for one chair hair salon. Cut/color/wax. Business supplemental attached. Has GL. Agt quoted in Incidental Business program. Feel it is more exposure than that program contemplates.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved subj to Total Business Excl. Maintain GL, confirm no large chem storage, no unattended wax warmers, no  tanning.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Policy excludes professional services and business.. TBE and GL provide 2 addl layers of protection. No adverse online info for address or business.

Risk Details: Can we match Lex rate of $4916? I ran AAL and it is coming in at $5700 with wind and non-wind. Our quote is at $5875. Left as is.

MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Ins score H.  Did not list further issues: Need full detail of horse, farm, Cov B, hay storage, WBS per app, uw questions not complete.

Risk Details: 2005 new purchase. Husband had prior foreclosure 12/31/14. (Hub info not provided even though I advised this was needed) Nice home.

Risk Details: 2016 seasonal home w/vineyard. No info on the business provided.  Extremely low per RM. Low per FireLine.

Risk Details: 1971 home w/unknown updates.  Roof in 96.  Not in brush. 3 prior losses:  1/27/17 roof leak $620. 5/4/18 slab leak $15,681. 3/13/19 slab leak - withdrew. (May be subro from first claim)
Reason(s) for Decision: WRS must be below 30 to consider. Slab leak mitigation required such as rerouting of pipes. $20K water damage ded should apply. Roof damage fully repaired. (The water damage ded will apply to the roof, and ACV roof would be required.)  Good ins score.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: I ran ins score 780

Risk Details: 1962 dwelling with lab dog that bit friend. Open claim $50,000. Insd keeping dog. Animal liab exclusion applied.

Risk Details: 1999 frame home w/prior hail loss $20K in 2013. 6 children. Pool w/slide.

Risk Details: Builders risk, as a result of prior fire loss (marshal report confirms caused by dryer)

Risk Details: 1850 dwelling w/no update info. Borderline condition. Roof not in good shape.

Risk Details: 12/17/16 fire $343K where homeless people burned down the house.

• Several key uw questions are blank.  Could you let me know what the answers are?  (And of course you will want to make sure to get a fully completed signed app if we proceed.)

• Could I have the names of the individuals that are part of Arrowhead Properties?  Also their dates of birth?  We want to look a little more at the financial situation.
• Could I please see a copy of the Corp/LLC questionnaire if they have completed it?                               • Could you please send us a copy of the Protection Class questionnaire?

Risk Details: Insured purchased a $25,686 engagement ring and wants to add to policy. No losses. Insured for 1 year with Markel.

Risk Details: actor, secondary home
Reason(s) for Decision: Online info OK, very low key, no large projects recently (or ever from what I can locate) restricted liab on secondary home anyway.

Risk Details: Inquiry about whether we could consider. No adverse news. App okay. Question on Cov A - RCE $275K  App $380K

Risk Details: 1998 home w/roof update. 3/13/19 sump pump failure.  Daycare w/4 children - will be more. Bible studies and mom& me classes. Has CGL for daycare and religious activities.

Insd affiliated w/the Chabad Jewish Center of SD and there is indication that some of the ceremonies and classes will take place in the insured's home.  Do not see issues where we would be looking at exorbitant defense costs. Just not comfortable with the level of activity.

Risk Details: 2000 home. Quoted by partner as PC8, looks like PC 10. PC app coming. Volunteer, 5.7 mi to resp FD, ?? hydrant per app. Insd placing 10 horse stalls in 2 barns at rear of home to be used for coml boarding. They are working on placing a CGL for horse boarding.

Risk Details: Primary, 1982 build, some updates, no brush, PC 4, non-renewed from state farm 2 years ago, hasn't had insurance since. Agency providing him with quotes 2 years ago, and he never followed through
Reason(s) for Decision: Too great of a lapse with no legitimate reason

Risk Details: 1990 frame home. Not in brush. Insd has 5 losses.  2 are car break-ins. 3 are water leaks - bedroom pipe, bathroom pipe, and slab leak. Insured had plumbing completely replaced in 2016. Agent quoting $25K water damage.

1891 dwelling with updates to roof and systems from 1990-2003, no mention if gutted. Three other structures that are in poor condition, which is reason for non-renewal with other carrier. Structures will be demoed or burned by control burn. Asked if RCV or ACV should be used.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approval subject to full exclusion of the outbuildings will be needed. Will require ACV since no mention of completely gutted, older updates, and not above average condition.

Risk Details: PC 10
Reason(s) for Decision: requested PCQ for review. Only quote attached

Risk Details: Primary home built in 1958, offering FRC. Frame, PC 1 with 4 losses. Will be primary home. Former renter damaged home (4 coverages from same incident)
Reason(s) for Decision: Changing the rental to a primary. Insured moves in two weeks. Currently daughter resides in home. There will be a lapse (and a charge) for the 2 days without coverage. One incident logged as four due to types of losses

Risk Details: 1979 dwelling w/updated roof. Has non thermostatically controlled wall heaters. Agt proposing to quote DP1 and rewrite to DP3 when heating is updated.
Reason(s) for Decision: Suggested DP3 w/water damage exclusion. Insd agreeable to update to thermostats.

Risk Details: 2004 home not in brush. No RiskMeter included. Quoted as PC4, but risk is 6.6 miles from the FD.  Woodstove in home.  Zillow says this is a "horse property".
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked for new rater and PC Quest to be sent for review. If ok, addl subjectivities are WBS quest and info on horses. Prior home total loss in Camp fire - Paradise. RM says in brush, rater confirms that rating. Cover email said not in brush.

Risk Details: 1960 home no updates in a business name. Insd is a denim company. Home is used 6 months by the VP and periodically by "employees" per app.
Reason(s) for Decision:
DP-3 with premises liability only. Reviewed policy forms and Total Biz Exclu(only avail on HO3) and felt we'd be better off w/DP3 subject to many verifications:  • We would need confirmation that the dwelling was being used as a residence only.  No business meetings.  No business activities at all on the property.  No business storage.  Not used as an award for employees.  Only used by officers and owners.
• What does the personal property consist of – just household furnishings?
• Note on app says “they have employees fly in from out of the country and stay with them several times a year”.  We’d need more info on what this means. Are these officers or execs?
• Is this used like a hotel?  I’d be concerned if that is the case.
• How close is the dwelling to the company headquarters?
• Roof exclusion applies due to 1960 and no updates.  Concerned about the condition since it says no wiring, plumbing, heating updates.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: All issues check out. Answers in email file.  No terms if no update to systems.  Okay to offer terms subj to roof exclusion. DP3 prem liab only.

Risk Details: Insured moving a 1 chair beauty shop into her home. 40-65 clients/month. InHome Business program with $10K property. Has a GL in place. 1916 home updated. Nice online photos.
Reason(s) for Decision: Meets UW guidelines.

Risk Details: Insured cares for 2 mentally challenged individuals. Has GL for the coml liability.
Reason(s) for Decision: No covg modification for the 2 individuals. Reasonable exposure, and policy allows for 2 boarders. Asked for opportunity to revise terms if insd is licensed for >2. Advised agt of 3 businesses found online using this address. Also, Zillow lists Mother in law apt.

Risk Details: 2011 dwelling with adult day care at the property. 3-4 adults 5 days per week. Insured's are only employees.
Reason(s) for Decision: Confirmed acceptable activities and details online. Require CGL policy to be put in place and maintained.

Risk Details: 1999 condo, referred due to 6 losses, 4 paid. SCU advised insured was not advised to not file small claims with prior agent, and advised with new agent they will make sure they do not do so. Claims are smaller. Applicant said he would have gladly paid for them himself had he known they would go against him in the future. 3/2017 $255 window leak, 10/2017 $7k smoke damage, 1/2018 $2700 water damage, 2/2018 $2700 water damage.
Reason(s) for Decision: SCU quoted with $10k AOP. Claims do not appear to be a concern and agent advised they would work with them on when to file claims. Approved terms as quoted.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: This risk was also quoted and referred by Burns. Burns advised water leak alarm system was installed and quoted with $2500 AOP and $5000 water damage deductible. I approved those terms, but since no mention of water alarms in this referral I approved with the overall $10k AOP. // MP on 4/10 Burns advised that one of the hail losses was not $0 paid, it was $4400 paid under Loss Assessment.  I emailed Allison generically and let her know it came to our attention.

Risk Details: 1999 year built condo. Prior carrier was USAA and they do not have agents and each time you call to inquire about coverage a claim is opened. The new agent is educating the applicant on filing claims. Technically there are 6 losses since 2016, 4 paid. 3/2017 water $255, slow leak that was present before insured purchased but noticed when damage became more apparent. 10/2017 $7037 smoke damage in kitchen due to incident with microwave. 1/2018 water $2740 sudden leak from plumbing fixture, 2/2018 water $2695 sudden leak from plumbing fixture, has installed water alarms on all plumbing fixtures. Two hail storms 2016 and 2018 that caused to open a claim even though coverage didn't apply, both closed with $0, HOA did repairs.
Reason(s) for Decision: Seeing that water alarms have been installed makes this easier to review. They are all lower amounts, and Burns has AOP at $2500 with a water deductible at $5000. As such, approved terms. // MP 4/10/19 Burns added s/c for a hail loss originally believed to be covered by the condo assoc. It was actually paid under loss assessment. Also, they added EQ. Confirmed w/Bethany.

Risk Details: Built in 1900, partial plumbing update in 2018, partial heating update in 2014, full wiring update in 2017 and full roof update in 2017. Frame construction ,PC6, one loss over $100,000. loss at this rental (fire due to tenant negligence); quoted on DP1
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved DP1, advised need to confirm loss cause since same location. Per applicant, it was caused by smoking of a prior tenant

Risk Details: Primary home and guest house w/separate addresses.  4 prior smoke/fire losses that are actually 2 losses.  WRS 31. PC1. Question about writing as 1 risk or 2 separate.
Reason(s) for Decision: Not comfortable with the loss history.

Risk Details: PC 9, primary, insured operates petting zoo/pony ride  business (gilchrist farm). Has GL policy in place, but residence is on same prop, NR by allstate 04/30, 1954 build
Reason(s) for Decision: the amount and variety of business that takes place on this property (petting zoos, riding lessons, summer camps, private events, cheese/soap making, camping expeditions, tours, etc.) that could lead to issues at the property.

Risk Details: 2006 home with greenhouse. Non-prof installed woodstove used to heat water feature in greenhouse. Fire department is 13 miles away with 30 minute response time. (Noted project list to add this as a criteria - looking for 20 minute response time max.)
Reason(s) for Decision: Woodstove clearance to combustible wall is 18". Typically require 36". Also, PC 10 w/30 min response time is a concern if there is a fire.

Risk Details: 1959 home w/updates. Greenhouse business on premises with hemp growing operation. CDB Hemp, LLC is business name.
Reason(s) for Decision: We are not a market for these risks
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Did not review entire risk. Declined based on description of operations.

Risk Details: 2005 home in medium brush. Not near an active fire. Agent not sure if PC5 or 10. Gave info. 18 min response time.

Risk Details: 1999 home w/updates. Had prior total fire loss on TN home 1/1/17 $305K. Fire Marshal report provided.

Risk Details: Dwelling inherited from parents. Bro was caretaker. Insd just went to look at home to put up for sale and found bro hasn't done anything for 4 years. Dry rot to exterior sills, needs paint. Agent wants to quote w/water damage exclusion.

Risk Details: Home built in 1920 with full updates to wiring and roofing in 2018. Heating and plumbing updated in 2000. They are running a bookstore out of their attached pole barn. The barn is attached via a breezeway which is one concern. The photos included with the referral show a door frame out of line on the back patio, siding issues next to the side door and a porch with mildew and potential rot.

Risk Details: 2002 home. Dog bite loss 11/13/18 still open. Dog bit UPS driver. Insured still has dog chained up in yard. No animal liability covg quoted.
Reason(s) for Decision: No animal liability

Risk Details: 1923 home w/updates. Seasonal use. Has no furnace. Insd drains pipes when not used. Has done this for "decades". Nice online photos. Roof shows patched shingles - pic online is from 2013. App shows roof updated in 2018.
Reason(s) for Decision: Provided only used in late spring/summer when there are no freeze days. No portable or solid fuel heat used. Surcharge TBD, no VMGA premium provided.

Risk Details: 1990 seasonal. No updates.
Reason(s) for Decision: Questioned $202 SF covg A-should be more like $300. Brush clearance? Roof? 25 years old-ACV or excl?

Risk Details: 2 prior losses, one fire-01/2016 space heater-repairs made, no longer use portable devices

Risk Details: New purchase for insured. Will be vacant for 6 months, then will be renovated by insured's own contracting company.

Risk Details: 1977 year built with some updates - heating and roofing 2005-2006. Business is a swimming school, no further info provided regarding business. There also was a loss in 2017 with no further details. Agent advised there are CGL policies for the swim school.
Reason(s) for Decision: I found online that there are three different locations for this business. Also need details of the loss that was listed.  UPDATE: Swim lessons taught in backyard pool. Baby & me, private, semi-private, autism, beginning group, intermediate, and advanced group classes. Classes are April-Sept. Policy would be in the name of Jon and Jamie Collard, not the business name. Max number of students at any one time would be 5.

Risk Details: 2017 home w/alarms. Insd runs private pilates studio in home. Usually 1 customer at a time, but website offers semi-private and group appts.  GL in place. Quoted w/TBE.

Risk Details: Risk has mix of plumbing pipes including iron per inspection. Do we allow? 1938 dwelling

Risk Details: 1994 dwelling with 2 prior claims. 2/17 Hail $12K 4/17 Water dmg from leaky valve $24k. Both closed and repaired. Ins score H.

Risk Details: Primary home on top floor with bottom floor rented out for AirBnB with separate entrance. Online photo shows 2 story home. Rented 10 weeks/year. 2001 home.

Risk Details: 1992 home, 2 story frame. The request is to increase TIV based on the latest inspection. 19 miles from 90% contained fire

Risk Details: 1970 w/ updates. PC10, 37 min drive time. Response time from volunteer department will be 40-45.  Agent adjusted rate to .63.

Risk Details: 1923 home on historical registry.  Site of Buffalo Bill Cody gold mine. Branch wants RC. Several outbuildings.
Reason(s) for Decision:
1.  This is the site of a gold mine once run by Buffalo Bill Cody.  Are tours offered?  
2.  Guest house is rented out per website:
http://www.highjinksranch.net/accomodations.html  Is this still the case?
3.  Accommodations for passing hikers:
http://www.highjinksranch.net/az-trail.html  Is this still the case?

If we proceed, it will be subject to:

• Protection class should be “9”.  8B converts to a 9.
• Excluding building that has travel trailer built into it - does not qualify for our program
• Exclude barn per agent note
• Woodburning stove questionnaire for unit in Casita building
• Since this is a significant historical site, we would not be comfortable offering replacement cost.  If we proceed, functional replacement cost could be offered.
• Please provide annual premium.  We will want to add a surcharge for the extended response time.
• Determine if there are any animals or farming on the premises.
//7/20/17  Answers to all provided and proceeded w/terms.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: 07/21 advised to add a 20-25% surcharge for response time. K.Burdine

Risk Details: 2008 home used seasonally w/WBS as primary heat. Acceptable installation. Any chance we could consider?

Risk Details: 03/10/2018-claim closed, $228,893, fire accidental, no negligence, repairs made but decided to renovate

Risk Details: Risk is for HUB, large agent for Hull. Agents says there is interest in the home for purchase. Since large agent, I approved one more term w/15% surcharge. Advised it is the last.

Risk Details: Tail end construction (only 30 days left) and insured's father is the GC w/construction supervisor and other hired subs. Current company found out about reno and cancelled.

• App states this is a 1950 building, no updates listed.  Could you please confirm?  Are there any updates to the 2nd floor tenant space?  Please send me a copy of the Older Home Questionnaire and any other info you obtain.  If there is no roof update, we should exclude. If it is updated, thank you for recognizing the flat roof and applying the $10K deductible.
• App states “Insured hired licensed contractors”.  Is there a GC managing the renovation, or is the insured acting as GC.  If the insured is acting as GC, we wouldn’t be able to write this.  If there is a GC managing the reno, please send me a copy of the builders risk questionnaire.

Risk Details: 1960 home updated, no alarms, 7 minute response, brush zone. The insured has his sheet metal business for heat and air type work ran out of an outbuilding. He has no employees or customers coming to the property. He has a CGL policy in place for the business.
Reason(s) for Decision:
Approved w/Total Business Exclusion form, subject to:
• Is there at least 20 feet between the dwelling and business? 
• If there is welding, fabricating, or other increased hazardous activity, is there proper electrical service and fire protection in the structure?  (so as not to pose a hazard to the dwelling)
• If there is “hazardous activity” is there a limited amount of personal belongings stored in the other structure?
• Is the separate commercial policy for buildings, business contents, and liability maintained by you or retail agent
There is a good ins score.

MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Considered if any phys dmg exposure exists from guns on premises. I suppose a student could mis-fire and shoot one of the buildings. Not the type of ammo that will cause "explosions". If any students end up in the house and a loss occurs, TBE will exclude coverage.

Risk Details: 1995 home not in brush. WRS 26. Liab loss 6/23/16. 17 y/o son involved in the plaintiff taking a substance that later led to his death. $601,000 settlement. Quoted without liability. Son is now 19, in college, and does not live with the parents. He lives with grandparents. Possible business on premises
Reason(s) for Decision: No liability. Son no longer in home. Ran score. Need info on business. UPDATE 3/13/2019: agent confirmed no business on premises. As such, approved subject to liability exclusion. MB
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: 633. 1.20 surcharge category. Probably good considering there was a major lawsuit.

Risk Details: 2001 home on same property as insured's business.  Sawtooth Rifles LLC.  Insd assembles and gunsmiths riles and guns. Small parts manufacturing.  Detached building 15' from the home.  TBE and there will be a GL.
Reason(s) for Decision: Reviewed website. This is a class of business that represents an exposure we are not comfortable writing. Possible exorbitant defense costs.

Risk Details: 1996 home with trucking business on property. Eff date 5/2/15. Total business excl in draft status waiting for Jeff to okay.
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked business on prop questions. Can do with Total Biz Excl if they can wait for it to be approved; PC 10 per PPC I ran.

Risk Details: Home has been quoted with 1% named storm but changed to 2%. Agent is moving business. Can we honor the 1%?
Reason(s) for Decision: Send AAL questionnaire.  If they return, plug into AAL rater.  Need to confirm with Jeff to make any exception to the 2% required ded.//Got info, ran thru rater/CQ. Current rate=$2,120 w/2% premium. We need $1460 for the non-wind and $8806 for the wind rate. Not going to make the exception.

Risk Details: Frame home built in 1900. Full roof in 2016 and partial for wiring (1990), heating (2006) and plumbing (1996). Two areas to the home. Second half is not accessible to the living area, including separate driveway. Post office is operated out of the other side.
Reason(s) for Decision: Must attach TBE for post office on other half. Feel comfortable there is good separation from the USPS on the other side. Also can only offer FRC/ACV settlement due to partial updates and age of home.

Risk Details: 2008 log home, in a PC10. ISO comes back with this as PC 10W. Response times are less than 10 minutes. The home is on 40 acres, and there is a cave on the property that has been fully explored. No losses. Being non-renewed due to exposure (log and unprotected).
Reason(s) for Decision: Will approve as long as it is confirmed there are no tours or any other related ventures with the cave. If confirmed, approval to release subject to an acceptable unprotected questionnaire and active central station fire alarms.

Risk Details: 1991 Dwelling with updated plumbing in 2010. Low brush. PC4 per ISO PPC. App says no prior coverage - can't tell if this is a new purchase.
Reason(s) for Decision: Liab okay, insured not too famous. Why no prior coverage - may need to apply 5% s/c for lapse, 10% for long lapse.

Risk Details: 1990 2 unit dwelling updated recently. Prior freezing loss 1/18 $65K. Repairs done, plumbing replaced. Heat was maintained. Gas meter malfunction. Carrier is subrogating against gas company. Seasonal, insured checks on dwelling regularly. Quoted w/$10K water ded.
Reason(s) for Decision: Cause indicates no negligence or insulation issue. Owner checks regularly. Unit 2 is rented.

Risk Details: 2003 log home seasonal. Road is dirt and not maintained in the winter. 20 min response time otherwise. Photos look good. FireLine is High 4 with light/med fuels and no access problems. Woodstove in pics looks close and no wall protection but can't see clearly.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved subject to acceptable WBS quest.

Risk Details: 2003 log home seasonal. Road is dirt and not maintained in the winter. 20 min response time otherwise. Photos look good. FireLine is High 4 with light/med fuels and no access problems. Woodstove in pics looks close and no wall protection but can't see clearly.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved subject to acceptable WBS quest.

Risk Details: 1982 dome home. Updated.  16 minute response time on 10 acres. Insd is retired firefighter. Paid FD. Brush zone.
Reason(s) for Decision: We are not comfortable with dome homes, and concern with going over 15 minutes in a brush zone w/heavy trees.

Risk Details: 1993 home w/2010 updates. Roof yet to be updated. 4 prior wind/hail losses 8/18 $1743 hail; 6/18 $20K hail; 1/17 $7K wind; 7/17 $24K hail. Quoted w/roof excl and existing dmg excl until reroofed, then 3% wind/hail
Reason(s) for Decision: Concern with location - multiple wind/hail losses.  3% will only partly mitigate future losses.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Reviewed w/JB and we agree. Looks like a bad location. B score.

Risk Details: 1992 home, being non renewed by Lexington due to not being on dual street (their guidelines have changed to no longer insure these risks). Two previous water loss in 2016 due to a slab leak.
Reason(s) for Decision: Not much of a concern with the no dual street issue. Response time is still low and protection class is still good. Water loss, will want to apply $10,000 water deductible. However, if aggressive repairs were not made to the slab leak, water damage should be excluded. Also, a fully completed app, current one is old and missing some questions.

Risk Details: Home was built in 2000 of frame construction.  Primary PC 10 NOT in brush and one fire loss that has currently paid out over $300k. Fire was determined accidental/undetermined. Home is being rebuilt at this time.
Reason(s) for Decision: Open claim (Fire loss), $300K payout to dat-undetermined loss cause, 30 min respose time

Risk Details: Lapse since  04/2018 (was out of county and didn't realize policy cancelled). No loss letter was obtained.
Reason(s) for Decision: 5% surcharge, as long as home now monitored during absences

Risk Details: Agency received bind request the exact minute we emailed our moratorium. Can they bind?
Reason(s) for Decision: 1. Pointed out National Weather service already had restriction in place. 2. Since our memo went out, we are considering the restriction in place. 3. Retailers should be aware of possiblity of restrictions, not put things thru under the wire.

Risk Details: 1981 home w/prior $400,000 loss in Feb 2012.  Fire to new purchase caused by Water Tank. Home just now completed, renewal up 12/30. No fire marshall report yet - agt has requested.
Reason(s) for Decision: Per our conversation earlier today, please reply back when you get the Fire Marshall Report.  We’re open to these large losses with a charge for the loss as well as an additional surcharge.  Additionally, we’d like a little more information on why it took 4 ½ years to put the home back together?  Was a licensed GC and licensed contractors used?  Did the insured do the work?  What are his credentials?
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Insured is a licensed contractor - that's why it took so long.  In business for 25 years. Class A genl engineering license and Class B genl builder license. Insisted on fire marshall report. (There was an arson investigation but determined to be an accident with HWT, per agent)  12/22:  Received detailed investigation report from State Farm. Accidental loss due to HWT issue. Approved w/10% schg due to size of loss.

Risk Details: 1959 home updated over 20 years ago. B&B -app mentions a GL. Agent proposing ACV roof and EHP rider. Home looks nice. Info on trip advisor. No formal advertising - $5500/yr receipts.
Reason(s) for Decision: need to see rates. They have a B&B program.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Rates look good.

Risk Details: 1988 year built. Two fire losses, one for $518,785 and one for $25,022. No details of either of the losses were provided
Reason(s) for Decision: Declined due to fire losses. Advised for future reference, that we would need to see C&O or fire marshal report for large fire losses in order to consider.

Risk Details: Home has 2 prior theft claims: 2014 $20K; 2015 $15K. Many homes broken into in the neighborhood. Insd has since added alarms. Quoting with $10-$15K deductible.
Reason(s) for Decision: Agent verifying if any high valued handbags or scheduled items. Has probably $35,000 in purses. Not a limited class. No SPP class. Not sure we want to schedule.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Advised agent we are not scheduling. Cov C. Charge for losses.

Risk Details: 1945 risk with no heater.
Reason(s) for Decision: Checked historic weather in Malibu. There has never been a recorded day of temps below 33 degrees.

Risk Details: 1966 build, 3 water claims in 4 years (all repaired 08/2017-$36K-leak; 10/01/2015-$10K; 05/18/2014-$5k (frozen pipe)
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved w/ water exclusion//discussed further w/ agent, agreed with $20K water ded

Risk Details: Two large fire events, both originating in the attic. Ongoing renovations have taken a long time due to DC regulations.
Reason(s) for Decision: Despite newer electrical (2013), two losses have occurred very close together. Not comfortable with the current wiring. Mr Elkins installed attic air handler near the origin of the fire.

Risk Details: Home built in 1932, full updates in 2013. Two fires - one electrical event wiring in the attic (11/18/17) and another fire in the attic (4/10/18). RC is $112268.16.
Reason(s) for Decision: Despite newer electrical (2013), two losses have occurred very close together. Not comfortable with the current wiring. Mr Elkins installed attic air handler near the origin of the fire.

Risk Details: Was with admitted carrier who discovered construction and got off the risk. Alison wasn't sure if this was "mid-term renovation".
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised these do not need to be submitted. We are concerned with ones where a carrier gets off due to bad risk, or it goes beyond a year. Ok'd her approving these with 10% s/c.

System Reason(s) for Referral: Vacant prior to demolition then COC
Risk Details: Insured purchased a home. It will be vacant for up to 6 months while insured obtains permits to demolish then rebuild the home.
Reason(s) for Decision: Concern with what value the home holds for us to insure. Moral hazard? Attractive nuisance? What if we aren't told of the demo? Discussed with Tim C. Seems best direction is to not get involved in any of these situations until demo is done, even if X-liab there is still exposure.

Risk Details: Confusion w/prior carrier covering the COC. Now 60% done. Close contact of agent. Apps and forms look in order.
Reason(s) for Decision: Reason for decl, canc, nrn? Add surcharge. 3 month-1 year term okay.

Risk Details: 1967 home w/ part update to plumbing. Full update to flat roof in 2012. Wire 87, roof 12. Prior losses: 3/18 liability -insd hit veh w/bike $1,946. 4/17 water heater leak $13K, 3/16 water slab leak $30K. Asked to waive liab loss since it was paid and is being s/c on primary home.  WRS 6.
Reason(s) for Decision: Concern w/1967 home, 2 water losses, part update, no info on mitigation. Asked about repairs and proposed ded. Likely water dmg excl will be required. Need RM, OHQ. Advised no backup or mold due to water losses. Good ins score.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: I ran Ins score 793

Risk Details: 1993 rental. Almost $100K loss in 2016. Upstairs bath water line broke. Damage repaired, claim closed. Agent offered water dmg excl or $50K ded w/surcharge.
Reason(s) for Decision: suggested 10-20% surcharge - up to agent.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: agent updated that surcharged 60% on original rate.  This puts Markel at $2,317 prior to taxes and fees but only the $50K deductible.  I think the insured would be getting more coverage with Markel; hence the higher premium.

Risk Details: Agent quoted with an eff date of 6/23/16. Insured did not make decision in time and there has been a lapse.  2007 duplex vacation rental. Tile roof. Not in brush zone. Ran insurance score, in low 800's.
Reason(s) for Decision: Gave Lisa the option of applying 5-10% surcharge. This is an agent who gives Hull all their RPS quotes; insured is in real estate. May be an important insured. Ins score is good.

Risk Details: 1918 dwelling with full updates/remodeled in 2018. Purchased 4/2018. In name of LLC which is solely owned by the trust. Agent wants to include trust as Addl Insd.
Reason(s) for Decision: Since they own the LLC, they have an insurable interest.  All are the same individuals. No commercial exposure.

Risk Details: 1987 frame home. Agent quoted at $4,503 and wanted to match $3,281.
Reason(s) for Decision: We can write, but we can't meet the $3,281 request.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Bethany and Kylie rated this out for us.

System Reason(s) for Referral: Tenant will have a marijuana grow operation
Risk Details:
REFERRING DUE TO TENANT WANTING TO SET UP 3 COMMERCIAL GREENHOUSES ON THE PROPERTY, 20 X 40, AS A MARIJUANA GROW OPERATION.
THE GREENHOUSES WOULD BE THE HOOP TYPE TEMPORARY STRUCTURES.
THE GREENHOUSES WOULD BE PERMITTED & INSPECTED.  THERE WOULD BE NO SALES OF PRODUCTS FROM LOCATION.  CAN WE PRESENT THE SECONDARY RENTAL TERMS WITH A TOTAL BUSINESS EXCLUSION?
Reason(s) for Decision: Even if a local municipality considers an operation like this "legal", it is still federally illegal.  That creates some coverage challenges.  Additionally an operation like this creates a very high theft hazard causing a concern with the exposure of the other structures and primary home.  Finally, the heat lamps needed in the grow operation increase the fire hazard.  Even with the total business exclusion, these issues could still present a hazard to our covered structures.

Risk Details: Renewal w/25 min response time. Did not find on approval log from last year. CA in brush 1986 partially updated. No alarms.
Reason(s) for Decision:
Agency was aware of response time last year, but policy did not get referred. Ran FireLine - 18 fire score - Extreme brush. 25 min response,accessible, but not paved. 
4/17/17 follow up from Fire Department - email in file that response time is 10 minutes. (From CAL FIRE fire chief)

Risk Details: Applicant had harassment claim filed against him. It was closed with no payment, but prior carrier is still non-renewing.
Reason(s) for Decision: Even though nothing was paid, the type of claim that occurred is one that would cause costly defense costs, even with no liability. We are going to pass on this risk.

Risk Details: 2 story dwelling-lower level is law firm, upper is insd residence. No foot traffic in residence. Has commercial ins in place.
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised Leslie they are really better off to insure the building commercially, and we write an HO-4.

Risk Details: 2005 year built, updates to roof in 2016 and heating 2018. Insured owns Alpacas of the Heartland LLC, an alpaca farm at the location. Previously used to be open year round, people could come and feed the alpacas, had a gift shop in the home. In 2018 the shop closed and now they only have the farm portion open to public Sept-Nov, and only at certain times on certain days. Website says they may still do some educational events and classes. Was not able to find anything online adverse about the business, all good reviews, no injury reports, no complaints.
Reason(s) for Decision: Since the time that they are open has decreased significantly, willing to approve subject to a full liability exclusion, TBE, and GL in place and maintained for the business. Not as big as a concern as it would be if it were horses or other larger animals that could cause serious injury.

Risk Details: Boat and RV storage on premises.  Total business exclusion applied.  Located within 3-400 ft of home. GL is in place and excluding Other Structures.  No employees, no foot traffic.   We currently write the GL Policy.
Reason(s) for Decision: maintenance of GL pol through agency, acceptable PC (not listed on app), TBE and other structure exclusion as quoted

Risk Details: 1992 home no updates.  Shingle roof in good condn per app. Prior decline/cancel/nrn question not answered. Prior covg, prior losses not answered. Agent quoting w/no liab. GL in place. Per aerial and online photos, there is not a separate building. It appears the business is conducted in the basement of the house. Biz has separate driveway and entrance.
Reason(s) for Decision: Want to see website and confirm location. But looking good to go.  GL in place. No liab on policy. Not including Total Business Excl as that will cause gaps in home and contents coverage if a loss occurs. Don't see a dog business increasing the physical damage exposure to the dwelling, so okay with it in the house w/no exclusions. Roof exclusion requested.//8/1 reviewed addl info all ok, notes in file.

Risk Details: 1982 dwelling this high profile EDM DJ is providing for his father.  Property only. Liab is elsewhere.

Risk Details: TIV is over authority of $500k. Masonry home built in 1820. Not provided any other information
Reason(s) for Decision: Need more information about the risk due to the age of home.

Risk Details: 1966 home with 3 water losses: 1/14 $44K; 2/16 $41K; 2/18 $10K. Agt quoted w/$25K water ded.

Risk Details: 1969 home. No info on updates. Insured is guitarist for Dirty Heads. Regae band. This is his seasonal. We bet it is for snowboarding. Online info okay. Ran by Jeff.

Product/Occupancy: HO3 Seasonal w/Rental and Builders Risk
Risk Details: 1977 home with updates. Location address is vague. On water side of PCH, Hwy 1 near Rocky Creek Bridge.  Prof appraisal uses this address as did the MLS. If >15 minute response time discuss additional surcharge.//6/29 Retailer spoke to FD, fully documented. This is PC9, 15 min response. no problem finding the home. Sent approval

Risk Details: 2016 home PC5. Insured owns and operates OCR Training on property. Agent quoted X-Liability. Insd has GL and participant accident insurance.

Risk Details: Risk in middle of trailer park, all owned by corporation. GL coverage on trailer park. Risk Details: 1968 home updated in 2001, roof in 2006. Other structure has a wood shake roof. No special flat roof criteria for Burns. Has a $2500 ded currently.

Risk Details: Asking for RC settlement type. Home is 1953 masonry veneer construction with full updates to the roof in 2017 and heating in 2015. Partial updates to plumbing and wiring in 2017 and 2016. CS Fire and burglar alarm
Reason(s) for Decision: Surcharge for all 3 claims. Explained valuation needs to be handled differently if they want full RC. If there are antique, obsolete or custom construction materials, the valuation must take into consideration the replacement of these at the correct amount, not the FRC we normally would require.

Risk Details: Two water losses. First was $120 but contractor error and another $14k water loss. Prior carrier doing subro for damages from contractor. New contract handling current renovations. Reason(s) for Decision: Sensors and shut off not yet installed. Water exclusion until then. $10k deductible unless house gets re-piped and then can use AOP.
New location ok

Risk Details: Home was built in 1962 and roof updated in 2010.  Looking for HO3 with FRC settlement.  PC3 with no alarms and no losses. Insured has inhome business - Dog Grooming, no employees.  Insured's have a completely separate entrance for the business which is in their basement.
Reason(s) for Decision: Subject to TBE and x-liab based on level of exposure

Risk Details: "1970" 6000 SF veneer building. Lower level was commercial. Now converted to all 1 residence. Online shows 1925 9525 SF. Roof appears flat. Cov A is low for even 6000 SF. Ins score is very good, so less concerned about RC/MV gap.
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked Matt to verify year built, SF, and Cov A. Advised of $10K water ded for flat roof.

Risk Details: 1947 home updated but app doesn't show it. Statement from FD indicates 16 minute response time + mutual aid. Clayton fire over 20 miles away as of today. ISO CA Brush Fire Report attached. N/A for brush rating. RiskMeter also attached - medium brush.

Risk Details: 1947 home updated. Roof not updated. FD is 6.6 mi away. Mix paid and volunteer. Some gravel road. Quest completed by FD shows 16 min response. Brush not cleared per PC quest. Barn and chicken coop per online source.

Risk Details: Insured will be using barn as primary home, former home as other structure (not rented)

Risk Details: 2009 dwelling. Open liab loss $300K. Insd accidentally shot target spotter and long range shooting range. It was ruled an accident per agent who has known insd for 50 years.

Risk Details: Built in 1930/updated, new purchase, no losses, tenant occupied, frame,

Risk Details: Primary home with seven reported claims since 2016. Brick home built in 2003 with 3600 square feet.  Losses have been due to falling objects (glass stovetop broke), two water damage claims, lightening, mysterious disappearance, dog who ate the flooring and Hurricane damage.

I went back and forth but in the end decided we didn't need to actually spend a lot of time in an area we don't want extra growth.

Risk Details: 2003 frame home no losses. 30 minute response. PC quest indicates winding road, accessible.

Risk Details: 1976 home updated in 2016 2/ 2 losses: 13 dishwasher line $17K; 11/15 meat smoker on deck caught home on fire $300k. Insd may sell lularoe and tupperware. Agt offering X-liab. Wants BPP.

Risk Details: 2006 home in PC9. 2 family dwelling. Insured lives in rear 1600 SF section. Rents the "hall" portion out to her sister's business. She holds weddings and events in the hall area.

Risk Details: 2 fire losses - 2/2015 $57,301 and 11/2016 $484,248. On CLUE report provided there is also a hail loss from 4/2014 for $66,225.

Brush rates were not applied correctly, and risks that are now ineligible were sent to us. Discussed with Melissa, who sent communication to Danielle about this matter. We are having a follow up discussion with Bill and Danielle on 1/18/19 to confirm/discuss the updated guidelines.

Reason(s) for Decision: Not comfortable with the loss.

Reason(s) for Decision: Guest home is not rented out.  Monitored alarms. Cal fire is closer than FD listed and is present all winter (unlike most CalFire stations).

Risk Details:
Business on premises (Divine Adult Family Home LLC) does have GL and professional liability coverage.  They provide live in care and daily activities(getting dresses, eating, bathing, reminder to take medication, but no meds are given to clients). This is an overnight facility. Home was built in 1994 and roof updated in
2010 of frame construction.  PC1 with no alarms and no losses.

Risk Details: 2005 frame dwelling visible to neighbors. 2% wind/hail. Lloyds $1951. Agent wants to match which would require a 12% total credit.
Reason(s) for Decision: Request Withdrawn by Jill - insured went elsewhere.  Nice home per online info. Approved 12-13% credit.// Later in the day I got another referral for what looks like the same risk from Jill. Replied to her with a copy and asked for more info.

Risk Details: 1997 log home on 64 acres. Gated community 16.3 mi from FD with 33 min drive time on partially paved and unpaved roads. May not be accessible year round. Inadequate water supply.

Risk Details: Home insured for 7 years w/AmFam. They are getting off because they don't write the coml package. Insured has their construction company on the property. Barn/Shop used for storage and equipment.

MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Business questions spell out a good situation. Sketch shows separation.  Approved with total business exclusion.

Risk Details: 1974 home in Estate name will be occupied by daughter who has in home business.  She has a website for promotional products.  She is just the middle man. All items are ordered online and drop shipped from manufacturer.

Everything is done electronically- mailing home address is only used for correspondence, catalogs, and purchase orders. Accordingly to some contracts, she must have a physical address-not a PO. Based on this info, I'm ok with issuing terms. LKT 4/25/16

Risk Details: 2016 home primary and rented on AirBnb. Insured is free agent wide receiver AML. Was w/TN Titans. No negative press. Includes $1M liability.

Risk Details: 1955 Frame with $200k in renovations scheduled with licensed and insured general contractor. The risk is ~1 mile from the coast. They have debited it 23.5%.
Reason(s) for Decision: Risk is closer than 2 miles to the coast which is currently ineligible. Risks with interior only renovation can be considered, but this one is far more extensive and involves both interior and exterior work.

Risk Details: 1948 home with only roof update. Many app questions re systems are blank. Insd has weddings and events on premises but not in the house. Aerial photo provided, but not sure what it is depicting. Prior hail loss 6/17 $3698.
Reason(s) for Decision:
Asked all the business questions. If we proceed, subj are:  • Apply Total Business Exclusion
• It seems we should be applying functional replacement cost due clear info on app that there have been no updates
• Prior to binding, obtain all missing answers on app about wiring, plumbing and heating.  Most of the fields are blank, and some of these are eligibility issues.
• Order EHP to ensure non-updated systems are operational and safe
9/20 - info came back. sounds okay. website reviewed. replied w/terms.

Risk Details: 1967 home w/no update to plumbing. Frozen pipe break loss still open. $36K 3/7/18.  Also 2016 ice dam. Agt quoted w/ $10K water damage, exist dmg excl.
Reason(s) for Decision: Need more info on the open water loss and type of plumbing pipes that are not updated. If ineligible pipes, risk should be declined. Also need OHQ.

Risk Details: 2005 year built. Home has a daycare, licensed for 12 children. Additionally, there are 4H animals on premises (3 horses, 2 goats, 8 pigs, 9 rabbits, and 13 chickens. No farming, the animals are "for the kids". They do have a CGL for the daycare, would apply TBE.
Reason(s) for Decision: Due to the combination of 12 children daycare and a larger number of animals that are for the children, we are passing on this risk. We feel, even with exclusions, that defense costs could be exorbitant if a loss occurs.

Risk Details: 1975 home that agent is unsure if it is mobile/manuf or modular. All evidence points to mobile/manuf.
1950 home updated. Not first row. Agent says he wanted okay for wind, since wind guidelines changed.
Reason(s) for Decision: Provided current guideline info and asked what he heard changed. Bethany and I checked - found no changes.

Risk Details:
1994 dwelling.  Agent quoted and 3 losses were revealed. Bind request came in and 4th loss was discovered. 1.       03/01/15 – dishwasher line broke, damage to flooring and cabinetry in kitchen, but carrier declined to pay, $00 paid out
2.       09/11/15 – AC condenser unit leaked into wall, due to faulty installation (overflow line was not long enough,) $2,581.00 paid out
3.       09/11/16 – AC unit leak again, but after this, they installed an automatic shut-off valve on the AC unit to avoid any future problems, $00 paid out
4.       1/27/2017 – Pipe burst - $38,601
Agent will surcharge for 4 losses and apply a water damage deductible.  $50K required.
Reason(s) for Decision: The dishwasher line and the pipe burst are the real pipe concerns. $25K will mitigate future losses.  The AC leak is different and has been mitigated by insured w/ a shut-off. // Lex came back w/$25K ded and lower price. I withdrew terms 10/5/17.

Risk Details: 1939 year built that has not been gutted and rebuilt, so FRC only available, confirmed by agent. Three smaller water losses in 2017 - 5/2017 sparkletts bottled delivered had leaked $5000, 6/2017 newer garbage disposal rusted out $10000, 7/2017 drain clogged $10000. No real concerns with the losses, agent applied $10,000 water damage deductible and additional 10% surcharge.
Reason(s) for Decision: The water losses listed are not really related to poor plumbing, so the subjectivity mentioned of $10k water deductible seems acceptable. Also, agree with the 10% surcharge of the losses. New roof in 2014 so no concerns there. Approving as quoted.

Risk Details: 1996 home no losses. Insured is a sheep farmer with 283 acres. Nationwide writes the farm. DP1 ACV no liability per agent request.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved subject to removal of Cov B; or exclusion of all farm structures and fencing. Also subject to 15% surcharge for lapse.

Risk Details: Agent wondering if $20K hail CAT claim would be surcharged and if the risk is eligible with 2 losses.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved w/surcharge for 2 losses. Advised we do charge for CAT claims.

Risk Details: 1978 home w/2012 roof update and 2000 new heat. 9 acres. Ben says they have an RCE.

Risk Details: 1972 home being renovated inside by insured who will act as GC, hiring out other contractors. He is self employed heating contractor.

Risk Details: 1920 build, some updates. 2 family home. NRN by Lex due to claims.  4/15 hail (roof replaced)  8/15 fire $27K 4/16 fire open $266K.

Risk Details: Duplex-front rented, back vacant. Insured actively looking for tenant for the back. No brush or losses. 1945 build, will complete old home questionaire prior to release

Risk Details: 1964 home updated. Risk has 5 prior losses. 3 of them were from an issue with tree roots growing in plumbing 5/16-6/16. Plumbing replaced in entire home. Tree issue fixed.  5/13/16 wind $675. 4/17 water $866 window sill leak. Windows have been updated. Write w/20% surcharge?

Risk Details: Applicant occupation: Producer-no recent films

Risk Details: open dog bite claim-dog bit cleaning lady

Risk Details: Was a COC for 6 months then rewritten, but insured/contractor had some interior work left and new carrier was not happy and got off the risk. Plumbing and wiring is complete.  (Even if some attic wiring is done, at least insured is a elec contractor.)

7 bedroom dwelling across from a college, currently vacant while insured decides if he might want to rent. Online photos look good. Claim in Aug 2017, break in, turned off water, stole copper. Risk Details: 2004 home. First row in the Keys.

Risk Details: 8 trusts jointly own a home that was sold to an individual and rented out. The individual defaulted and the trust is taking it back, letting the renter stay and putting it up for sale. Risk Details: New build. Insured is a self employed contractor. His company would be doing the work.

Get name, addr, dob and we can run ins score - telling factor. 4. Concern with mold and unrepaired structure, cleanup? 6. Insd says it will take 6 months to complete everything. ??   Summary-if financially sound and makes sense how they could live without the repair, we could consider. Advised Tamika I am ONLY considering since this is a very good agent of hers. Will take some convincing for us to do it.

Risk Details: 1988 home remodeled. Prior NRN due to brush (admitted). Expires tomorrow.  On 9/11, the insured's German shepherd bit someone. Mrs is an attorney. There were no marks, person said they were okay, went home and filed suit. No reserve yet. $500K liab requested. Agent says good insured and good risk otherwise.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved with either animal excl or limited animal liab form.  Compliance has confirmed (and Jeff too) that we are comfortable with our limited animal liab form even if excluded dog or dog that bit. Open liab claim is not a worry that it could come back to us.

Risk Details: Primary home with 4 month rental when they travel. Will we allow personal liability. In UW research found insured's online business website. Also other online info that may be connected to the business. They are using their home address. They do excavating - heavy equip. Sent business questions to Allison and advised we may need to apply total business excl. Sent copy - it's not on SCU's forms page yet.
Reason(s) for Decision:
I don’t see a good way to move forward with terms.  The only way we could do it is with the Total Business Exclusion.  Unfortunately, the shop is actually part of Coverage A, so in essence we’d be excluding coverage for the entire home and shop structures.  That won’t do the insured any good.  And I’m not comfortable going forward without the exclusion.

I’m definitely wondering why the retail agent didn’t mention this business to us, especially since they write the commercial.  It’s a pretty big concern!  I’m glad we found out, because our HO-3 mainly excludes business in Other Structures, so I’m not sure our policy exclusions would have applied, and we would surely want them to.

If the shop was detached from the home, we could call it Coverage B and then our Total Business Exclusion would be more clear cut.  I’m sure they could more easily get it added to the commercial policy.  That might be something to consider if they have trouble getting coverage.

Risk Details: 2008 home. Ran ins score: score okay, but shows 2 bankruptcies - another one in 2013. Self employed, owns 2 homes. Mortgage balances modified w/bankruptcy. Primary home shows up on foreclosure.

Risk Details: 2006 home in brush with lapse. Unclear how long. SF prior carrier nonrenewed due to bike theft claim.
Reason(s) for Decision:
• Is this a new purchase, or how long has the insured owned the home?
• Am I understanding that there is a lapse in coverage on this home as well as on another location that is a full time rental?  Could you tell me the reason for lapse of coverage?  Has it been lapsed since 2/2017?
• Tell me about the lapse on the other rental home.  Reason, how long, what is the TIV of that risk.
• Notes on app say that SF cancelled over a bike theft claim?  That seems unusual.  Was there more than one claim?  Could we get the SF loss runs?
• What is the distance of this home to any current wildfires?
Between you and me, there are some red flags on this risk:
• It’s usually a bad sign when someone has multiple policies lapse, and on top of it a theft loss.  
• Info provided shows the home is up for sale for a price lower than what was paid 10 years ago. (A concern if this is not a new purchase.)
If we do go forward an additional surcharge may apply.
A+ shows no losses. // 8/30/17 Add 10% surcharge to to lapse mindset. Insured is buying this home - new purchase. Existing home lapsed 2/17 - they are living there now. Will turn into rental.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Ins Score 800

Risk Details: Risk is in Lake Arrowhead (42352) which is currently capped at $50M. Agent is trying to get this increased, but meanwhile is asking for an exception.
