• PC9 or less with 15 minute response time

Risk Details: 2016 water and theft losses. Water was $173k. Home has since been re-piped and they now have monitored alarm. Also have CS Burglar alarm. Frame home with stucco built in 1989.
Reason(s) for Decision: Redid all of the piping and now have fully monitored alarms for both theft and water. Confirm fire alarms.

Risk Details: Vacant dwelling owned by "shock jock” in the Cleveland OH radio market. Some online antics. Dwelling has been vacant 2 years. Prem liab requested.
Reason(s) for Decision: Tasha is trying to quote with us - we've received several. Ex liab if we do it.  JB had addl questions about why moving ins now and why vacant 1.5 years and now selling.// 2.19.19 Lloyds cancelled subagt. Insd got married, bought bigger house, finally decided to sell old house. Ok'd with no liab and $.35 rate (vs quoted .25). Discussed/approved with John.

Risk Details: insured syndicated radio talk show host for Rover's Morning Glory
Reason(s) for Decision: approval to offer property terms on this risk. However, based on the current high-profile of the applicant, he would not be eligible for liability coverage.

Risk Details: historical home (no tours), quoted at FRC
Reason(s) for Decision: online review, app, OK

Risk Details: 2 structures (main and guest) on property. Insured wants them to be combined under a single Cov A limit. This is how tax and title are and he wants them to match.
Reason(s) for Decision: Can't combine both under A. Did agree to write one policy with A & B.

Risk Details: 1895 home well maintained and updated for an employee of XSB. Not gut rehabbed. Adding FRC. $2500 ded.  (1900 rule)
Audit Notes: One of the first policies bound. Verify condition looks good

Risk Details: Owned by football player and former teammates. Used as upscale tailgate condo and also sold as exclusive package for high prices. Matt uncovered this information online.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved subj to $3K prem and $2500 AOP and $5000 theft deductible per our discussion.

Risk Details: Producer, prior approval as DP3, but will now use as primary. Updates in 2016
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved; reviewed and nothing recent for producer. Ok w/ liab

Risk Details: Nice home per online photos on 10 acres. Nearby airport. Building on prop used as shop for insured's sign/framing company. Was a hangar. Agent quoted with TBE.
Reason(s) for Decision: GL maintained by retailer, TBE, All UW questions answered, advise if bldg ever used as a hangar. Photos show adequate distance from dwelling. 10 acres, so airport exposure is not a concern.

Risk Details: CPA-75-100 clients over a period from about February to April come into insureds home for consultation. Agreed OK to submit for consideration with a total business exclusion.
Reason(s) for Decision: Relatively low exposure, ok with liab as long as total business excluded

Risk Details: Home as asbestos roofing. Agent advised they were aware of concerns with asbestos siding, but was not sure on roofing.
Reason(s) for Decision: Same concerns are present with asbestos roofing as with asbestos siding. Too may concerns - liability, partial losses, valuations, etc. Declined

Risk Details: Home built 1979, new roof 2014. Plumbing in 2005. Insured's husband, Cory, is an MD who practices from his home. Has been in practice since 1992. Up to 40 patients in home per week. Has GL, professional, and work comp coverage.
Reason(s) for Decision: TBE due to practice done in home, seems to be responsible with other business coverages. Animal exclusion will also be applied, mentioned by agent. Confirm business questionnaire is completed and reviewed.

Risk Details: 1992 home. Big Bear Water District as AI ok. Agt quoted as PC3. Looks like it may be a 10.
Reason(s) for Decision: Need PC quest to verify PC. No PPC hit at address. RM shows station is 11-12 mi away.  6/6-clearly a PC3. Approved.

Risk Details: 1955 (maybe 1993?) dwelling used for adult home care/memory care. 2 employees, 4 patients, 2 owners live in the dwelling. Online website looks like a good facility.
Reason(s) for Decision: Apply TBE, commercial policies, updated app.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: PER ADDITIONAL CONVERSATION WITH JEFF MAY, WE SHOULD NOT BE WRITING THESE RISKS WHERE THE CLIENTS LIVE THERE. THIS IS TOO MUCH EXPOSURE. TOO MUCH LIABILITY THAT WE DON'T FEEL OUR EXCLUSIONS CAN CONTAIN.

Risk Details: New build with about a 90 day lapse. When construction completed in Feb 2019, they moved from a coml loan to a personal loan and there were delays with closing date and appraisal. This delayed the acquisition of insurance.  Partner will get Cert of Occ and no loss letter. $1,000 ded quoted.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: I ran ins score 847

Risk Details: 2008 log home made of factory milled logs.
1978 home w/roof update. Insured operates Paddack Wrecker service on property. Photo showing separation provided. GL/prop policy in place. App questions not completed.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved w/Total Business Excl Form Subj to confirmation of no public traffic near or in home; coml pol maintained by retailer; app complete.  Per Delta 10/13, agt does not control Coml. Advised we could do that X-liability.

Risk Details: 1900? Year built. App says 1920 but inspection says 1900. Per inspection, systems have been updated within last 10 years. Agent is asking if they can quote with removing FRC, as they typically do for this specific agent.
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised what the guidelines are (pre 1945 not gutted and rebuilt, but have had updates, only FRC). Advised we may be able to make exceptions for risks that are much closer to the 1945 cutoff, but with this being 19001 and no mention of gut/rebuild, we will stay on the requirement of FRC.

Risk Details: 1930 warehouse updated in 1996. 900+ SF apartment in the warehouse which is used personally as a garage. Roof update ?? 2 layers of tin.  No PC provided. Part of Susanville is PC10. Asked Jill to verify brush and PC and response time.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved - verify roof update, verify PC and response time.

Risk Details: 1999 home. $140K bathroom toilet overflow loss 5/17. $5,000 slab leak 6/18. No mitigation. Asking if high ded or exclusion could apply.
Reason(s) for Decision: Exclude water damage, no mold, no backup.

Risk Details: 1864 build, no brush, PC 4, no losses,
Reason(s) for Decision: Has this home been completely gutted/remodeled? Since the 1864 build year was used on the rater, I am assuming it has not been. If there has not been a complete gut of the home, this property is not eligible for our product. If there has been a complete gut/remodel then we are able to use that year as the actual build year

Risk Details: Agent says new purchase, may be renovated, currently has a desk and works there. No running water. Electric only. 1935 home with some updates. Online photos show 2014 purchase which is supported by app included from 2014. Ins score poor.
Reason(s) for Decision:
Agents says new purchase, but the app shows purchase date of 7/2014 which matches what I find online.  In fact, the attached app is from 2014, which must be when the insured purchased.  FYI - Insurance score is poor.  Risk is currently vacant and appears to have been for almost 3 years.  Currently used for business purposes.  Possible plan to apply for a loan for renovations, but no guaranty this will happen. (May not be able to with their score, and it hasn't happened yet.)

Based on current use as business, the fact it has been vacant possibly for 3 years, and the fact that we don't have solid plans in process to renovate for occupancy, I would say this best belongs on a commercial policy.

My guess is it might be in the midst of renovation and they ran out of money.  (No running water?)  Or they've been applying for loans and have been unsuccessful and decided to use it as an office vs. leaving it empty.

Risk Details: 1997 4000SF NW of VA Beach. Internet shows 1830 year built on 48 acres. Addl quest sent to Charity
Reason(s) for Decision: Confirmed. Part of the home is 1830. Charity did not want to pursue finding out about renovation to that section of the house, so said she would tell the agent it was declined.

Risk Details: Insured had wind loss - dmg to roof 7/16 $13,403 paid. Claim is still open as insd is changing flat roof to vaulted roof. Freeze claim and wind claim also.
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised we don't like to take these on due to possible damage no one knows about. Even with exclusions and deductibles, we could get stuck.

Risk Details: 1998 dwelling w/tile roof and stucco siding. Updated in 2000. Insured suffered damage from Thomas fire. 2 separate losses. Fire 12/10/17 (dwelling and landscape $131K); Flood (mud flow from fire $108K). There were tenants there who were arrested for illegal substances. They are no longer there.
Reason(s) for Decision: Apply surcharge for 2 losses plus additional 15%. RM indicates high brush. FL (copy in file) is a 9 and does account for the Thomas fire.

Risk Details: 1989 home w/ 2 prior slab leak losses 9/14 $2K; 7/16 $75K. Also falling tree dmg 8/16 $12K. No riskmeter. Mold and backup not quoted.
Reason(s) for Decision: s/c for 2 losses. Water dmg excl as no info on mitigation. Confirm no addl tree threat. Reminded no water bu or mold. Asked for RiskMeter to be run and apply appro s/c.

Risk Details: PC10 & not accessible year round, appears to be 30 min response time; Secondary, log home, no losses, built in 2001, located in UT
Reason(s) for Decision: Response time may be less based on my research, but volunteer FD, not accessible year round

Risk Details: We are under $50 mil – I believe it is currently around $48,300,000 and the TIV on this one is under $1 million
Reason(s) for Decision: Confirming will not breach the zip code cap

Risk Details: 1997 year built, complete update to roof in 2015 after a $49k hail loss. Second wind/hail loss 5/2018 to siding, garage, pool for $20k, and 9/2018 broken pipe water loss $5717.
Reason(s) for Decision: They have $5k AOP and w/h deductibles quoted, think that is acceptable especially given the larger hail loss had a complete roof replacement afterwards. Approved subject to noting file if another considerably large wind/hail loss is sustained to consider increased deductible.

Risk Details: 1994 home not in brush. NRN question = yes. Not explained. 1/16 pipe break. 7/16 elderly mother of friend fell inside house. $70K reserve - still going through therapy.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approve subj to verif the NRN was due to losses and not something else.

Risk Details: 1980 frame dwelling. Has log siding. 15 min drive time by paid FD. 6.3 miles. No barriers. Full time residence, Mrs is homemaker. Med brush per RM. Photos shows cabin in woods with trees trimmed up. Many UW questions blank.
Reason(s) for Decision: Fireline shows "High 6, medium fuels, mod slope, no access issues."  Drive time by paid FD right at 15 minutes. Slight rate adjustment - 5% surcharge gets us to $0.58. Need uw questions answered.

Risk Details: 1981 home updated in 2010, roof fully updated in 2010. Lloyds quote coming less than ours. Can we match.
Reason(s) for Decision: If water damage, animal, and mold is removed, it is a 15% reduction to beat the rate by $25 or so. Ran insurance score which came back outstanding!

Risk Details: Home built in 2007. Vinyl siding, frame, Roof is original (11 years). Central Burglar and Smoke alarms?
Reason(s) for Decision: Trampoline exclusion,  no scheduled personal property, left theft deductible pending confirmation of CSA. Must charge for all three losses.

Risk Details: THERAPY BUSINESS. 20-30 PATIENTS PER WEEK. INSURED HAS OWN GL POLICY - OCCUPANCY OF IN-HOME BUSINESS IS LESS THEN 50% OF RESIDENCE AREA. NO EMPLOYEES. INSURED DOES NOT OCCUPY ANY OTHER BUSINESS IN ANOTHER LOCATION.; built in 2011, no losses
Reason(s) for Decision: TBE required

Risk Details: 1964 condo with CS temp and burglary alarms. No renovations listed. Primary owner occupied condo. Insured is well known producer. Has two  water losses of >$500k and about $6k.
Reason(s) for Decision: What mitigation measures have been taken? Pending answer. Will remove water if none taken. At least a high water deductible is otherwise warranted. Asking for larger amounts of loss assessment, id theft and eq breakdown. Be sure to note we are not a market for the fine art and they should do stand alone policies for those.

Risk Details: Two prior losses. One Hail (CAT) claim of $35k (2017). Water claim in 1/2018 for failed toilet supply line. Kitchen remodeling in process. $161K in repairs. Home built in 1991 frame. Asphalt roof replaced in 2018. No CSA.
Reason(s) for Decision: As home repairs have begun but not complete, we will decline.  Repairs are now complete.

Risk Details: 2000 frame home on 48 acres of personal land. No farming. No leasing. No animals. Various structures on the 48 acres. FD is mutual aid from 2 departments. Palmyra 4.8 mi; Baldwin 6.1 mi. visible and accessible. Liberty insuring for $7800 w/$5K ded.
Reason(s) for Decision: Verify PC - app says 3. ISO PPC says 9 or 10. Need premium to s/c for longer response time. Confirm why app says "hobby farm".

Risk Details: 1997 home. Occasional rental handled by a realtor who wanted to be listed on the policy as AI.  1/25/14 furnace shut down, pipes froze and broke. $295,000 damage.
Reason(s) for Decision: Ensure all damage repaired and furnace replaced or repaired/in working order. 4 years ago-didn't feel additional mitigation would be needed. Realtor can't be listed - no insurable interest.

Risk Details: Attached is a primary home property located in AZ. Home was built in 2005- no losses; issue in 2007 (accident) but none since then. Retired NFL player
Reason(s) for Decision: Adverse info found (including recent lawsuit due to issues at his home and recent foreclosure)

Risk Details: Agent wondering if we write B&B.
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised we don't have a program for them, but if there was enough demand we could look at something for future risks.  If only 3-4 rooms rented out, we could do this X-liability. Total Business Excl not a good application when biz is in the home since Cov A is excluded.

Risk Details: 1965 home updated. Volunteer FD within 2 miles per google.
Reason(s) for Decision: Confirm responding FD. 15 min or less ok.

Risk Details: Home with prior fire loss. 6/28/18 $223K gutted and repaired. Closed and repairs complete. Lloyds is nonrenewing. Fire Marshal report shows accidental. Agt will require CSFB and fire extinguisher.
Reason(s) for Decision: Gut and rebuilt home like new. Accidental fire. Excellent ins score.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: John reviewed the fire marshal report and we agree, cause is accidental. Called/emailed Zach agt 4/25/19 for Ins score. It is 5 star B.

Risk Details: 2007 frame home, no alarms, in brush. Has woodstove used as secondary heat. Unknown when last cleaned. 15 min resp. dirt roads. 3-4 miles away
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved subject to no dirt road washout issue, must clean woodstove now and annually.

Risk Details: 2001 home w/open liability claim. 5/17/19 handyman found deceased on insured's property. No details on what happened. We previously approved this risk w/no liability but it was never written with us. (Insd has BMX and go cart track on property.)  Insp indicates not just that exposure, but unfenced pool and in ground trampoline.
Reason(s) for Decision: Can't take on a risk with an open liab and we don't know cause of death. Also advised there are more exposures than we knew and we are concerned w/exorbitant defense costs.

Risk Details: Insured has a dog with a prior bite and open liability claim.  They are keeping the dog.  Agent quoting with animal liability exclusion.
Agent reports that insured says they are the "owner/builder". However, they have hired a contractor to manage the construction project.  He is pulling permits and hiring subs. Isn't this a GC.
Reason(s) for Decision: Verify if there is anything in the contract between insd and the contractor that relieves the contractor of responsibility for subs and subrogation.  If not, we should be okay.

Risk Details: 1930 home bought as is. Condition fine, but insured doesn't know if there are breakers, fuses or k&t. Plans to close paying cash, get in there with GC and gut/reno.
Reason(s) for Decision: Suggested to find out how quickly he will get in there. If it will sit, it's a concern. Don't run utilities and equip off wiring until it is assessed. If any fuses or k&t, gut quickly. Alison will investigate.

Risk Details: Insured has a partially furnished home that after reno is complete will be their secondary. No alarms. Nice neighborhood on Malibu beach. $150,000 Cov C requested.
Reason(s) for Decision: Our rule is $50K binding authority w/o alarm-submit higher amounts. Since in nice hood on beach, approved subject to the $150K being larger items. Nothing small that could easily be carried off.

Risk Details: Insured purchasing duplex, will be owner-occupied in 6 months as there are currently renters from prior owner. Agt proposing H03 with tenant-occupied rates; will not include owner occupied forms until owners actually move in
Reason(s) for Decision: Discussed with Jeff, agreed OK with agt proposal. Obtaining tenant-occupied rate for entire year, will be owner occupied for 50% of term.

Risk Details: Leslie was looking at the Homeowners criteria which limits to 2 units.
Reason(s) for Decision: Provided a copy of the Dwelling criteria which allows 4 units.

Risk Details: 2016 vacant model w/$100K personal property.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved subject to confirmation of security. Kept locked, managed tours, alarm.

Risk Details: Insured renovating 1939 home (has a 1997 roof). Will be vacant 3-4 months while insured works out building plans. Then will gut and rebuild. This is from Alex's best agent.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approve subj to vacancy form added (created a new form w/compliance). Write at current value until gutted, then increase to completed value. MFRC and water damage ded being applied by agent.

Risk Details: 1905 home updated w/ this renovation. Insured is a financial investor. MFRC being added. Frame duplex. Per agent, the builder had a COC that expired 10/8. Agent has been unable to place. Cosmetic paint, tile, flooring left. Agt will s/c 5% and get signed no loss.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved with a 20% s/c on minimum prem=$960. Received LLC info and insd is not affiliated w/builder.

Risk Details: 1895 risk, fully updated but not gutted. Online pics look okay - average. Agent asking for RC.
Reason(s) for Decision: Don't feel that caliber of risk qualifies for RC.

Risk Details: EIFS home built in 1996. Frame. Fire department actually within 1 mile (report says 4.5 Miles).
Reason(s) for Decision: Must confirm drainage for EIFS or we decline risk. Home is close to FD. No losses. Inspection shows no concerns.

Risk Details: Insured will be occupying home during renovation. Agent wants okay to add coverages a homeowner needs.
2011 home almost 3 miles from gulf. Insd is retired NHL player now developmental coach for Columbus Blue Jackets.
Reason(s) for Decision: FL is currently restricted for wildfire. Active wildfires near Naples. Not too high profile - we can write when restr are lifted.

Risk Details: 4 family dwelling, 1 unit occupied by owner along with a rented cottage. Agent asking to insure as homeowners 5 family. Usually this would go commercial.
Reason(s) for Decision: Reviewed w/Jeff. We like the risk, nice house. Unit 5 is separate, it's 2 structures. Along with that, one of the units is owner occupied. Agreed to write with 3% surcharge on the technical rate for 4 family.

Risk Details: 1908 home  updated in 2000. Online photos look okay. Insured had oil tank removed and it leaked some oil. SF denied loss. Insured funding clean up.
Reason(s) for Decision: Subj to long list of items - see email. Need to ensure work is being done professionally. Excluding liab and mold until proof of cleanup is received. Figure if they don't do it right, we don't have any liability. // Per followup, cleanup not even assessed yet - declined.//6/9/17 - clean soil test, now 3 family. Approved.

Risk Details: 2007 masonry home w/tile roof.  Fenced pool.  Agent verifying she entered things correctly as she doesn't quote FL that often. Verified attached docs and verified deductible in guidelines. Location is inland FL.
Reason(s) for Decision: Meets criteria

Risk Details: 2000 built main dwelling (log veneer) and two small cabins purchased by LLC for use as secondary residences. LLC consists of "a few guys" per Allison. No liability requested since they lease some of the land to farmers. (They were nrn'd by Firemans Fund because of this.)
Reason(s) for Decision: Emailed list of additional questions. Jeff wants us to run a FireLine. Trying to get access.

Risk Details: 1940 condo with full updates.3 prior losses 1/2014 water leak from unit above $7,077. 2/20/18 water pipe burst $381,072. 12/28/18 water pipe burst $0 paid. Insured is completely replacing pipes. Repairs not complete-60% repaired.  Insured is high profile movie actor.  AOP $5K ded; Water dmg $10K ded.
Reason(s) for Decision: Declining due to open water claim.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Considered whether we might consider when repairs are done. Several strikes here. L ins score, high profile would be x-liab. We'd need conf ALL pipes were repaired. Still the issue of neighboring units (which DID happen) in this old building. Eve though dmg was from another unit, this insured's insurance responded.

Risk Details: 2006 home. Prior dog bite and insured is keeping the dog. Agent wants to quote with Animal Liability and remove the prior bite history exclusion.
Reason(s) for Decision: We can write with Limited Animal Liability but cannot remove the prior bite exclusion.

Risk Details: 1998 home. Online photos look great. Theft at prior location - do we surcharge? App incomplete.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved subject to details indicating insured had no fault in the theft, then no s/c applies. Also need application completed w/acceptable info and answers.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Fault was out of a locked garage. Ok'd.

Risk Details: Brush exposed home with 12 minute response time (minimum - volunteer). Frame home with stucco siding. Propane heat, built in 2009 with above ground pool.
Reason(s) for Decision: Due to TIV, brush and response time, I passed on this one.

Risk Details: 2000 home with no fence around pool. Hilton Head.  Has heavy shrubs. Photos provided.
Reason(s) for Decision: Get answers to missing questions on app. Advised of a form in error. We allow exceptions to pool excl on Hilton Head w/heavy shrubs. Some HOA's do not allow fences (aesthetics).

Risk Details: 1925 home with major reno in 2005. CS alarms. 3 prior losses 1/19 wind blew neighbor's dead tree on insd home $3353, 6/18 sewer backup $9256, 1/18 frozen pipe $37315.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved subj to, but told Barbara we should probably resolve questions before offering terms (although rate only is okay).  Ensure repairs completed. Agt addressed w/$10K water damage ded, no sewer backup, no mold. Need conf that reno included plumb/elec to feel comfortable with RC/ERC. That would indicate probably gut. (This work was prior to their purchase.)  Need to clarify roof situation. May need to be excluded due to age. // 4/12 Barbara advised they got terms without ACV roof.

Risk Details: not in a brush zone, but it's across the street (100ft away) from medium/high brush. PC provided on app shows 4, ran FireLine and PC and it's coming back as a PPC10.
Reason(s) for Decision: prefer something closer to a fire station. App indicates 3 miles. UPDATE: agt responded and indicated the PC is in fact 10. 5 miles to fire station. FireLine shows moderate slope, no access problems. Last fire in that area was in 2007 and 1996 (1/4 mile from Calabasas fire). will approve with a brush surcharge.

Risk Details: 2013 $600+K fire loss. During rebuild, pipes were stolen in 2015. Then agent said insured couldn't get ins for 5 years after a fire.  Home now rebuilt. Online photos look good.
Reason(s) for Decision: No loss statement, fire marshal report, discuss pricing w/Lisa.

Risk Details: New build. We currently wrote the outbuilding on this property as a stand alone since 2017. Secondary home. Agent quoted rater +10%.
Reason(s) for Decision: .50 rate. Typical range .60-.90 but this was an existing customer and this is a new range for Allison.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Some chaos this week with a RUSH Stockton audit that backed up referrals.  Turnaround may have been impacted.

Risk Details: 1984 dwelling w/ prior $100K+ fire loss to Paradise home. Moved to new location. Photos show barn, fence, garden, grapevines. No RM. No OHQ. No updates listed.
Reason(s) for Decision: Did not apply loss s/c since CAT loss. Asked for confirmation about animals, crops. Roof exclusion due to no updates. OHQ needed. No RM provided, but eligible either way.

Risk Details:
Primary frame home built in 1960. They have Also, the livestock they plan on keeping at this farm is a follow: 
Mini Horses (x2) - not for pony rides, Rabbits (x2), Goats (x2), Mini Pigs (x2), Alpacas (x2), Chickens (x12), Peafowl (x2). Allow for limited tours for families and children, using the home grown vegetables to allow visitors to feed.
Reason(s) for Decision: Due to the nature of the business and the potential liability (even with our exclusions) we would have exorbitant defense costs that make this inadmissible to the program

Risk Details: response time 17 minutes, PC questionnaire attached-there are two wells, hydrant, and other water sources on property, central alarm only
Reason(s) for Decision: approve, subj to confirming that if they do bring horses are personal use only (per photos/descript online there are stalls on prop). Suggesting 5% surcharge if can still remain competitive

Risk Details: 1870 home gutted/remodeled in 1980's. Unfenced pool with natural landscape barrier on 4.5 acre parcel.  Agt quoted w/FRC, applied 10% credit.
Reason(s) for Decision: Age ok w/full gut. Recommend ERC inspection. FRC okay. RC would have been okay, so agreed w/10% credit. (Agt has 20% discretionary). Pool excl applies unless inspection shows otherwise (must resubmit to Markel). I saw business owners on app, googled address and found possible biz on prem. Agt to verify and advise.

Risk Details: 1994 frame home on 10 acres, gated. Not accessible year round per Burns. Some dirt roads. 16 miles to FD.
Reason(s) for Decision: We require roads to be accessible year round and no more than 15-20 minute response time.

Risk Details: Home on 70 acres. One small 2016 water damage claim. Insd has 4 donkeys and 10 goats. All personal, no business, no breeding, hobby only. Unfenced pond okay.
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked for claim detail for file. Review pricing for possible surcharge. Asked for other structure info - review condition and limited hay.

Risk Details: 1978 home w/some updates. Full alarms. In brush, no RiskMeter attached. 15-16 min response time by paid and volunteer FD. Ran FireLine - High 12.
Reason(s) for Decision: Borderline response time. High brush per FireLine.

Risk Details: 1940 home w/updates. Very nice online photos. 2 water damage losses in 3 years. $9K and $12K. Agt quoted w/2 loss surcharge and $7500 ded for $3000 rate. Losses unrelated and do not show lack of maintenance. Plumbing was updated. One loss is bath pipes, one is dishwasher. Agent asking for pricing relief.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved w/13% credit which is about what they would get if we removed one loss. Feel we didn't "require" the excl, would have taken the risk. They are helping us. Looks like a nice risk overall.

Risk Details: 1977 home updated in 2010 w/2012 metal roof update. New purchase. 10 other structures including carports, guest houses, bathrooms, storage barn, equip canopy, greenhouse.
history of water losses, including large back up claim earlier this year. Want back-up coverage
Reason(s) for Decision: Water dmg exclusion

Risk Details: 1995 home with 3 prior losses. Bathtub overflow - open. Unknown amount. $10K ded suggested. Also ice dam $37K in 2015. Theft-items stolen from car in garage $5304.
Reason(s) for Decision: Need to know extent of bathtub claim and what is left to repair. Also what is expected payout to determine if $10k ded is enough. // $25K is appx loss, only floor tile left. Approved with $10K ded and no backup or mold coverage.

Risk Details: 2015 home. 2 prior losses. 1/18 wind dmg to roof w/water damage $5600. 7/18 water pipe broke. $3267
Reason(s) for Decision: Subj to $5000 deductible. Both losses this year. 2015 home, pipe breaks not common. Flat roof. No covg/ded required for 2015, but with a loss, $5K ded will help mitigate future loss.

Risk Details: NR due to prior loss-$456,000 water claim in 2015 (insured out of town), completely gutted and rebuilt, no issues since then, home office that has GL policy (no customers), including surcharge for loss
Reason(s) for Decision: subj to $10K water deductible

Risk Details: 2000 home with 4 prior water losses. 6/18 $0 slab leak, 6/18 $3K water heater leak, 10/16 $0 slab leak, 4/14 $12K pipe leak in wall
Reason(s) for Decision: Declined for loss history. >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Insurance score shows concern of cc bad debt, judgement $12K and low scores, 604, 646

Risk Details: 3 CAT claims, over 2400 brush zone, questioning if need to surcharge
Reason(s) for Decision: requested more info about losses (Which fires, what damaged, etc) due to frequency

Risk Details: Risk is located on barrier island in NJ. Nice modular that is being remodeled inside. Online photo looks good.
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked for AAL questionnaire and submission of app, etc.  If rate comes out okay, we could write this. 1958 per AAL; Markel rate 2990.

Risk Details: trying to match $1000 premium from Encompass (Pulling out of NC), 2 claims on primary home
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised with claim surcharges and TIV would need to bring in more premium to consider, ran insurance scores and both very high. Agreed to give 25% off quoted premium so OK at $2200

Risk Details: Open claim from Camp Fire. The only damages that have been noticed so far are smoke damages. Insured was having company come out to confirm if there are any other damages. No repair has yet been started. UPDATE 1/9/19: hull came back indicating the repairs have now been made and are complete, no damage to insulation or interior of property. Asking if we can reconsider
Reason(s) for Decision: Declined due to open claim. Extent of damages has not even been confirmed yet, repairs have not been started. UPDATE 1/9/19: Discussed with Jeff 1/9/2019 - Had this risk been in any other area, we would be able to consider. However, given that it is in Paradise there are many other ongoing concerns - market value of homes, building moratoriums, etc. As such, we will not be accepting risks in Paradise.

Risk Details: Working on renewal and wondering about loss notice from January. Homeowner withdrew the claim in March. 1951 Frame home. Water deductible at $5k
Reason(s) for Decision: Already have bigger water deductible. OK with the risk.

Risk Details: 1979 dwelling w/roof update. Cosmetic renovation in addition to adding 14 pier rods to foundation. Nice home per online. Using contractor. Per form.
Reason(s) for Decision: Contractor liab in place

Risk Details:
• Cov A $615K/TIV $1.1M
• 2009 PC10

Reason(s) for Decision: Due to the number of farm animals they own, they are not eligible for liability coverage. As such, terms may be offered x-liability.

Risk Details: 2004 home, recent victim of Camp Fire. Claim is for loss of use as they couldn’t get to their home during evacuation. Being cancelled from current carrier due to insolvency. Risk is PC4, appears to be in brush.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved subject to confirmation that the open claim is loss of use only, and no damage to the property is present. If any damage, will want to re-refer for review.

Risk Details: Log home,  photos online at https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/4710-San-Juan-Vista-Rd-Placerville-CO-81430/124652354_zpid/.  This will be a new purchase for the insured.  The home is a little off the grid, but is accessible year round and the roads are maintained all winter.  However, the insured’s only plan to use the home in the summer months, so they won’t be using the woodstove often.  They will winterize it each winter which they are going to do right after they purchase.  They have solar panels and propane generator for power.  Response time 25-30 minutes
Reason(s) for Decision: Due to response time double guideline requirement, primary wood stove, etc.

Risk Details: 2004 home. Insured has daycare with 6 children. GL of $1M in place.  Little Barnyard Daycare. Insd and one assistant per website. Playground equipment outside per pics.
Reason(s) for Decision: Originally approved (Licensed for 6 children. Online info looks good.  TBE and GL required.) But then they sent the OHQ. 9.1 miles and 16 minute drive time. Volunteer FD makes this about 20 min response. Not eligible.

Risk Details: 1952 adobe home, average condition per photos. Interior renovations complete. Some exterior adobe repairs being done by contractor brother who is living there. Some chickens - no concern. 3 mi to FD.
Reason(s) for Decision: Discussed w/Rodney - seems concern from fire, wind, etc is low. Asked for details of renovation and extent of adobe "damage". Asked if frame w/adobe, solid adobe, or reinforced. Add cosmetic roof for metal roof str. 12/6 discussed w/Jeff. He is okay w/adobe w/10% surcharge for construction. Add cosmetic roof.

Risk Details: 100 year old shotgun style home recently renovated and 2 story addition added. System replaced, appears to be an gut/reno.
Reason(s) for Decision: Nice condition, reviewed appraisal

Risk Details: 2015 construction. Not completed. Zurich will not renew. Agent wants a 1 1/2 month policy. This is standard business. Advised we won't take on tail end construction that we won't retain, even with 3 month fully earned. Advised best bet go back to Zurich.
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised we could do it subject to 1 year fully earned premium, forcing them to stay with us for 1 year.

Risk Details: 1995 home. Ran A+ no losses. Discussed w/Jeff and we are okay if the risk is nice allowing this exception of $50K mold limit. Used CA rates - $500 for the coverage.
PC 9, built in 2001, frame, seasonal, with a 10-15 minute response time. home used for business retreats and meetings
Reason(s) for Decision: You have approval to offer terms on this risk. However, due to the use of the property for business meetings and retreats, the total business exclusion must be included on the policy. Additionally, please be sure they have a GL policy in place that provides coverage when using this property for business dealings.

Risk Details: 1953 dwelling that will be demolished completely with the exception of 1 wall.  Agent wants to know if that counts as demolition.
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised the moral and morale hazards apply since there is really no value to the dwelling.

Risk Details: 1926 home w/partial updates. New purchase will be renovated (extent not determined). MIL will live in part of house and other part will be rented.  Ho-3 or DP-3?
Reason(s) for Decision: DP3 since it's MIL and tenants. HO4's for all as needed. MFRC and plumb/heat/elec inspection since partial update.

Risk Details: 1920 dwelling updated in 00-12 with 2 rental dwellings on the same property. Agt is excluding for PD but extending liab from the policy for $150 addl prem.
COC, updating wiring in home (1945 build), but not in attached garage that has knob & tube wiring
Reason(s) for Decision: No plans to update, advise if have plans to do so w/in 30 days can reconsider

Risk Details: 1962 dwelling w/partial updates. PC9 per agent, but risk is listed as 13 miles from FD. Referred to Danielle. Woodstove quest ok - not in use. 49 acres. Online photos look okay. Flat roof per pics and app says built up. $5K ded.
Reason(s) for Decision: Verifying PC and response time. Conflicts with what I found online.. Update: Per agent, meant "3" not 13 miles. So FD appears correct. Also stated roads are paved and drive will be plowed as required. . Approved subject to accessibility OK. Burdine
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: May need to discuss this one with Danielle when info is clarified.

Risk Details: Malibu risk (restricted zip) 1952 dwelling all updated recently. Ran fireline - high 8. Not in brush but surrounded by brush so agt applied 20% s/c.
Reason(s) for Decision: We have been approving non-brush risks in this zip. Fireline is good.

Risk Details: PC10 with 20 min response, but automatic aid in place w/ FD w/8min response. Concrete wall home w/ glass roof.
Reason(s) for Decision: IM to Jeff. EM to agent - how does the risk fit w/ISO's auto aid criteria? Discussed. Decided if ISO recognized, PC would be lower. Safe bet is to decline.

Risk Details: Malibu risk, no brush
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved to quote.

Risk Details: primary home located in OK. Home was built in 2006, roof was fully updated in 2017. PC2. lady who owns a high value house who was recently divorced. Her ex husband called her agency and intimidated the CSR into adding him as a named insured to the policy. He even got them to backdate it to inception.After addition, he started calling in fraudulent liab/and property claims. Most have been closed, but a lot still open. Chubb NR due to claims
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised that given circumstances of tension surrounding property/open claims, not eligible at this time

Risk Details: Sent over as an initial request to see if we would consider. 1963 year built, two losses - 5/2017 theft/vandalism $3200, 7/2019 water flex line burst $19k. No app, just a quote sheet. They applied $5k water ded.
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised we could consider, however, would need all required info for a referral (such as app) in order to make a final decision. Things to question, like age and updates, whether or not water deductible is enough.

Risk Details: 1983 home with updates to all systems and roof in 2018. 2 prior large losses, neither of which appeared to be fault of insured. 2016 loss was due to drunk driver that crashed into the home $172k, 2017 loss was a water loss about $200k - They purchased new home and were doing reno, water was off, pool guy came and turned water on (was not supposed to), plumber came to do work and when started working water came out and flooded home in mater of minutes. Claim is still open due to fact that prior carrier is trying to subrogate. All repairs have been made 100%.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved - losses are not fault of insured and pose no moral/morale hazard concern. Damages have been repaired.

Risk Details: Primary home, TX, professional basketball player with Sacramento Kinds. Requested sister to be listed as an AI (lives in home full-time)
Reason(s) for Decision: requesting clarification on sister-is this a rental for applicant, or sis on deed of home? Pics, exposure Ok. Will confirm liab OK w/LT; confirmed this is a rental for applicant. Approved as DP3. advised sis would need HO4

Risk Details: 1999 home. $135K slab leak 8/16. Pipes have been re-routed. Also 3/18 $3711 broken roof tile claim. Prior cancel/nrn no details.
Reason(s) for Decision: If nrn for claims ok. Otherwise refer back. Since pipes re-routed, no slab leak concern.

Risk Details: 1921 very nice home (per online photos) not in brush. Insured is husband of the late Kate Spade. (App says brother, but I found no mention of a brother named Andres, only a husband.  DOB seems in line.)  No liab requested - they have it through a "family policy"
Reason(s) for Decision: Make sure we know who we are insuring. Ok x-liab. ERC okay.

Risk Details: 2013 home w/ 1 sewer backup and 3 other pipe losses. 2 were builder error per app. All under $3,500.
Reason(s) for Decision: 4 losses on newer home is a concern and also wonder if there are other hidden issues that may cause loss and it's too late to attribute to builder error.

Risk Details: 2007 risk in Sarasota 1 mi from coast coming in with what seems like a low rate. Agent increased rate 50% and wants to know if that is okay.
Reason(s) for Decision: Reviewed with Product Management who sent to Tiger. Odd rate coming in for all. Advised to go ahead with 50% s/c provided we are within range of competition. Thanked Jill for questioning!

Risk Details: 1987 home /w updates, roof in 2002. 3 prior losses: wind $21K 11/16, theft from car $17K 12/16, water dmg $37K 4/18.  Agent applying water damage exclusion. Zip is open for business.  WRS 6.
Reason(s) for Decision: Applying exclusion eliminates exposure from water. $5K ded minimizes other possible losses.  Will s/c for 3 losses. Ins scores are good.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: I ran insurance scores on both - 870, 775

Risk Details: REFERRING DUE TO TIV $1,331,900 PC 10 & NOT ACCESSIBLE YEAR ROUND, 40 ACRES (NO BUSINESS USE, PC10, brick veneer, secondary, c/s alarm, built in 2011, no losses, located in IL
Reason(s) for Decision: Per PCQ, 10 min response time, gravel road to home may be inaccessible if bad weather. Advised OK to release terms with 30% surcharge for possible inaccessibility

Risk Details: 1938 home, updated. Home and airbnb rental gar/loft on same property. Quoted as 2 family to acct for extra premium. Max 26 renters annually; weekly rental required. Primary home, so insured is there.
Reason(s) for Decision: Updated. Primary risk.

Risk Details: 2005 dwelling with 3 water losses (due to wind and faulty window installation). Agt quoted on HO8, wind/hail excl, exist dmg excl. New custom windows going in by 10/30/18.
Reason(s) for Decision: Also exclude mold. Address VMM loss on app $56K. Apply 25% s/c. Addl possible subjectivities on email if we proceed.

Risk Details: 1967 frame dwelling. $250K prior water loss-2nd floor bath pipe break. Total gut & remodel. Usu I would s/c 10% due to size of loss. Since gut/reno, would reduce to 5%. Then saw there is a leak detection system added. Decided against required s/c.
Reason(s) for Decision: S/C if there is room to do it.

Risk Details: tv producer-OK; but online details for home show: short-term rental situation (3-5 days), and use for events (wedding was held there before) and commercial/movie shoots.
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised rather 4+ days minimum; but need clarification on possible commercial uses of property for events and filming. Also FD over 5 miles so checking PC

Risk Details: 1999 risk rated PC9 by retail agent. Leslie caught and changed to 10. In brush. PC Quest shows 4 miles/7 min. Google shows 8.7 miles/17 min. Insd will have llamas, sheep, cattle for grazing. Will also rent 2 RV spaces.
Reason(s) for Decision: Response time >15, in brush.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI:
Addl questions if I have wrong info regarding response time.  We could still have some exposure with the animals if there is any breeding or sales with people coming on the property.  Is there any of this, or is it strictly for grazing?
Could we please get some more information on the plans to rent RV storage space?  Will this allow in and out privileges?  Will they just be parked off season with 1-2 expected visits from the owners?  Is there a separate policy for the building rented out for RV storage?  What else is that structure used for?
What other structures are included in the $310,000?  We would need to exclude any used for the animals if there is breeding or sales.  We may need to exclude the building rented out for RV storage.

Risk Details: 1976 dwelling with various water losses. Quoted with $50K water damage deductible and surcharge about 20% in addition to s/c for the claims.  2/16 slab leak $86K - pipes re-routed. Agt verifying extent. 10/16 pipe leak near tennis court $2435.  2/17 roof leak $181. Assume repairs made-agt verifying.
Reason(s) for Decision: Confirm repairs. Reroute of damaged pipes in slab. $5K premium.

Risk Details: 1990 build,  flooring business on premise. Terms if offered would be subject to a total business exclusion and the outbuilding where the flooring business is housed would be excluded.

Risk Details: 1955 dwelling with full updates. However there are 2 water losses. 5/17 $2K appliance pipe; 8/17 $146K heavy rains, sewage up through floor drains

Risk Details: 1985 dwelling, with complete updates in 2001 and roof in 2009. WRS 33. Applicant is a singer/song-writer/producer.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved terms as quoted. No concern with profile of applicant. Dwelling is updated and in line.

Risk Details: Duplex. Half will be vacation rental, half will be insured's property management business. No owner occupancy (habitational). Agt offering to write on DP3.

Risk Details: James Palmer is a British actor. In one recent TV episode and a few movies. Married in CA. Home pics online look good. No news stories.  Looks like no issue with Liab.

1994 home. Roof updated in 2006. Vacation rental occupied. Home is on Lake Vermilion. Online source shows the sale came with pontoon, fishing boat, canoes, kayaks. 15 min response time reported. Google shows 16 min drive time. Visible, paved, volunteer FD.
Reason(s) for Decision: Subj to confirmation of 15 min response time. If longer, need to re-evaluate terms. Willing to offer X-liab if boats etc. are still there.

Risk Details: Home was built in 2003 of stucco construction, c/s fire alarm only; applicant is professional football player (Currently free agent)
Reason(s) for Decision: Reviewed with LT. Agreed OK to offer w/ liab.

Risk Details: Agent asking to add property management company as AI.
Reason(s) for Decision: Agreed to add them as Additional Interest - providing notification only, no coverage.  Also asked Lisa to verify how much owner occupancy. Sounds like a full time rental.
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: There are a couple of weeks of owner occupancy.  Approved.

Risk Details: 1952 home w/all systems updated. New plumbing pipes in 2014 after HWT flooded home. Burglary in 7/16 $4417. This is an important agent for Alison. Farmers nonrenewed
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised plumbing and water loss are okay. Need info on theft to determine what they did to mitigate or if special terms are needed. 6/20-loss was break in to car at gym

Risk Details: 2007 home in brush. Seasonal pond, mine shaft, 40 acres, tree house. Online photos show good railing and professional looking tree house. 40 acres ok. Seasonal pond ok. Insd offered to fence mine shaft.
Reason(s) for Decision:
• Confirmation of 150' brush clearance
• Regarding the mine shaft:  (1) The insured should fence off any entrances to the mine shaft so they are secure. (2) Insured should add signage indicating "Danger - Do Not Enter" or something to that effect.  (3) Insured should advise tenants the mine shaft is off limits and they are not to enter.  (4) It is recommended the insured consult with their legal counsel about adding language to their tenant lease stating the mine shaft is off limits and they are not responsible for injury.
This is not a feature of the property added by the insured. It is not naturally occurring, but did come with the property. Securing entrances and advising tenants not to use, adding a waiver to the lease should protect the insured.

Risk Details: 1976 updated in 04 $500k liab and PI. In brush area.
Reason(s) for Decision: No adverse information. Not a widely known/popular actress.

Risk Details: prior fire loss, think it may have been electrical but loss undetermined. Parents owned home at time, but now deceased. Home repaired, now vacant, up for sale
Reason(s) for Decision: with claim surcharge

Risk Details: built in 2000 of frame construction.  PC10, 6 minute response time, with full c/s alarms. They have an open dog bit claim 11/11/16; reserve amount is $10,000. Insured was hiking with dog and dog was scared by other hiker that came around a bend and nibbled the ankle of the other hiker.

Risk Details: 1984 8400 SF garage used by father/son as personal workshop. Radiant thermostatically controlled heat. Locked, entry gate. Adequate water from FD. 5 miles away. Risk Details: 2016 home rebuilt after 2015 non-suspicious total fire. Subsequent hose break under sink 7/18 $104K paid.

Risk Details: Insured moved to new home. Prior location was burglarized and torched when they were in Mexico. $500K jewelry, pens, Rolex and 2 expensive cars stolen. Risk not in brush. Police report provided.

MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Ins score is 775 and no concerns. Insd prior business has no adverse info. No adverse info on the insd.

Risk Details: 2001 home not in brush. Had a prior WC claim. That employee is no longer with the insured. WC is insured on a separate policy (as Lex prev required). We would be offering $500K prem liab only.

MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: 2 losses w/same claimant. Doesn't appear to be any insured negligence. Also found out there is a prior water loss.

Risk Details: 1955-updated in 2005 frame. Brush
Reason(s) for Decision: Rented for minimum of 2 nights

Risk Details: Attached is a primary home located in IL. Home was built in 1975 with roof update 2008, heating update 2008, PC 10; D score

Risk Details: Newly rebuilt dwelling - prior $1.2M fire loss.  Fire dept report provided indicates cause is undetermined. Suspected it is electrical.

Risk Details: 2004 home alarmed. 18 min response time per app. Mapquest shows shorter response. Gate which FD has access to. App shows loss in dispute - checking.  Online shows Stotsenberg Consulting, Mr's CPA firm at this address - checking.  RM in brush.  FireLine High 8. Med to Heavy fuels. Mod slope, no access probs.

1979 year built with no updates. Tile roof, but agent added roof exclusion. No losses. Insured lives in home as primary but renting the downstairs out (long term rental). Referred because it is in Monroe County, wanting to make sure they can offer terms with excluding wind
Reason(s) for Decision: Per Burns' guidelines, Monroe county is eligible as long as wind is excluded. There was no other reason for referral. Approved as is since wind was excluded.

Risk Details: 1935 frame home with monitored burglar alarm. One large water loss on 12/26/2017 for $124k. While repairs begetting done, burglary occurred. Burns recommending $25k water damage deductible. Asking plumbing types remaining to be confirmed (no lead, galvanized or cast iron)
Reason(s) for Decision: Asking for plumbing types to be confirmed. Home looks good. Attach absolute mold. If any questionable plumbing left then attach water exclusion.

Risk Details: Agent submitted thinking they had $1M authority. Advised they have $2M. Reviewed risk. It is okay, but 15% under Lloyds. (2772 vs. us:2379 w/mold)

Risk Details: 1984 risk "seasonal w/rental" leased to Blue Sky Ranch and also used as AirBnB 2 night minimum. Renters can use boat and kayaks and bring pets.

Risk Details: 1983 home (need update info) was residence, now VRBO w/2 night min. Guidelines currently state 3.

Risk Details: 2013 year built. Two losses - 7/2017 theft $6665 and 11/2017 water damage $131000. Water loss was hot water heater that burst upstairs. Risk Details: 1965 home w/partial updates. Updated roof.  Insd is a psychologist. Sees 15 clients/week in home office. Has GL in place. TBE quoted. Wife is psy.d. also but travels.

Risk Details: Risk has had minor damage from 2 wildfires in 2016 and 2017. In extremely low brush (RM) and Negligible-0 (FireLine). Renovated in 2017. Incomplete app.

Complete app. Considering since both fire reports show very low exposure. Reviewed w/Louisa. Low payout. Brush exposure negligible. We are getting extra 10% surcharge plus the 2 loss surcharges. Agreed to terms with increase ded from $2500 to $5000.

Risk Details: Insured charged w/perjury (and more) in 2006. Many news articles. 1989 home w/ no losses. This is not held against the insured, but FYI, the insured's brother tried to take out a hit on the judge in the case and burn down a jurors home.
1999 home in brush. Oth str is a detached garage w/an apartment used by visitors and as a "man cave".
Reason(s) for Decision: This referral prompted me to search the overall referral log to find that Burns has submitted 4 risks for "Oth Str >35%".  All oth structures have been acceptable.  I proposed an authority increase to Jeff and he agreed to change to "Oth Str >100%".  Guideline changes coming soon.

Risk Details: $1850 water claim 4+ years ago, $128K water claim about 3 years ago. Plumbing pipes completely replaced. Agt charged for loss and added 10%. $10K water damage ded

Risk Details: Rental property, agent wants 100K contents. 2 prior theft losses. Now has alarm

Risk Details: Grandson of Gregory Peck and son of Cheryl Tiegs (actors)

Risk Details: Home will be raised, addition removed, interior rebuilt. Not moving to another location. Contractor is insured.

Risk Details: 2006 home with Barn, detached garage w/apt, car port, $60K 36 panel solar system. 6 acres, 6 horses - both personal use. Agt offering x-liability. In brush.
Reason(s) for Decision:
You are approved to release terms subject to:
• Confirmation there is no rental in the apartment.  (If there is rental, we can probably approve and appropriate forms can be added. Just let me know.)
• I'm approving with no liability (x-liability).  However, if you want to make a case for it, I can reconsider.  Our guideline is 5 and they have 6.  If exposure is low and no concern about current or future breeding, boarding, riding lessons, or horse sales, we could consider.  To determine exposure, it would be helpful to know:
o How many people in the household
o Do friends/neighbors/other family members ride
o Frequency of riding
o Is there a fenced area on the property where the horses are kept
o Any large amounts of hay stored in buildings
o Any 4H or horse shows?  If there are, how often are the horses taken off the property?  
o Do they expect the number of horses to change?
MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Provided acceptable responses to questions. Gave Ok for liab. K.Burdine

Risk Details: 1928 build, LLC for tax purposes, company cancellation due to claims. 08/27/2018 open water loss, home was vacant, not checked on, so damages extensive. Now, insured lives nearby and check home frequently. Current pay out is $501,000. Still open
Reason(s) for Decision: to avoid risks that have an open claim--particularly an open water claim. Water claims can be quite extensive, and it is common for hidden damages and other issues to be revealed after repairs are well under-way. As such, we do need to wait until the claim is actually closed. Once the claim is closed, and the repairs are complete, we could consider as it sounds that they have put appropriate mitigation measures in place.

Risk Details: 1908 year built. Partial updates to wiring, plumbing, heating in 2003 and 2008. Agent asked if $10k water deductible or exclusion should be applied. Also asked what to do with roof since it appears portion of it is flat.

With the roof, it does appear sections are flat, and on RCE it says built-up tar and gravel is part of the roof covering which is used typically only for flat roofs. As such, applying the $5,000 roof and ensuing water deductible should apply also, and a completed OHQ.

Risk Details: FireLine High 12 - Med fuels, steep slope, limited access. RiskMeter Medium.  New build. 20 acres w/private well for sprinkler

Need to confirm acceptable response time and access. Not clear from info provided.  • Unprotected questionnaire
• 20 acres - where is the dwelling situated on the acreage?  Are driveways fully accessible by fire trucks?
• Your email mentions a sprinkler system - is that for outside or inside the home?
• Is there a central station fire alarm?
• App says tenant occupied - just want to confirm there is some seasonal/owner occupied usage.

MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Paid FD 3.3 miles away - 10 min response time.  Situated near center of 20 acres. Appears to have a wide paved drive per engineer plans. Sprinkler system in home. No alarms. Need to confirm there is some owner occupancy. Need short term quest.

Risk Details: Location.  Risk is in Malibu, we have that zip restricted for submission only. Risk was approved last November.

Risk Details: 2007 home. No alarms. NRN due to claim history. Water leak (repaired) and some odd claim: "Neighbor disputing prop lot line". Looks like 2 carriers paid.

MARKEL CONFIDENTIAL Follow up & FYI: Property encroachment claim. 2 carriers were on loss and shared. Letter from Travelers in file. All settled and closed.

Risk Details: 1988 home with wood shake roof in brush area. Med per RM; High per FireLine with med fuel, moderate slope, good access.
Reason(s) for Decision:
Declined due to:  • FireLine is coming back High (6) which is on the lower end of their high rating.  Fuels at the property and surrounding area are listed as medium.  There is a moderate slope, no access problems.  I was hoping to get a lower rating.  
• The home is 1988 with no roof updates.  We can’t be sure of the fire retardant properties of the roof, and it is our understanding that post-manufacture application of fire retardant chemicals are not completely effective.  
• Additionally, we’re looking at over $1M in Cov A, over $2M in TIV.

Risk Details: 2005 year built. Looks like a nice home per the inspection provided. App indicates a liability loss from 2014 in amount of $425,000 and that it was "dropped/closed." No other info provided. App indicates PC5, but inspection indicates no hydrant/water source within 1000 ft. App also says no pool but inspection shows pool.
Reason(s) for Decision: Advised that the home itself appears to be a very good risk, in great condition. No concern with the pool, property is fenced. However, need more info on liability loss in order to review further. Also asked to clarify protection class since inspection shows no hydrant within 1,000 feet. Mentioned updated app will be needed to confirm everything is accurate, such as pool question. UPDATE 4/11/2019: liability loss was applicant arrested for 1st degree murder, 4 grand jurys and 1 prelim hearing before everything was dropped. Used insurance to cover legal ccosts. Declined due to loss history.

Risk Details: 1966 home updated in 2005. No brush exposure. 2013 loss. UW questions not answered. 3 dogs, 4 goats, small aviary, pool, trampoline, zipline. Insd nrn due to zipline. Reason(s) for Decision: See email: Concern with firepit-asked many questions. 10% addl s/c due to above avg liab exposure. Need details on 2013 water loss for file. All UW questions should be okay. Terrier mix dog? Advise insd excluded if a pit bull.

Risk Details: 1956 dwelling gut/update in 2002. Nice online photos. Insured lives across the street. Not in brush. We asked 90265 to be referred case by case.

Risk Details: 1996 home on 26 acres. Very nice photos online. Details about 2 large garages and equestrian facilities.  PC10 - 5 min response, accessible, medium brush.
Reason(s) for Decision: Need info on use of garages and equestrian exposure. Where on 26 acres are the structures and are they fully accessible by FD?  Per Ben, no farming, no animals. Garages used for insured's own car collection. No horses, no equestrian exposure. Home fully accessible.

Risk Details: 1974 home updated in 1999. Wildfire score of 80. Over $3M TIV.
Reason(s) for Decision: Reminded Leslie of new direction. Markel max is $3M PC1-7; $1.5M PC8-10.

Risk Details: 1/2016 $200K pipe burst. Home was vacant at the time. Found when insd checked on it. 1999 home will now be tenant occupied.
Reason(s) for Decision: Additional surcharge for size of loss. (1999 home w/ plumbing loss seems to be a fluke). Also want completed app (uw questions); completed Corp/LLC form.

Risk Details: 1933 home updated in 2002. PC2 with Negligible brush exposure per FireLine. Alarmed. Mr. is attorney-real estate, employment, mergers, acquisitions, trademarks. Challenging fire access area, but FD practices per inspection. Notes in inspection about insured being a writer with an assistant. Will find out details. Need newer inspection - this is from 2013. Sewer backup claim in 2011 $13,000. Old home quest notes all repaired and plumbing fixed.
Reason(s) for Decision: Subject to review of the situation with a writing assistant who works in the home, noted in inspection.  Advise insured of any exclusions for personal property or liability for employees.

Risk Details: Overlooks SF Bay. 1978 home fully updated in 14. Brush medium. FD 4-5 miles/hydrant/PC2.
Reason(s) for Decision: Approved pending 150' brush clearance. Get signed statement of no loss.

Risk Details: 2016 home. Insured looking for a 3 month policy - tail end construction. Agent rated vacant DP3 w/surcharge
Reason(s) for Decision: Not good UW results on tail end constr. We would be taking on over $1M exposure for 3 mos of premium.

Risk Details: Insured has 2 water claims. 2nd was discovered when 1st was being repaired.  Cost=$14. Wonder if we can eliminate surcharge.
Reason(s) for Decision: Asked what the water losses actually were.

Risk Details: 1973 home w/ 3 losses. 2 are window leaks during storms, shown to be an installation issue. 1/16 $23K paid. 1/17 $3K paid. 10/18 $115K paid for fire around the fireplace fire box. Box was defective. Not in brush.
Reason(s) for Decision: High value, 3 installation issues, 1973 home. What comes next?

Risk Details: 1989 home updated w/new plumbing in 2013 after $300K pipe break on 2nd floor. Then in 2016, another pipe break. Agent wants to apply water damage excl. Currently w/CA Fair Plan. Ins score is decent.

Risk Details: 1998 home no updates. Agent wants $25K deductible
Reason(s) for Decision: Ran AAL which showed we need a total premium of $3408 at 2% wind ded. We'd be getting about $4700 w/the $25K ded.

Risk Details: Primary home with large loss. Neighbor's house caught fire and caused large loss for exterior of house.
Reason(s) for Decision: Looks good. Will obtain a builder's risk supplemental prior to binding and a favorable COC inspection.

Risk Details: 1993 home w/updated roof in 2015. 11 min response time per FD. Full alarms. 2 night min with AirBnB-rent a room or whole house. Insd not there. Pool with diving board-agt adding pool exclusion. Animal question not answered on app.

Risk Details: 1994 log home PC10 alarmed, visible, accessible. Response time at least 20-25 mins on a good day. Ran FireLine and it is High 13 w/med fuels, steep, limited access.

Risk Details: Insd is a casting director. No adverse information. 1912 dwelling fully updated in 2014. 22 miles from Woolsey per map tool. App notes a detached dwelling on same property $236,000. Cov B $149,000.

Risk Details: builders risk with a living roof. Vegetation not planted directly on the roof, but on planters elevated above.

Risk Details: New build started in 2/2017; will be completed 12/2017.65% done. Roof, floor, cabinets, paint left.

Risk Details: Insured rents to brother and occasionally visits. Brother has HO4. Agent wants to write on HO3 w/ low contents, no loss of use, premises only coverage.
Reason(s) for Decision: Agreed as a family member is typically a good exposure. By insured definition, family members are included as insureds. Nice home. Brother has been there over a year.

Risk Details: 1965 home updated in 98. 100% copper. Agt originally quoted with 10% s/c. Now they found a loss. $20K toilet overflow (2nd floor). Has alarms, $5K water dmg ded.

Risk Details: Home is vacant and for sale. Has been with Lexington. 1 year old inspection - do they need to reinspect? Beverly Hills home

Risk Details: 1970's home retrofitted. 4 years ago, construction at a nearby park involved sandblasting. Apparently vibrations caused major issues at home as well as covering home in sand/dirt. Risk Details: New construction with large prior loss. 2/17 painter rags combusted $685K loss. 12/16 freezing pipes $16K. Agent getting info on loss, who is contractor, subro?

Risk Details: Insured started construction 1 year ago overseen by a licensed contractor. Expects completion in early 2017.

Risk Details: 2015 home written 1 year with E&S carrier, 7 month extension. Still has 3 months to go.  Finish work is left. No brush. Alarms are unknown.

Risk Details: 1995 home under renovation. Has been with Lex for 1 year. Renewal is pricing at $7600; we are $1000 less. Agent is shopping. Expect 6 months more. Risk Details: Quoted last year. No changes. 1992 w/full alarms. 8 min response. No losses.

Risk Details: 1992 in brush

Risk Details: 2008 frame home. PC9 - FD is 5 miles away; 10-15 min response; accessible; visible.

Risk Details: Insured has a prior total loss due to lightning - house burned to the ground. $1.1M loss. Occurred 7/18/15. They are just now rebuilding. Home was only a few years old. Rebuilding from ground up. $1.5M cov A.

Risk Details: Unique situation - home is being renovated while it is tenant occupied. Agent confirmed this is the case. She was going to credit due to occupancy (vacant rate) but we decided since rate is pretty good, we would not apply a credit.

Risk Details: 1985 frame home. In brush. 85 acres. 7 minute response time from FD 3 miles away.

Risk Details: Referred to us due to the flat roof. 2017 year built, very nice home. Two sections of the roof are flat, where it is finished almost like a deck where people can walk on it. Risk Details: 1969 dwelling not in brush, no update info. Nice online pics. Extensive horse buildings and fencing. Boarding up to 8 horses with 2 addl horses owned by the insured. AirBnb of 2 units, and 1 full time rental in addn to seasonal use.

Risk Details: Secondary home, no losses, PC 9, rater attached
Reason(s) for Decision: acceptable PCQ, subject to: Properties greater than $2M TIV are required to have a central station fire and central station burglar alarm.  A full house sprinkler is acceptable in lieu of a fire alarm.  If no central station fire alarm or sprinkler, increase AOP deductible to a minimum of $10,000.  If no central station burglar alarm, increase theft deductible to a minimum of $10,000.

Risk Details: Malibu home-low brush

Risk Details: Insured has large water damage claim and prior hail loss.  Info submitted does not match app. Sent back numerous questions. May consider if details make sense. Need rater correct, add 10% addl prem and large water ded.
Reason(s) for Decision:
• The app says a pipe broke, your message says ice dam claim.  Please clarify?
• When did the loss occur?
• If it is a pipe, please provide full details of what happened, where the pipe was, why it amounted to so much, what plumbing repairs have been done throughout the rest of the house.
• Could we please have more information on the plumbing leak detector that was installed. Brand name? How does it work?
• What is the current status of demolition and/or repair of the interior?  
• Are there any areas remaining in the interior that were damaged by water or has everything been torn out?
• Has any mold testing been done?
• There is no surcharge for losses on the rater?  Per the app, there are 2.

Risk Details: accidental fire by owners boyfriend (Owner passed away in fire), home now in name of fire. Caretaker at property several times a week. No alarms.
Reason(s) for Decision: The build year of this property is 1960, so we would need to review an Older Home Questionnaire. It was noted that they have a burglar alarm, but at this TIV (over $2M) we require a central station fire and central station burglar alarm.  A full house sprinkler is acceptable in lieu of a fire alarm.  If no central station fire alarm or sprinkler, the AOP deductible must be a minimum of $10,000.  If no central station burglar alarm, theft deductible must be increased to a minimum of $10,000. Also advised of max TIV
